Jessica N. B. is a 23-year-old mother who sells natural medicines and cosmetics with her business partner. Though Jessica is not the owner of the business, she hopes to one day open her own business selling natural medicinal products.

In order to purchase medicines, Jessica travels roughly six hours, one way, to the capital city, San Jose. The cosmetics she sells from a catalogue by visiting potential clients in her community and offering them various items. Jessica will use this loan to purchase medicinal and cosmetic products to sell in her community. Some of her most popular items are natural products which facilitate weight loss.

Jessica´s aspires to finish her degree in Business Administration. She mentions the fact that the business is not her own as a limitation she must deal with.

loans.use: To make improvements to her taxi

loans.name: Laure

texts.fr: A. Laure est née en 1975 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, et vit depuis 30 ans au quartier Finagnon à Cotonou.  Laure est célibataire et mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et tous à sa charge.  Laure vit seule avec ses enfants.  Elle n’a fait que l’école primaire.  Pour assure les charges de la famille, Laure vend des produits divers (pâtes alimentaires, huile végétale, conserves de tomate, lait, petits pois, mayonnaise, etc.) à son domicile.  Parallèlement à cette activité, Laure vend également des produits pour cheveux dans sa boutique. Laure a cinq ans d’expérience dans ce domaine et s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.  Elle sollicite son premier crédit de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients.
texts.en:
A. Laure was born in 1975 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, and has been living in the Finagnon district in Cotonou for thirty years.  She is unmarried and the mother of two children who are both in school and in her care.  She lives alone with her children.  Laure attended primary school only.  To cover family expenses, she sells a variety of goods (pasta, vegetable oil, canned tomatoes, milk, peas, mayonnaise, etc.) out of her home.  Along with this business, she also sells hair products in her shop.  She has five years of experience in this domain and gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  Laure is requesting her first ALIDé loan for bolstering her business and for responding better to the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying various goods

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, a 40-year-old married mother of four children ranging in age from 7 to 17, all students, has been farming since she was 18. She has a farm near Kitale, in Kenya's Rift Valley, where she cultivates a mixed crop and runs a dairy and poultry operation, selling her milk and eggs locally.

Grace is requesting this first loan for Kes. 20,000 through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase chickens in order to expand her poultry farming. She says that with the extra income from this business she hopes to help pay for her children's education. In the future, Grace would like to acquire a bigger plot and increase her dairy production.

loans.use: To expand her poultry business.

loans.name: Adora's Group

texts.en:
Adora B. is from the village of Bocator Tangub City. She is 22 years old. Adora is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Adora is married. Adora owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells daily use products such as sugar, salt, sardines, shampoo, soap & toothpaste. Adora has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Adora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Adora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Adora is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Adora from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga V. G. is a 30-year-old mother who lives with her family in Tierra Blanca, Costa Rica. She is currently seven months pregnant with her second child.

Olga is an experienced client: this will be her 4th loan with Fundación Mujer. The loan consultant that has been working with her over the years describes her as a professional, goal oriented, hardworking woman who has displayed exemplary client behavior regarding punctual repayments in the past.

Olga has a nurse’s license and a master’s degree. Years ago, she decided to put her nursing career on hold and opened a store in order to have more time to spend with her daughter. Olga’s business is based in Tierra Blanca where she sells women’s undergarments, cosmetics and jewelry. Olga works in the afternoons and has the mornings to attend to her other responsibilities.

In the past, Olga has used her loans to invest in her business, to purchase clothing, and to improve her services to her clients. However, the current loan will be used to pay her debt to the Professional Nurses Association so that she can retain the right to work as a nurse in Costa Rica.

Olga’s goals are to increase her client base, make more sales, and expand her business. She is dedicated to working hard, whether as a nurse or at her business, in order to ensure a quality standard of living for her children. An obstacle Olga faces is a recent decrease in sales levels. She says she needs to seek out new clients. Also, with the baby coming, life is sure to become a lot more exciting and challenging.

loans.use: To pay membership fees of the Professional Nurses Association

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey C. is 53 years old and is a villager who lives in Kandal Kaoh Touch village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field where she cultivates ginger and garlic. In this farming, Mrs. Srey C. faces a problem because she does not have enough money to support her farming. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy ginger seed and garlic seed, and the rest of the loan she will use to buy a water machine to support her farming crops. Her husband, Mr. Phornsy Meach, is a construction worker who earns a small salary to support his family. This couple has a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy ginger seed and garlic seed and buy a water machine to support her farming crops.

loans.name: Santos Eliodoro

texts.es: Santos Eliodoro V. M. de 43 años de edad, se dedica a la elaboración de cómales hechos de barro, los cuales son un utensilio de cocina el cual se utiliza para cocinar tortillas o pupusas en toda la región de Centro  América y México. Aunque en la actualidad no son tan utilizados para cocinar, su comercio es muy bueno, ya que las personas los utilizan como adornos ornamentales para los hogares, colocándolos en lugares como jardines y cocinas, así mismo se dan como regalos, lo que permite que se vendan como artesanías. Santos posee 16 años de comercializar cómales, en Guatajiaga, ubicado en el departamento de Morazán, lugar en el cual también habita junto a toda su familia la cual esta conformada por su esposa y cuatro hijos, los cuales se dedican a ayudar a Santos tanto a elaborarlos como a comercializarlos. Este negocio ha sido heredado de familia, ya que todos se han dedicado a la elaboración de los cómales, lo que los hace unos expertos en fabricarlos. Santos solicita un préstamo a Integral a través del cual, compre mayor cantidad de barro para elaborar más cómales y de esta manera vender más.
texts.en:
Santos Eliodoro V. M. is 43 years old. He makes clay comales, which are used to cook tortillas or pupusas, a thick corn tortilla, throughout Central America and Mexico. Although nowadays they aren't used so much for cooking, his business is very good. People use them for decoration in their homes, placing them in gardens and kitchens. They are also given as gifts, which allows for them to be sold as handicrafts. Santos has been selling comales for 16 years in Guatajiaga, located in the department of Morazán. He also lives there with his whole family made up of his wife and four children. They help Santos make and sell the comales. This business has been passed down to him through the family, since all of them have made comales and they are experts in producing them. Santos is asking Integral for a loan to buy a greater quantity of clay to make more comales and thus sell more.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clay

loans.name: Nhim

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhim T. is 41 years old. She is a villager who lives in Preal village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Kimhoeun Ses, is a cake and fruit seller who can earn a small income to support the family. 

Mrs. Nhim T. now is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide; to pay for a laborer to plow her farm; and to buy cake supplies and more fruit to support her husband's business. 

This couple has seven children; two are laborers, two are students in the local school, and the other three are between the ages of 2 and 7. Mrs. Nhim T.'s husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for a laborer to plow her farm

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
Nely es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Nelly hace 1 año tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Nely los días domingos vende mondongo en su misma casa, antes de que naciera su hijo que tiene 1 mes vendía cebiche todos los días, actividad que dejo de realizar por su hijo. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite.
Nely es socia del Banco Comunal Diamantes y lo que mas le gusta es el incentivo al ahorro.
Nely sueña con mejorar su casa, darle un acabado y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nelly, 32, lives with her life partner and their two children. A year ago she set up a grocery store in her home where she sells assorted groceries and vegetables daily. In addition, on Sundays she sells mondongo [a hearty traditional soup of Latin America and the Caribbean. It is made from slow-cooked diced tripe (the cleaned stomach of a cow). Vegetables such as bell peppers, onions, carrots, cabbage, celery, tomatoes, cilantro, garlic or root vegetables are added] from home. Before her son, who is a month old, was born she sold cebiche (marinated fish) every day but she stopped this activity due to her son. She will use the funds to buy rice, sugar, milk and cooking oil. Nely is a member of the Diamantes (Diamonds) communal bank and what she likes most is the savings incentives. Nely dreams with making some home improvements, to complete its finishing touches and with providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nahima Isvelia

texts.es: Nahima Isvelia tiene 19 años, su actividad es la venta de electrodomésticos y cafetín. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, pues fue su Papa quien le enseño a ser comerciante y para que aprendiera a manejar el negocio, y al mismo tiempo que se independizara para que le sirviera en un futuro. Pues siempre le ha gustado hablar con sus clientes y proporcionarles lo que ellos le solicitan. El deseo de ella es tener su propia tienda de electrodomésticos y ofrecerlo a sus clientes. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima y así comprar abanicos, planchas, televisores, entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Nahima is 19 years old. For work, she sells appliances and runs a cafe. She has had this business for 5 years. Her father taught her how to be a merchant and how to manage the business, so that she would be able to do so independently and benefit from it in the future. Nahima has always enjoyed talking with her clients and providing them with what they request. She hopes to one day have her own appliance store to offer to her customers. She is requesting the loan to purchase raw materials and to buy fans, irons and television sets, among other items.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en: Chhorn C. is 34 years old and along with her husband, sells pork in the Takeo province. Her business has been around for about two years and she makes US$5 every day. She has four children; three are in school and one works at a garment factory. Chhorn C. would like to invest more in her butcher shop. She sees this investment as an opportunity to be able to increase her daily income.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to sell.

loans.name: Nguyễn
loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Rosalina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Rosalina tiene la edad de 25 años, es una joven con mucha energía al trabajo, un negocio que inicio hace cuatro años, con el objetivo de ayudar a sus padres.
Vende cosméticos, ropa, carteras, ropa interior, perfumenes, prenda de plata. El cual inicio con  dinero propio ya que trabajaba en servicios domésticos.
Su objetivo era cambiar de trabajo y lograr mejores condiciones personales.
Se afilia a la Avon, comenzando con poco, es por eso busca alternativas para lograr mejor inversión. Afodenic ha sido quien ha dado el apoyo mediante el crédito.
Comprara: ropa, prendas de plata, ropa interior para dama y caballeros, para seguir sastifaciendo al cliente con sus variedades de productos.
texts.en:
Rosalina is a young woman who is 25 years of age and demonstrates tremendous energy in her work. She started a business four years ago in order to help her parents.

Rosalina sells cosmetics, clothing, handbags, undergarments, perfumes, and silver jewelry. She began using her own money that she earned providing housekeeping services. Her goal was to change jobs so that she could improve her personal living conditions. She started working with Avon because she is always looking for alternatives to improve her investments. AFODENIC is supporting her by providing her with a loan. She will buy clothing, silver jewelry, and undergarments for women and men so that she can continue satisfying her customers with a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, silver jewelry, and undergarments

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Esta cliente es madre de familia de dos  niños  y estos se en encuentra en edad escolar.
El préstamo solicitado es para cubrir los gastos médicos de su mama ya que esta se encuentra en ferma.
Ella dice que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel han sido para el mejoramiento de su casa.
texts.en:
This client is the mother of two school-aged children. The loan requested is to cover the medical expenses of her mother since she is sick. She says that thanks to the loans granted by CEPRODEL, she has been able to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses for her mother.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne M. K. is 28 years old and married. Her husband is a casual laborer and they have three children aged between 9 and 13 whom they hope to educate to the university level. 

Her business is located in Mwingi but served by the Thika Branch. Thika is the region in Kenya known for the production of pineapples. She has been selling goats to the local people for the last 10 years. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is getting food for the goats during the dry season and actually, some goats die during this period. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more goats to meet her customers' demand. She sees herself selling goats wholesale in Mwingi and other towns in Kenya. She describes herself as hardworking, courageous and social.

loans.use: To buy more goats

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
"Charles V. is a 61-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a business venture, buying and selling peanuts (salted and Sugar coated).  She lives in Vista Alegre , Tap-ok, Brgy. Enclaro, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1992 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard buying and selling peanuts (salted and Sugar coated), she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. 

Charles is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she could  purchase a transport vehicle . This will be her 20th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Charles aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 
 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Purchase transport vehicle

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
Carmelina G. is 60 years old and married. She supports her family by operating two business ventures:  Fishing and Farming businesses. She lives in Luyong Baybay, Brgy. Tacup, San Remegio, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts, by working hard in her  fishing and farming businesses.  She is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,500. 

Carmelina is now borrowing PHP 14,500 so that she can purchase fishing gear and other equipment. This will be her 5th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Carmelina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Oyunjargal

texts.en:
Oyunjargal T. is a 28-year-old single woman who lives with her grandmother in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. She operates a women's clothing retail business from a stall at a local clothing market. Oyunjargal started her clothing business in 2000 with the help of her sister. After finding success and achieving stable business operations, she expanded her product line to include children's and women's clothing items, and rented an additional stall. In 2005, her sister moved to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, and now they operate their businesses individually. Since 2009, she has been renting a stall in the local trade center, where she sells a variety of women's clothing items and her wide selection of products attracts many customers.

Oyunjargal is a diligent and hardworking person, and she is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more winter clothing items for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more winter clothing items.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 37-year-old woman, married to Harrison Muya. She has two businesses: selling shoes and jackets is her primary business and she has a grocery store as a secondary business. She has been in these businesses for 10 years and earns 6,000 Kenyan shillings per month. She normally supplies nearby hotels with vegetables from her green grocery business, but also has a space in the market where she sells shoes and jackets.

Agnes has applied for a loan which she intends to use to increase her stock of tomatoes and jackets. She hopes to run a more stable business and increase her stock so that she can supply big hotels in Nairobi.

loans.use: To increase stock for a grocery store

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 40 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el sector Fundo El Gañán del caserío Punto Nueve, una localidad agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Lambayeque, a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El cuenta con animales  menores como pavos, gallinas, cerdos y ovejas, los cuales cría en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar su  localidad con frecuencia. Adicionalmente se dedica a trabajar como jornalero.

Santos siempre se esfuerza al máximo para sacar adelante a su familia. Por ello trata de desarrollar sus actividades económicas de la mejor manera posible. Actualmente desea ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta con la compra de animales menores y alimento balanceado, de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas durante la presente temporada navideña, que es cuando la demanda aumenta. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar  Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Santos is 40 years old, married, and lives with his family in the Fundo El Gañánarea of the Punto Nuevo country house, an agricultural place located on the Lambayeque district, half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

He farms small animals such as turkeys, chickens, pigs, and sheep in his backyard. Once they mature he sells them to the public and other sellers who come frequently. He is also a day laborer.

Santos always works his hardest to help out his family. To do so he does his best in his economic work. At the moment he wants to expand his farming business with more small animals and a balanced feed. He wants to increase his sales during the Christmas season when demand increases. To achieve this he found it convenient to request Edpyme Alternative a 1000 Peruvian Soles loan.

loans.use: To buy small animals and a balanced feed to expand his farming business and increase his sales during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Noe Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr Noe de 42 habita en la  colonia san Pablo, soltero actualmente estudiante de la carrera tecnico superior en ciencias agrarias, ademas labora en la unidad de produccion de sus padres, los que le han dado el derecho de poder desarrollarse realizando actividades agricolas y pecuarias y tambien de mejorar las condiciones tecnicas de la misma, su principal fuente de ingreso es la producción de leche que le genera su inventario ganadero y la produccion de maiz y frijoles en tiempo de cosech.

Requiere de este financiamiento para realizar establecimiento de pasto en la  finca de sus padres y asi poder tener condiciones para menejar la alimentación de su hato ganadero.

espera ser beneficiaddo con el FONDO KIVA, para hacer realidad su sueño y poder vivir  en mejores condiciones, ya que como todo ser humano tiene mejores aspiraciones.
texts.en:
Sr. Noe is single, 42 years old and lives in the district of San Pablo. He is studying agrarian sciences at a great technical school. Also, he works in his parent's production unit. They have given him the privilege to be able to develop his skills through his work with agriculture and livestock. His main source of income is milk production from his cows and corn and beans during the harvest. 

He needs this loan to make a space on his parents' farm for his cows to graze and therefore to be able to have conditions that improve the diet of his herd of cows. 

He hopes to be a beneficiary of FONDO KIVA (Kiva Fund) in order to make his dream a reality and to be able to live in better conditions, as every human being has aspirations of improving their life.

loans.use: To set up an area on his farm for his cattle to graze.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 27 years old and married with a child. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a dream of building a permanent house in the next five years. 

He has worked in motorcycle transport for four years now and this has enabled him to meet his daily family expenses. His dream is to buy a motorcycle as he is currently just an employee. Francis needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: Buying a motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of chickens to fatten and resell.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy V. is from the village of Bacnor West. She is 47 years old. Joy is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Joy runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Joy has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Joy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Joy is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the third loan taken out by Joy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is 35 years old, married with three children.  He has a matatu (van) transport business, which he has been running for 11 years.  He has three employees helping him with the business.  Through Faulu Kenya, Benard has gained business management skills which have helped him to improve his business.  He dreams of owning a transport company in the future.  He has requested for 40,000 Kes to repair and paint his vehicle.

loans.use: To repair and paint his van

loans.name: Nathmeyya

texts.en:
Nathmeyya and her family run an events rentA. shop. The family rents out chairs of all kinds needed for big events, weddings and parties. Nathmeyya is the mother of two daughters and three sons. One of the sons works in the family business, while the rest are either too young to help or work part time in the shop.

Nathmeyya took out a loan from FATEN to purchase more chairs to rent for severA. occasions in order to serve more people and increase their returns. Nathmeyya is a religious woman, as are most of Gaza Strip citizens; therefore, her son is photographed instead.

loans.use: To purchase chairs that are used in parties and weddings

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es: Marcial, tiene 32 años, natural del distrito de Santa Rosa departamento de Ayacucho, convive con Luisa de 32 años de edad, ambos tienen 04 hijos, quienes son la felicidad de su hogar y viven en su propia casa en la comunidad de Pataccocha anexo del distrito de Santa Rosa. Marcial, es un hombre de mucho provecho, se dedica con mucho esmero a la labor que realiza. Su trabajo es labrar la tierra, es campesino y cuenta con 04 hectáreas de terreno donde cultiva cacao, barbasco y hojas de coca. Hace 10 años que trabaja en esta actividad, por lo que ahora es conocedor del agro; y en tiempos de cosecha busca el apoyo de los jornaleros para que le apoyen en las extracciones de los frutos. Sus plantas más rentables son: los granos de cacao y las hojas de coca, por lo cual las empresas acopiadoras le remuneran muy bien por cada kilogramo. El problema de su trabajo radica en no poder combatir con los insectos quienes se encargan de dañar los frutos de las plantas. El crédito solicitado es para la adquisición de más plantones de cacao para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar nuevas tierras para expandir sus sembríos y aumentar su producción. Este es  su primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesto a hacerlo. Se siente muy agradecido con la institución por concederle el crédito solicitado. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados comprará plantas de cacao para poder injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo.
texts.en: Marcial, 32, is a native of the Santa Rosa district of the department of Ayacucho.  He lives with Luisa, 32, and their 4 children, who are the joy of their home.  They live in their own home in the community of Pataccocha, an annex of the Santa Rosa district.  Marcial is a resourceful man who puts a lot of care into the work that he does.  He works in agriculture, and has 4 hectares of land where he cultivates cocoa, barbasco (a plant used to make a natural temporary poison used in fishing), and coca leaves.  He has been doing this kind of work for 10 years, and so now is very knowledgeable about farming.  During the harvest season, he hires worker to help him with the harvest.  His most profitable products are the coffee beans and the coca leaves, because the wholesale firms that buy the products pay him well for each kilogram.  The problem with his work is that he must fight against the insects that damage the fruits of his plants.  The loan requested is to acquire more cocoa seedlings to plant, so that he can get the most fruit out of his plants in less time.  But now, his priority is to buy new land so that he can expand his cultivations and increase his production.  This is his first loan with MFP, and he knows that he has the responsibility to make all of his payments on time and he is ready to do this.  He feels very grateful to the institution for granting him the loan that he requested.  With the 3,000 Peruvian soles requested he will buy cocoa seedlings to plant, so that he can get the most fruit from his plants in less time.

loans.use: to buy cocoa plants

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando C., age 34, earns a living by offering tricycle transportation services. He has been engaged in his business for over a year now and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. He and his wife have seven children and live in the village of San Lorenzo Ruiz, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. 

Earlier this year, Rolando joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. He hoped to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Rolando is requesting his first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other essential motorcycle accessories

loans.name: Kenny Carolina

texts.es: Kenny Carolina O. M.  de treinta años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y su hija en San Martin en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella posee una tienda hace un poco mas de dos años en su misma casa de residencia,  tiene mucha clientela pues siempre tiene lo que necesitan sus clientes a un buen precio. Kenny está llena de vida y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y siempre está a disposición de las personas que la visitan, su lema es cliente feliz: seguro regresa; esto la ha impulsado a solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar productos con que no cuenta o mas solicitados para su tienda, como aceite, papel higiénico, azúcar, granos básicos, sal entre otros; de esta manera mantendrá a su clientela, atraerá a nueva, crecerá su negocio y al mismo tiempo logrará apoyar de esta forma a su compañero de vida Oscar quien trabaja como albañil
texts.en:
Kenny Carolina O. M. is 30 years old.  She lives with her life partner and daughter in San Martin, in San Salvador department.

Kenny has owned a store for a little over two years.  It is located in her home.  She has a lot of customers as she always has what her customers need at a good price.  Kenny is full of life and has a great desire to get ahead.  She is always ready to help her customers.  Her motto is "happy customers will definitely come back".  For this reason, Kenny is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy products which she either doesn't have in her store right now or which are very much in demand such as oil, toilet paper, sugar, basic grains, salt, etc.  In this way, she will keep her existing customers, attract new customers, grow her business and manage to support her life partner Oscar who is a construction worker.

loans.use: to buy oil, toilet paper, sugar, basic grains and salt

loans.name: Isabel Maria

texts.es:
Isabel de 56 años, una mujer inspiradora en sacar adelante a su familia por eso decidió abrir su local de comida para así ayudar a su esposo que no tenia empleo.

Ella labora diariamente con la ayuda de su esposo. Ella hace la preparación de las comidas y el las vende en el pequeño local que tiene. Le afecta en su negocio la delincuencia por que su sector cada vez esta peligroso. Con el préstamo quiere comprar cocinas industrial y la comprar de alimentos para la preparación de la comida y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Isabel, age 56, is an inspirational woman when it comes to getting her family ahead.  She decided to open a food business to help her husband, who was not employed.

She works every day with her husband’s help.  She does the food preparation, and he sells it at the small place that she has.

Delinquency affects her business because it is dangerous in her area.

She wants to use the loan to buy industrial kitchenware and ingredients for food preparation.  That way she will increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy industrial Kitchenware and food.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, tiene 52 años de edad, nació en el departamento de León, esta casada, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería, es madre de 4 hijos, pero vive con sus nietos a los cuales ella los cuida. Inicio la venta de productos alimenticios por medio de una vecina que tenia una pulpería, pero después su vecina decidió quitar la pulpería y se la cedió a doña Mercedes así fue ella empezando a vender ,la mercadería se la daba al crédito y poco a poco fue ella pagando su productos .Ella tenían experiencia en venta , ya que desde los 7 años comenzó a vender en las calles ,solía vender tamarindo(fruto) ,artesanías ,después se dedico a vender frutas ,buñuelos, tamales hasta hoy en día que se dedica a atender una pulpería que con esfuerzos propios ha venido manteniendo. Lo único que lamenta es no haber podido estudiar pues las escuelas quedaban muy lejos era muy difícil para ella  y sus padres ponerla a estudiar solo logro llegar hasta cuarto grado de primaria.
Solicito el préstamo para comprar mercadería tales como granos básicos, aceite, jabón, productos de limpieza, para abastecer de nuevos y mejores productos su pulpería, ella espera que con esta nueva inversión pueda atraer más clientes, mejorar las ventas, incrementar sus ingresos. 
Con esta inversión ella espera lograr una de sus mas grandes y anhelados sueños componer su casita, hacerle mejoras su pulpería, pues donde ella vive los materiales de que esta hecha su casa es de cartón , plástico, zinc .Su meta próxima es comprar materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 52 years old and was born in the department of León.  She is married, works as a merchant, owns a general store and has 4 children, but lives with grandkids that she cares for.  She started selling food products through a neighbor who had a store.  Later, her neighbor decided to leave the business and passed it on to Mercedes.  That is how she started selling merchandise, buying on credit and paying for her products little by little.  She had experience in sales, having started selling as a street merchant at 7 years of age.  She tended to sell tamarinds (fruit) and handicrafts.  She later dedicated herself to selling fruits, fritters and tamales up until today, when she dedicates herself to her store and has maintained it through her own efforts.  Her only regret is not having been able to get an education, as the schools were very far and it was difficult for her parents to allow her to study.  She only managed to complete school up to the fourth grade.

She requested this loan to buy merchandise such as basic grains, oil, soap, and cleaning products to supply her store with new and improved products.  She hopes that, with this investment, she will be able to attract new customers, improve sales, and augment her income.

With this investment, she hopes to achieve one of her greatest wishes which is to outfit her little house and make improvements to her store since, where she lives, the materials these are made out of are cardboard, plastic, and zinc.  Her next goal is to buy construction materials.

loans.use: buy merchandise such as basic grains, oil, soap, and cleaning products to supply her store with new and improved products.

loans.name: Elmer Edgar

texts.es:
Elmer es un cliente de  30 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa e hijo en la zona rural del distrito de Jayanca – Lambayeque. Las actividades principales de esta comunidad son la agricultura y ganadería.

Elmer se dedica a la agricultura desde hace más de 5 años, él cuenta con terreno agrícola donde cosecha maíz que luego comercializa a clientela ya establecida, quienes son principalmente pobladores de su zona.
 
Elmer es un hombre muy trabajador pues sabe que su esfuerzo beneficia a su familia. Él tiene muchos deseos de darle lo mejor a su hijo y de mejorar su calidad de vida.

Elmer solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que invertirá en mejorar su cultivo de maíz, comprando los abonos y fertilizantes adecuados y también para el deshierbo de este. Esto le permitirá obtener ganancias (producto de su cosecha)  e ir creciendo económicamente. 

Elmer estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele el crédito, pues le ayudaría a aumentar sus ganancias para darle mayores comodidades a su familia.
texts.en:
Elmer is 30 years old and lives with his wife and son in the rural area of Jayanca district, Lambayeque.  The main business activities in this community are farming and livestock raising.

Elmer has been farming for more than five years.  He has a plot of farmland where he grows corn which he then sells to established customers who are mainly residents of his area.

Elmer is a very hard-working man as he knows that his efforts benefit his family.  He has a great desire to provide his son with the very best and to improve his quality of life.

Elmer is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will invest this money in improving his corn crop, buying appropriate manures and fertilizers and weeding his land.  This will enable him to make profits (from his harvest) and continue growing financially.  Elmer is very grateful for this loan as it will help him to increase his profits which will enable him to provide his family with more comforts.

loans.use: to buy manures and fertilizers for his crops and to weed his land

loans.name: El Carmen Group

texts.es: El Banco D. Emprendimiento el Carmen  esta compuesto por la siguiente mesa directiva: la presidenta del grupo  es la señora  María,  se dedica a la venta D.  víveres entrega a crédito   y también alquila sillas y mesas, para todo tipo D. acontecimientos se dedica a esta actividad hace tres años y la venta D. víveres desD. hace 7 años, su familia esta compuesta por dos  hijos  pequeños a quienes cuida sola ya que tiene que trabajar y cuidar a su hijos. El monto que solicito es para la compra  D. víveres para continuar con su venta  y sillas para poder alquilar ya que cada día aumenta sus pedidos para alquilar para los acontecimientos, es una persona muy dinámica agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
The "El Carmen" Communal Bank is lead by the following board of directors: María is the President of the group. She sells provisions on credit and delivers them. She also rents out chairs and tables for all types of events. She has been in this business for three years and has sold provisions for 7 years. In her family she has two young children. She supports them on her own and has both to work and take care of them. 

The loan that she requested is for the purchase of provisions to continue her sales. She will also buy more chairs because every day her orders increase for event rentals. María is a very dynamic woman and is grateful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to purchase provisions and chairs.

loans.name: 50.thieu Nguyen. Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dam works in agriculture farming food. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Dam is 66 years old and she is married. She has 4 children. Dam is the group leader of the 50. Thieu N. solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2003, Dam joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Dam has successfully repaid a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Dam has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She needs more capital to improve her business.

With her business profit, Dam hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: To purchase breeding animal and fertilizer.

loans.name: Elida Albertina

texts.es: Elida Albertina de 51 años de edad, reside con su hija de 21 años en casa propia. Elida es una mujer increíble y ejemplar ya que ha trabajado y sigue trabajando duramente para ayudar un poco con la economía de su hogar y dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Ella posee una pequeña tiendita en donde ofrece diferentes productos de primera necesidad. Los clientes la prefieren por su amabilidad y buen servicio y esto ha hecho que su clientela aumente. Ella es una mujer emprendedora y a pesar de su edad no se da por vencida. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de sus seres queridos y para ello necesita más ingresos  es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL que le permita comprar lo necesario para mantener surtida su tienda con diferentes artículos como: aceite, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, sal, café y de mas artículos para  tener todo lo que el cliente solicita. Con esto espera obtener mayores ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hija.
texts.en:
Elida is 51 years old and resides with her 21-year-old daughter in her own house. Elida is an incredible and exemplary woman who has worked and continues working hard to help her household economy and provide a better quality of life for her family. She has a little store in which she offers different products of primary necessity. 

Her customers prefer her for her amiability and good service, and this has made her clientèle grow. She is an enterprising woman and despite her age, she hasn't grown weary. Her dream is to improve the lives of her loved ones and for that reason, she needs additional income. That's why she decided to request a loan through INTEGRAL that will permit her to buy the necessities to keep her store supplied with different articles: cooking oil, rice, sugar, beans, salt, coffee and all the rest, to have what her customers request.

With this loan, she hopes to obtain greater earnings to improve the quality of life for her and her daughter.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, rice, sugar, beans, salt, coffee, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. She has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for two years. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks. Maricris is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is 29 years old and single.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products to sell in her store.

Carina has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF. She has been running her sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Carina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her store

loans.name: Gualberto

texts.es: El señor Gualberto trabaja en la policía nacional y está destinado en la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para el acabado en obra fina de una habitación. Vive en casa de un familiar  ubicada en la zona Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz; es padre soltero  y tiene dos hijos. Con el crédito anterior pudo acabar otra habitación donde ahora sus hijos viven en mejores condiciones. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Gualberto works for the national police and is stationed in the city of La Paz.  The loan he is requesting will be used to finish a room.  He lives at a relative’s house in the District of Las Lomas in the city of La Paz.  Gualberto is a single father and has two children.  With his previous loan,  he was able to finish another room and now his children live in better conditions.  

This is the second time he has requested a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor in order to finish a room.

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en:
Lovelyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 1 child. 
Lovelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stock for her store.
Lovelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en:
Muhamed is 44 years old, married, and has five children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to construct a bigger permanent house for his family. 

He is a mechanic for motorcycles, motor vehicles and bicycles and has been in this business for 10 years now. His major constraint has been the constant rise in prices for spare parts and his goal is to set up a full fledged garage. 

Muhamed needs the Kiva loan to buy batteries and lubricants.

loans.use: To buy batteries and lubricants.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena  es socia del  Banco Comunal “La Yunguyeñita”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 42   años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos. Estudió hasta la secundaria.
La señora se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, venta de zapatilla, pinzas,  etc, estos lo vende en la ciudad de Arequipa.  Hace más de seis años que trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero  que invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/.  500.00 nuevo soles, incrementará al capital de su negocio y  comprará cincuenta pares de zapatillas y mercadería para la tienda  como  leche, galletas y gaseosas.  La señora trabaja sola en el negocio,  su esposo trabaja en una empresa como miembro de seguridad.
La señora desea que sus hijos sean profesionales y trabajen, por ello se está esforzando.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the “La Yunguyeñita” Communal Bank, which is located in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the department of Puno.  She is 42 years old, and is married with two children.  She attended school up to secondary level.

The Señora works selling groceries, and also sells shoes, tweezers, etc.,  in the city of Arequipa.  She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for more than six years; her first loan was for the sum of 300 New Soles, which she invested in her business.

With this new loan of 500 New Soles, she will increase the capital of her business and buy 50 pairs of shoes as well as merchandise for her store such as milk, cookies and sodas.  The Señora works on her own in the business; her husband works for a company as a security guard.

The Señora wants her children to become professionals and be employed, this is what she is working so hard for.

What she likes about the Communal Bank are the meetings and the loan facility.

loans.use: to buy 50 pairs of shoes as well as merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Enkhtaivan

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhtaiwan is 25 years old, married, and has two young daughters. They live in a Mongolian ger, the nomadic Mongolian traditional tent. He has started his wheel-service business a year ago and it has been running quite successfully since then. He said there is no other similar service nearby and that is advantageous for his business. He wants to expand his business, as every businessman dreams.
 
Now he is requesting a loan to open a new wheel service and hire a worker there. He expects it will be successful and that he will be able to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To open a new wheel service and hire a worker for expanding his business

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married, and has three children. Tarek has owned a food market since 2009, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese, dairy products, and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area, so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a loan of $1,500, in order to make a ceiling for his market and to add more food products. He is aiming to gain more profits so he will be able to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make a ceiling for his market and to add more food products.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 44 years old and is blessed with one child. She lives peacefully in Solana, Cagayan. Her house is near the public market so she grabbed the opportunity to establish a small retail store where she sells food and daily use products to customers in the market. Julita established her business 18 years ago. She encountered some problems in her business, but due to her patience and perseverance, she has continuously generated income by working hard. 

Julita is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, bread, eggs, vinegar, and sugar to sell in her store. She would like to stock more items in her store to satisfy customer demand. Julita wants to expand her sales and profits to make her family economically stable and prepare for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, bread, eggs, vinegar, and sugar to sell in her store

loans.name: Karla Eugenia

texts.es: Karla tiene 33 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de León, ella es comerciante tiene un pulpería en su casa de habitación, madre de dos hijos, casada, su esposo es mecánico trabaja en una zona franca. Ella inicio sus actividades económicas hace tres años lo puso con el dinero de su liquidación de su anterior trabajo, estaba cansada de horarios inestables y agresiones laborales que sufrió así que decidió emprender su propio negocio donde ella es su propio jefe.  Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar productos lácteos, granos básicos, cosméticos, perfumes para aprovechar los meses de noviembre y diciembre que es cuando las ventas incrementan y necesita productos para ofertar. En sus expectativas esta comprar un freezer nuevo que tenga capacidad de almacenar mas productos como lácteos, jugos, gaseosas, pollo, comprar 2 vitrinas para exhibir sus productos y trabajar cada día para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Karla is 33 years old and lives in the city of León. She is a merchant and has a grocery store in her home. She is the mother of two children. She is married and her husband is a mechanic who works in the free zone. 

She began her business activities three years ago putting in the money after quitting a previous job. She was tired of working an unstable schedule and suffered from work problems and so she decided to start her own business where she is her own boss.

She is asking for a loan to buy dairy products, basic grains, cosmetics, and perfumes in order to take advantage of the months of November and December when sales go up and she needs products to offer. 

She anticipates one day buying a new freezer in order to have the capacity to store more products such as dairy products, juices, soft drinks, chicken and to buy two display cases in order to show her products. 

She works every day in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy products such dairy, basic grains, cosmetics and perfumes

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es: Pascual, de 22 años de edad, soltero, el vive en una vivienda alquilada ubicado en la urbanización de valle dorado del distrito de Pichari. Pascual es un joven entusiasta con unas ganas de sobresalir, dejó los estudios por falta de economía, apenas logró culminar la secundaria en un colegio estatal estudiando de noche y de día trabajaba alquilando motos que gracias a ello obtuvo un pequeño capital, derivándolo en la compra de su propio moto taxi de  segunda mano. Actualmente brinda servicio de transporte a todas partes del distrito de Pichari, los horarios de que tiene más trabajo son a parttir de las 7 hasta las 8.30 de la mañana luego a partir de las 12 del medio día hasta la 1.00 de la tarde. Él está satisfecho con lo que hasta la actualidad viene logrando gracias al esfuerzo, y perseverancia en el trabajo que son los que hacen que pascual continúe en esta labor y el compromiso con sus hermanos menores quienes requieren de su apoyo. En un futuro no descarta continuar sus estudios para de esta manera superarse. Este será su primer credito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en llevar su moto al taller mecánico para su mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Pascual, age 22, is single and lives in a rented home in a development of the Valle Dorado in the Pichari district. Pascual is a young, enthusiastic man with a desire to excel. He had to stop studying due to lack of funds; he was just barely able to finish secondary school in a state school. He took night classes while working during the day renting motorcycles, which provided him with a small income. He bought his own second-hand motorcycle. He now offers a transportation service to all parts of the Pichari district. He has the most work from 7:00 am to 8:30 am, and then from noon until 1:00 pm. He is happy, because he is succeeding thanks to his hard work and perseverance. This has helped him to keep going. He is also motivated by his obligation to his younger siblings who need his support. For the future, he hasn't ruled out going back to school in order to get ahead. 
This will be his first loan with MFP, so he promises to repay his quotas punctually. With the 1000 nuevos soles, he will invest in bringing his motorcycle to the mechanic for maintenance.

loans.use: to bring his motorcycle in to the mechanic.

loans.name: Alexandra Maria

texts.es:
Alexandra María tiene 40 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con la mamá en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC. SAN JOSE Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto El Rosario, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Alexandra se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, arroz, fréjol hace 3 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realizan en Ventanas.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en el ciclo corto  para sembrar  maíz y fréjol, cacao, arroz.
El sueño es poder tener una casa propia. En el tiempo libre le gusta leer, escribir, estudiar.

CON LA AYUDA DEL CRÉDITO ANTERIOR ha podico invertir en la agricultura ha sembrado maíz y arroz y con esto ha obtenido ingresos que han mejorado el nivel económico.
texts.en:
Alexandra María is 40 years old. She is single with no children and lives with her mom in Ventanas in Rios province. 

The San Jose Rural Community Bank is in Recinto El Rosario in the district of Ventanas. This bank works with agriculture workers planting corn and rice

Alexandra works in agriculture and has been growing corn, cocoa, rice, and beans for three years. She makes her purchases and sales in Ventanas. She will use the loan to invest in planting corn, beans, cocoa, and rice for the next season. Her dream is to have her own home. In her free time she likes to read, write, and study.

With her previous loan she was able to grow corn and rice and the profits have helped her improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to plant corn, beans, cocoa, and rice

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 43 years old, married and has five children. He does livestock farming to earn his living. John has been farming for over ten years. Through Faulu Kenya, he has opened another outlet of his business in a different location.  

John has requested for 10,900 Kenya shillings to buy a solar lamp for lighting his house because he has no access to electricity and has been using a kerosene lamp.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Ngumbao

texts.en:
Ngumbao is 40-years-old, married and has three children between the ages of 3 to 10. He owns a retail shop and also does farming. He has been in this business for 2 years and has employed one person. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he expanded his retail shop. He hopes to see his retail shop and farm grow in the future. He has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, unga (flour) and a bull.

loans.use: to buy sugar, unga (flour) and a bull.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 11 children. 

Rosalina has a food shop (sari-sari store) that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Rosalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosalina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Majda

texts.en: Majda is a 22 year old woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 500 JOD to buy new furniture for her home. She would like to improve her living conditions in this way for her family. Since Majda is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan. Majda prefers that her photo is not on the internet, the photo is of her husband.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Beautiful Life Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thảo is 45 years old and she is married with 3 children. She has had a retail business selling fish for 10 years. Thảo lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her circumstances are the most difficult of this group. Her family is living in a small tiled house. Thảo's household was recognized by local government as poor. Moreover, this region often suffers the effects of natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. 

Thảo go to sell fish every morning and works for a fish store every afternoon to make an income for 2 of her children to go to school. Thảo need money to buy more fish and supplies, but she has no collateral because can't get loan from other banks or credit institutions.

In 2014, Thảo joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is a reputable person in the community and all members in "Beautiful Life" group agree to vote for her to be the group leader. 

With her business profits, Thảo hopes to maintain a successful business and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to re-sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO PURCHASE FRUITS AND VEGETABLES FOR SALE.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Despite only having an elementary education, Walter A. has a successful farm. He cultivates the lands he grew up on with his parents. He has taken the lead in the farm due to his father's old age. He has been doing well and is seeking investment capital in order to rent machinery to collect his crops and sell them on his own, avoiding having to deal with a middle man. He is single and does not have children, but he is a very hard worker and aspires to have a family in the future.

The Primero de Agosto Communal Bank in Santa Lucia

Walter is part of one of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program: the Primero de Agosto Communal Bank. All bank members are part of the Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia, and they will use these microloans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. As members of a communal bank, they are all guarantors for each other's loans. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Primero de Agosto Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we work with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about the commnity of Santa Lucia, compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The region is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area, as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with the rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them harvest their crop. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not have access to formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also often lack skills and knowledge of how to commercialize their product and get fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them to repay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Gather and sell his crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks of flour and peanut oil

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Mrs. Graciela Velazquez, 32 years old, lives in the Trinidad neighborhood of Asuncion and has two school-aged children, one of whom lives with her and the other with a grandmother. Dona Graciela is a seamstress who works, on her own, making all kinds of garments, exclusively for women. She's been doing this work for 13 years, relying on two old-model sewing machines, both of which need to be replaced. She dreams of opening a shop, something that will involve a big investment and is impossible for her now. Her immediate plan is to purchase a sewing machine and hire a person to help her so that she can work with the best possible chance to get ahead. For that, she’s asking for credit of USD 200 and promises to pay it back monthly.

This business forms part of the group of CME micro-businesses, “Women in Action”. Formed by 20 people who take responsibility for the loan with solidarity.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Graciela Velázquez, de 32 años vive en el barrio Trinidad de Asunción, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, uno de sus hijos vive con ella y el otro con la abuela. Doña Graciela es costurera, se dedica, por cuenta propia, a la confección de prendas de todo tipo, exclusivamente para damas. Realiza esta actividad desde hace 13 años, cuenta con dos máquinas de coser modelos antiguos, las que necesita reponer. Sueña con abrir una boutique, lo que implicará mucha inversión y ahora le resulta imposible. Su proyecto inmediato es adquirir una máquina de coser, contratar un personal para ayudarla y así poder trabajar con mejores posibilidades de progresar. Para ello solicita un crédito de USD 200 y se compromete pagarlo mensualmente.

Este negocio forma parte del grupo de microempresas del CME “Mujeres en Acción”. Formada por 20 personas que responden por el préstamo solidariamente.

loans.use: Compra de una máquina de coser

loans.name: Mataniu

texts.en: Instead of planting taro as most women do, Mataniu prefers to grow taamu (a bigger rootcrop) instead. She is requesting her first loan of $300 and this loan will be spent on supplies for her plantation. She is one of our new members and she is about to supply her products to the market.  Mataniu is a hard-working lady and she is willing to extend her business in the future so that she will earn more. She has only got one son working but she clearly explained that the money she is expecting to get from her business will help to pay for the things she has never been able to do before. She is honest about repaying the loan and she is looking forward to continuing to get loans from SPBD.

loans.use: Buy weed killer and also other chemicals and fertilizers for her plantation

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: I am Naseem B. from Lahore, the second-largest city in Pakistan. I am the mother of an only daughter who studies in grade four. I knit sweaters, and my husband works at a local factory for a small salary. Winter is around the corner, and the demand for woolen sweaters will increase significantly. I need a loan to expand my business and buy wool in bulk. With the increase in profits, I plan to buy another knitting machine and hire a worker.

loans.use: Buy wool in bulk

loans.name: Rehmat

texts.en: I live in Vehari, a small town about 350 km from Lahore, the second largest city of Pakistan, but Vehari is quite accessible by road. I have been living here for the past 12 years in a room and have four children. I want a loan for myself of $200 to purchase a new sewing machine. I make clothes for women in the city and make about three outfits per day and generate an income of over $4 per day. With an increased income I can help make the standard of living of my family better.

loans.use: Buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Azda

texts.en:
This is 23 year-old Azda G. from Mbeya, Tanzania. She is married with one child. In 2002 Azda established a furniture business, and now requires a loan of $200 in order to purchase additional stock. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of furniture.

loans.name: Rosa Ines

texts.es:
The production and sale of tortillas is the business in which Mrs Rosa Ines Juarez has dedicated herself for 25 years in her humble house in the municipality of El Sauce de Leon in Nicaragua. She started her business with small savings that she obtained from her previous business which was washing and ironing clothes by request. It is necessary to emphasize that Mrs. Rosa is a single mother and she faces the necessity of taking care of her little son and a small granddaughter of school age. Her difficult seconomic situation puts her in a place where she works with a lot of strength and desire to better her life. Also it is necessary to emphasize that the business of Mrs. Rosa needs to improve its infrastructure because it does not have a roof she only uses leaves to cover her place and furthermore she needs to acquire firewood and the dough to produce the tortillas. For this reason she went to Ceprodel so that she could benefit from credits that allow her to better her business and in this manner take her son and granddaughter out of the neighborhood they inhabit.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La elaboración y venta de tortillas es el negocio a que se dedica la señora Rosa Inés J. desde hace 25 años en su humilde casa de habitación en el municipio de El Sauce de León en Nicaragua. Su negocio lo inicia con pocos ahorros que los obtuvo por medio de su anterior negocio que era lavado y planchado de ropa a quien se lo solicitara.

Es necesario destacar que la señora Rosa es madre soltera y con la gran necesidad de mantener a un pequeño hijo y una pequeña nieta en edad escolar. Su difícil situación económica da lugar a que trabaje con mucho esfuerzo para mejorar su condición de vida. También es necesario destacar que el negocio de la señora Rosa necesita mejorar la infraestructura por lo que no posee techo sino que utiliza hojas de palera para cubrir su local y además d esto necesita adquirir la leña y la masa para elaborar las tortillas.

Por esta razón es que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos que le permitan mejorar su negocio y de esta manera sacar adelante a sus hijo y pequeña nieta.

loans.use: To purchase corn and wood.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mr. Keo H., 46, has a business milling rice for the local farmers with his rice grinding mill to take the husks off the rice. He also recharges the batteries belonging to people in this community using a generator. In rural areas, people depend on these batteries to power their lights, TV, etc. He earns around $7 a day. His wife works as a teacher and makes on average about $1.60 a day. This couple has five children, one of who works making noodles, earning on average $6 per day. The rest of the children are students. They plan to use this loan of $1100 to purchase a new generator to replace their old, unreliable generator. This will allow them to charge more batteries in the village. Part of the loan will also help finance the purchase of a motor bike.

loans.use: To purchase a new generator to replace their old, unreliable generator.

loans.name: I Made Kara

texts.id:
I Made Kara is a paddy farmer. He works on a land of 1 hectare (around 10,000 square meter). At the moment, I Made Kara's paddy plants are 3 month old. In this period, paddy plants need a lot of maintenance and a lot of good care as they are vulnerable to a lot of plaques. Therefore fertilizer and pesticide are crucial in this period of times. However he is facing a difficulty to find affordable good quality fertilizer and pesticide.

He wants to use the loan money from Dinari to finance his purchase of fertilizer and pesticide. He is optimistic that with a good care of his paddy field he will be able to get maximum result. With this he will be able to improve his family's well beings and to repay the loan on schedule.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Saat ini, usia padi I Made Kara sudah 3 bulan. Pada periode ini, tanaman padi sangat membutuhkan perawatan dan penanganan yang baik karena sangat rentan terhadap penyakit. Dengan perawatan dan penanganan yang tepat, akan sangat menentukan hasil yang didapat saat panen. Untuk hal itu, memerlukan pupuk dan anti hama yang cukup untuk areal sawahnya yang seluas 1 hektar. Kendala yang dihadapinya sekarang adalah sulitnya mencari pupuk dan anti hama dengan harga yang terjangkau. I Made Kara merencanakan pinjaman ke Dinari untuk dapat membeli pupuk dan anti hama sehingga tanaman padinyaa tidak terlambat mendapat penanganan. I Made Kara optimis, dengan perawatan dan penanganan yang baik, ia akan mendapat hasil yang maksimal dari sawahnya. Dengan hasil yang didapat, I Made Kara bisa mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya dan bisa mengembalikan pinjaman tepat waktu.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide (Membeli pupuk dan anti hama)

loans.name: Parromero Group

texts.es:
San Jose Chacaya is a rural community in the high plains of Guatemala. It is difficult to conceive the idea that women that have been so marginalized from the social, economic, and political system of the country have access to a service as modern as credit. In their town they heard about a lady called America that works on a project in which they give fast loans with dependable and low interest. That "lady" is America Chiyal, a loan agent that works for Friendship Bridge. The women that make up the group joined to form the communal bank and once they had formed said unit they contacted America.

The Parromeras contacted the institution because they need a loan to enlarge the amount of capital for their business. Half of the group is going to invest their loan in the breeding and sale of chickens. Some are going to buy chickens already grown to feed for some weeks and then sell. Others are going to buy the chickens already grown to cut up and sell in the market, while others are going to buy the chickens already cut up and plucked to sell in the market. Juana Martinez says that she not only plans to invest her loan in the breeding of chickens, but she also plans to buy piglets to grow fat and then sell in the market, and finally she also embroiders typical blouses. One is surprised by the versatility of many of these women.

The other half of the group is divided into 3 parts. Three women sell vegetables in the market. They will invest their loan in the purchase of carrots, huisquil (a type of squash), cabbage, onions, tomatoes, lettuce, and avocado, among other vegetables. Two women work with a foot loom to make short and long traditional skirts. Usually, only men work in the looms owing to the force required to work the loom.
