The last group works embroidering traditional blouses of their towns.

The dream of the women of Parromero is to grow their business so that they do not have to depend on debt to have a profitable business and so that they can generate sufficient income to invest in their business and to cover the needs of their families. Inside this communal bank there are many women with the drive of Juana Martinez, nevertheless many of these women battle alone. That is why, if we give them a hand, they are going to feel that they are not alone in their fight against poverty.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

San Jose Chacaya es una comunidad retirada en el altiplano de Guatemala. A uno se le haría difícil concebir la idea de que mujeres que han estado tan marginalizadas del sistema político, económico y social del país tengan acceso a un servicio tan moderno como el crédito. Ellas escucharon en su pueblo sobre una “señora” llamada América que trabaja en un proyecto en el cual dan créditos rápidos, con intereses bajos y confiables. Esa “senora” es America Chiyal, una agente de crédito que trabaja para Friendship Bridge. Las mujeres que integran el grupo se juntaron para formar el banco comunal y una vez conformado dicha unidad contactaron a America.

Las Parromeras contactaron la institución porque necesitan un crédito para aumentar el tamaño del capital de su negocio. La mitad del grupo va a invertir su crédito en la crianza y venta de pollos. Algunas van a comprar pollos ya crecidos para alimentarlos por unas semanas y luego venderlos. Otras van a comprar los pollos ya crecidos para destazarlos y venderlos en el mercado, mientras que otras van a comprar los pollos ya destazados y desplumados para venderlos en el mercado. Juana Martinez dice que ella no solo invierte su crédito en la crianza de pollos, sino que ella también a comprado sus cerditos para engordarlos y luego venderlos en el mercado, finalmente ella también borda blusas típicas. Uno se sorprende de la versatilidad de muchas de estas mujeres.

La otra mitad del grupo se divide en tres mujeres que venden verduras en el mercado y que invierten su crédito en la compra de zanahoria, huisquil, repollo, cebollas, tomates, lechuga, aguacate, entre otras verduras. Luego, dos mujeres trabajan en telar de pies. Ellas elaboran cortes, faldas largas tradicionales. Usualmente, solo los hombres trabajan en los telares debido a la fuerza requerida para emplear el telar. Mientras que el resto trabaja bordando blusas tradicionales de sus pueblos.

El sueño de las mujeres Parromero es el de agrandar su negocio para que así no tengan que depender de una deuda para tener un negocio rentable y para que puedan generar las suficientes utilidades para que puedan invertir en su negocio y cubrir las necesidades de sus familias. Dentro de este banco comunal hay muchas mujeres con el empuje de Juana Martinez, sin embargo muchas de estas mujeres se encuentran batallando solas, es por eso que si nosotros les demos un empuje, ellas se van a sentir acompañadas en su lucha contra la pobreza.

loans.use: To buy chickens and piglets for breeding and sale, vegetables for sale and materials for weaving and embroidering traditional blouses and skirts.

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en:
Mrs. Yeng C., 49, and her husband, Mr. Sarim Ros, 50, who live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1978 and have five children, three sons and two daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home; of the remaining four, two sell bananas and two are in school.

Yeng and her husband have been farming since 1979, growing bananas, corn, cucumbers, and other vegetables. In addition, Yeng sells sweets in the village. Now she is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase fertilizers and pesticide for growing corn and cucumbers.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide for growing corn and cucumbers.

loans.name: Hing

texts.en:
Mrs. Hing N., 51, and her husband, Mr. Lo Pang , 72, live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1975 and have eight children: five sons and three daughters. Four of them are married and live outside the family home. 

Mrs. Hing has been a weaver for twenty-five years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Lo grows rice and vegetables.

Hing is requesting a loan of US$900 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Greetings from Martin in Rwanda! Martin is 42 years old, married with three children and two adopted orphans from the Rwandan genocide of 1994. Martin has been a tailor with his workshop for 27 years. He makes different clothes for both women and men in the area. He makes school uniforms for primary children. He has 15 sewing machines and employs 5 people in the workshop. He is training young girls and boys who never had a chance to continue with school to sew for a skill in life. He earns about $250 from the sewing workshop. Besides sewing, Martin has two milking cows, which earn him about $35 from selling the milk to his neighbors. He is requesting a loan worth 504,495 Frws to buy more sewing materials for his workshop.

loans.use: Martin would like to buy more sewing materials for his workshop.

loans.name: Art

texts.en:
Art I., 34, is a former porridge seller. But now she stays at home looking after the children and cooking food for her family members. 

Her husband, Neang Yat, has a business as a motor-taxi driver and on average he makes $2.50 of profit per day. This couple has two children and both of them are too young to attend school. 

Mrs. Art is asking for a loan to restart her business by raising animals.

loans.use: She needs to breed pigs.

loans.name: Bisi

texts.en: Bisi A. sells bags of rice in her shop located at Iyana-Iba market, Lagos state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. Bisi is 45 years old and married with 3 children. Her youngest child is 10 years old and the eldest is 20 years old. With the profit she makes from her business, Bisi supports her husband in taking care of their children. Bisi is enthusiastic and optimistic about the prosperity of her business and that of her family. She needs a loan to buy more bags of rice to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice for sale

loans.name: Zuwena

texts.en:
Zuwena has owned a small business in the Jang'ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She works daily from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM and earns a profit of approximately $100 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more inventory for her shop and increase her profit.

Zuwena is 38 years old and has 4 children, ages 3, 7, 10, and 12.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to expand her business

loans.name: Juana  De La Cruz

texts.es:
La señora Juana de la Cruz García tiene la edad de 41 años, su estado civil es soltera esta señora tiene 2 hijos su hijo mayor tiene la edad de 18 años que cursa recientemente el 5 año de secundaria y su otro hijo de 14 años cursa el 3 año de secundaria, en sus propósitos esta mantener activo su negocio de forma segura y así podrá darle a sus hijos un futuro prometedor por lo que en sus deseos esta que sus hijos logren graduarse y proporcionarles una vivienda donde ellos puedan gozar de plena libertad .



El tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 10 años, su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas, ella inicia este negocio por iniciativa propia por unos parientes que residían en una finca y ella empezó la elaboración de las tortillas en su casa de habitación y las vecinos llegaban a pedirle tortillas por lo que mas tarde decide poner una venta de tortillas y es así como obtiene este negocio, el motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra del maíz, leña ya que la carreta vale 840 y también realiza la compra de maíz por quintal por lo que de esta forma le resulta mas factible  y así podrá generar ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Juana de la Cruz García is 41 years old and single. She has two children. Her older son is 18 years old and is repeating his fifth year of secondary school. Her younger son is 14 years old and in his third year of secondary school. Juana would like to maintain an active, secure business so that she can give her sons a promising future. She hopes that her sons will graduate and wants to provide them with a house that they can freely enjoy. Juana has been making and selling tortillas for 10 years. She started this business buy herself with some relatives who live on a farm. She started making tortillas in her home and neighbors would come by to purchase them. Later she decided to establish her business to sell her tortillas more widely. Juana will use the loan to buy firewood, now that a cart costs 840. She'll also buy corn in 100kg bags because its more feasible, and thereby generate income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bulaga B-Lucy Mpagi Group

texts.en:
After working as a nursery teacher two years ago, Lucy M. saved enough capital to start selling cereals in small quantities in the nearby local markets. She is 34 years old and a single businesswoman. She sells cereals, like soya, millet, rice, and oats. Her business is affected by insufficient funds and, hence, earns her an average of only UGX 20,000 each week. 

Lucy is using her loan to purchase more soya, millet, rice and oats. She gets her stock from the Masaja Mumia food industry in Entebbe.  A polite and humble Lucy also aspires to set up her own food industry some day, from which she will be in position to set up a residential house.

loans.use: Purchase more soya, millet, rice and oats.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic A. B. is married and has four dependents. The highest education he has received is junior high school.  His wife is a seamstress.   

Dominic sells electrical gadgets and parts on Lime Street in Elmina.  He has been engaged in this business since 1993. Dominic uses his income to pay for rent, utility bills and other financial expenses for his family.  Dominic will use the loan to purchase more electrical items to meet the increased demand from his costumers. The new profits earned from his expanded business will be spent developing and building a house on a piece of land that Dominic has acquired.

loans.use: to purchase more electrical items to sell

loans.name: Gonzalo Mercedes

texts.es: El señor Gonzalo Mercedes Martínez tiene 59 años, está casado, y tiene tres hijos quienes todos estudian o trabajan. Gonzalo Mercedes ha trabajado como taller de soldadura hace treinta años, y su propósito para su negocio es mejorar su taller para obtener más espacio para todas sus herramientas. Don Gonzalo necesita este financiamiento por lo que tiene que comprar los materiales para cumplir con los trabajos que tiene pendiente. Sus sueños son de mejorarla calidad de vida de su familia para que no pasen necesidades. El monto que solicita es de C$ 13.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Gonzalo Mercedes Martínez is 59 years old, married, and has three children who either study or are working. Gonzalo Mercedes has worked as a soldering shop for thirty years, and his goal for the business is to make improvements and obtain more space for all of his tools. Gonzalo needs financing because he needs to buy materials to complete still-open work orders. His dream is to improve the quality of life of his family, so they will not be lacking of anything. The amount he requests is 13,000 córdobas at a term of 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Hermanas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Hermanas” está conformado por las hermanas: Virginia G. y Rosalía G., ambas viven en la zona Noroeste de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia con sus respectivas familias. La Sra. Virginia tiene hijos en edad escolar a quienes cuida dedicadamente y vive junto a su esposos quien le tambien trabaja y entre ambos mantienen a su joven familia. Ambas hermanas se dedican a tejido y bordado de chompas, chalinas, y otras prendas de alpaca, trabajo por el cual son muy reconocidas ya que trabajan bastante tiempo en este rubro. Invertirán el crédito en la compra de materia prima. El fino producto que realizan es vendido principalmente a turistas quienes más aprecian su trabajo.
texts.en:
The group “Sisters” includes the sisters Virginia G. and Rosalía G.. Both live in the northwest area of the city of La Paz, Bolivia with their respective families. Mrs. Virginia has school-age children, who she cares for devotedly, and lives with her husband, who also works. Between the two of them, they care for their young family. Both sisters weave and embroider sweaters, scarves, and other alpaca garments. They are well-known because of their work in this field. They will invest the loan by buying raw materials. They sell their final products mostly to tourists who appreciate their work most.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool

loans.name: Najmiddin

texts.ru: Камолов  Наджмиддин проживает в районе Джилликуль. Женат , но детей не имеет. Имеет магазин , где торгует продуктами питания. Опыт в бизнесе уже три года. Для расширения бизнеса планирует получить кредит и увеличить ассортимент товара. Таким образом он привлечет новых клиентов. Погасить кредит планирует ав течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Najmiddin K. lives in the area around Jilikul. He is married, but has no children. He has shop where he sells food. He has three years experience in business. To expand his business, he plans to take out a loan and increase the variety of products he offers. Thus, he will gain new customers. He plans to pay off the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Uyen's Group

texts.en:
Uyên Nguyễn Thị Tố was born in 1978. She has two children, and her husband works as a builder. She buys rice from the market at a low cost and resells it at her house or in her village T. earn money. She will use this loan T. boost her income by buying more rice T. sell T. another village. She has a monthly income of about 2,500,000 VND and wants T. borrow 4,142,000 VND T. purchase more rice. 

She is applying for this loan with two other women:

Chức Nguyễn Thị was born in 1967. She has a monthly income of about 2,000,000 VND and would also like T. borrow 4,142,000 VND T. buy rice T. sell.

Mầu Nguyễn Thị was born in 1961. She wants T. borrow 4,142,000 VND T. buy food for her pigs.

loans.use: To buy rice to sell.

loans.name: Enedina

texts.en: Enedina C. is 47-years old, married to a motorcycle driver and she is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC since March, 2005. She has demonstrated excellent performance in loan repayments. Now, she is applying for a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase hog feed and vitamins. She hopes that someday she can own a traveling boar that will augment their household income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86590&_tpos=15&_tpg=2
Juana es socia del Bancomunal Las Orquídeas
Juana es separada, tiene 51 años su hijo está terminando la universidad.
Juana empezó llevando almuerzo a la universidad D. su hijo y sus amigos le  pidieron que también trajeran para ellos, ella empezó a ofrecer al personal administrativo, han pasado los años y ella lleva 80 menús a la universidad , tuvo que alquilar un cuarto cerca a la universidad, para cocinar, cuenta con dos personas que le ayudan. 
Juana necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles, para la compra D. una parrilla para venta D. anticuchos. 
 DesD. que Juana esta en Finca pudo lograr muchos sueños y adquirir muchas cosas para su casa.
El sueño D. Juana es tener su tienda D. llantas y poner un restaurante.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86590&_tpos=... Juana is a member of the community bank Las Orquídeas (The Orchids). Juana is separated. She is 51 years old. Her son has already finished university. Juana began taking lunch to her son and his friends, who asked her to bring it for them as well. She then began to offer it to the administrative personnel. The years have passed and she has 80 set menus at the university. She has to rent a room close to the university in order to cook, and she has two people who help her. Juana needs a loan of 1200 soles for the purchase of a grill so she can sell kebabs. Since Juana has been with Finca she has been able to achieve her dreams and get many more things for her home. Juana’s dream is to have her store on wheels and to put a restaurant on it.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a grill to make kababs

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria A. is 32 years old, married and has four children. She makes a living selling fresh and smoked fish. Victoria has applied for this loan to buy more fish to sell, and wishes to extend her sincere thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Suma Sartawi Group

texts.es: La Asociación Comunal “Suma Sartawi” tiene aproximadamente 3 años de vida, se encuentra en el Centro Focal “Los Andes”, su presidenta es Judith Agüero, quien indica que la Asociación se conformo con amigas que vivían en la misma zona, alrededor de una escuelita. “Suma Sartawi” esta conformada por 14 integrantes que tienen diferentes negocios como ser: tejido de mantas, venta de ropa, comida, juguetes, repuestos de celulares, zapatos, tienda de barrio y costura de deportivos. Todas manifiestan necesitar el préstamo, para incrementar su capital de trabajo y poder llegar a más mercados.
texts.en:
The Suma Sartawi Community Association has been in existence for approximately three years. The Association is located in the Los Andes Community Center. Their president is Judith Agüero. Judith says that the Association was formed by friends who live in the same zone close to a small school. Suma Sartawi is made up of 14 members who have different businesses like weaving blankets, selling clothes, selling meals, selling toys, replacement parts for cell phones, shoes, neighborhood store, and sewing sportswear. All of them need a loan for working capital to be able to go to more markets.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en: Jane is a 38-year old entrepreneur and mother of two school-aged children.  Jane began her current dressmaking business in 1998.  She specializes in making women’s clothing, such as skirts, dresses, casual and formal tops. The central location of her shop in a busy town, coupled many years of doing good business within the community, has gained her a good reputation and a wide customer base. She intends to acquire an additional stock of dressmaking materials with a portion of the loan for which she has applied.

loans.use: To add to her stock of dressmaking materials

loans.name: Tushikamane Group

texts.en:
Upendo is a member of the Tushikamane borrower group in Kola, Morogoro. She is a 26-year-old woman, married, and the mother of 1 child. Her child is 5 years old. She also cares for 2 other dependents.

Upendo started her own cafe business selling food, 4 years ago. She works 3 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 280,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Upendo’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 350,000 Tsh in order to buy more rice, wheat, etc. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Upendo hopes to save money and expand her business.

Rehema, another member of the Tushikamane borrower group, has also requested 350,000 Tsh in order to support her own cafe business.

loans.use: She will buy more rice, wheat, etc.

loans.name: Ismenia

texts.es:
Ismenia M. G. es una señora de 61 años de edad, quien vive,  en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada La esperanza localizada en San José de Upala, Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche) y agricultura. Vive con uno de sus cuatro hijos.

Doña Ismenia se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de platano. Dice que el mercado para este producto es muy bueno. Comenta que gracias a este proyecto sus condiciones de vida han mejorado considerablemente y dice además que ha crecido como persona y ha adquirido mucho conocimiento, además ha aumentado su autoestima y su seguridad.

En estos momentos doña Ismenia desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢680,000 (seiscientos ochenta mil colones),para darle mantenimiento a su cosecha además comprar fertilizantes, abonos entre otros insumos. Con esta inversión  espera lograr una buena cosecha, con un producto de características apropiadas para conseguir un precio de venta alto poder incrementar la producción. 

Doña Ismenia es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Mujeres la Esperanza; la cual está integrada solo por mujeres, ya que se especializa en apoyar a mujeres no profesionales y  jefas de hogar, es una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su sexto  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Ismenia M. G. is 61 years old and lives in the small rural Costa Rican community of La Esperanza, located in San José of Upala, Alajuela Province. The main business activities for this area are cattle breeding (both meat and dairy) and agriculture. She lives with one of her four children.

Doña Ismenia is a banana farmer. She says the demand for her product is very high. Thanks to her business, her living conditions have improved considerably and she has also grown as a person who has gained much knowledge through experience. It has also helped her increase her self-esteem and financial security.

Doña Ismenia is currently requesting a microloan in the amount of 680,000 colones to pay for labor during the harvest season. She will also purchase fertilizers and other supplies. She hopes that this investment will result in a good harvest so that she can command a good price for her product.

Doña Ismenia is a member of La Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Mujeres (the Women’s Communal Credit Union) in La Esperanza, which supports women entrepreneurs and heads of households. This institution is one of 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This is Doña Ismenia’s sixth loan and she hopes to continue growing personally and financially. She will also continue participating in the local credit organization in her community.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies & pay for labor to harvest bananas

loans.name: Yuriy

texts.en: Yuriy is married with two children. He owns a small store and sells window curtains and shades. Yuriy has been in this business for 12 years. There has been a high demand for this type of goods. It enabled Yuriy to develop his business and open a store. Moreover, Yuriy has got a discount policy to bring the clients back. Yuriy employs two sales managers giving them jobs and opportunity to make living. Yuriy would like to borrow 18,100 UAH to increase his inventories. He has used mircoloans before and finds them very instrumental in his business development.

loans.use: to increase the assortment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer and beauty products.

loans.name: Margarito

texts.es: El señor Margarito es padre de familia de una señorita que esta estudiando, el y su hija viven solos por cuestiones de la vida así ha tenido que ser, el se encarga de su casa y de su hija, para brindarle un mejor futuro. El labora como vigilante en una empresa desde hace 2 años. Su hija esta próxima a graduarse y esto es el motivo por el cual esta el señor Margarito V. solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Margarito is the father of a young lady who is a student. He and his daughter live alone. Due to life’s circumstances that is how it had to be. He is responsible for his house and his daughter and wants to offer her a better future. For 2 years, he has worked as a watchman in a business. His daughter is close to graduating, and that is the reason Señor Margarito V. is applying for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payments for the graduation of his daughter

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. She is 56 years old and happily married with four children.

Christiana is determined to lift her business and family above poverty. She hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua A. is married and cares for five dependents. She has received vocational training. Efua sells corn mill plates and other spare parts at Elmina near Liverpool school, which she has been doing since 1996. Her husband is a driver.

Efua uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Efua will use the loan to purchase corn mill plates and spare parts for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase corn mill plates and spare parts for resale

loans.name: Linalyn

texts.en:
Linalyn M. is from the village of Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Linalyn is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Linalyn owns and operates a bakery. The main source of income for the business comes from selling baked bread to the community. Linalyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month.

In 2009, Linalyn joined GDMPC in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Linalyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional equipment. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Linalyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further improve and expand her business.
 
About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing additional equipment

loans.name: Jolidenw Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Jolidenw sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 33 ans et 3 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de MARKA COUNKO, sous préfecture de FANA, Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers  des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Elles exercent les activités d’achat et de ventes de condiments alimentaires et la restauration il y’a un peu longtemps de cela. 
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives. 
Elles sont à leur onzième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires et du riz pour la restauration. Les condiments sont achetés en gros à Bamako et sont revendus en détail sur place à MARKA COUNKO et une partie est utilisée dans la restauration servant de nourriture pour les passagers. La composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 25 000F CFA par mois. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of group Jolidenw are married women having an average age of 33 years and 3 children. They live in big traditional family homes with their husbands and children. They reside in the village of MARKA COUNKO within the FANA prefecture, KOULIKORO region of the Republic of Mali. They know each other through family ties and neighborhood relationship. They have been in the business of buying and selling of food ingredients and catering for a little longer. These women work with Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution with the aim to making durable their lucrative businesses. They are on their eleventh group loan and all preceding loans have been repaid correctly. With this loan, they expect to buy large quantity of food ingredients and rice for the catering business. The ingredients are bought in bulk in Bamako and resold in bits right in MARKA COUMBO and a part is used in catering to serve passengers, comprised of male and female.They expect to make an average monthly profit of 25 000FCFA each. On one hand, the profits are reinvested in the business and in the daily family expenses , on the other hand.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food ingrdients and some rice

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es:
El Sr. Osvaldo  Gaspar Ríos Fernández casado con la Sra, Mercedes Morinigo y padre de 3 hijos de 12, 10 y 6 años respectivamente, el cliente actualmente se dedica a la activación y venta de chips para telefonía celular, el mismo fue funcionario del Ministerio de Defensa y en el año 1998 renuncio a sus 10 años de antigüedad pues sus ingresos no le permitían mantener a sus entonces dos hijos y señora, ni mucho menos pretender una vida medianamente respetable, fue así que en ese mismo año se habilito el Departamento De ventas de lineas de la Empresa Núcleo Personal, mas tarde se habilito la venta de lineas de pre pagos y desde ese entonces el mismo se dedica por cuenta propia a la compra de chips para su posterior venta.
El Sr. Osvaldo manifestó al momento de solicitar el crédito que nunca había podido acceder a un crédito para ampliar su negocio por carecer de documentos suficientes que el exigían en las entidades financieras y bancarias, hasta la fecha que dio con la Fundación Paraguaya y el crédito le fue concedido para la habilitación del su primer local fijo en la ciudad de Lambaré donde ya cuenta con accesoR. para aparatos celulares ademas de las lineas para activación y venta de lineas de prepagos.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya la primera ayuda prestada y ya cuenta con su local de venta gracias a ella.
texts.en:
Osvaldo Gaspar Ríos Fernández is married to Mercedes Morinigo and the father of 3 children ages 12, 10, and 6, respectively. This client currently dedicates himself to the activation and sale of cell phone chips. He was previously on the staff of the Ministry of Defense. He resigned in 1998 after 10 years of service because his salary did not permit him to support his wife and his then two children, nor much less allow him to expect a life even halfway respectable. This is how, that same year, he joined the Sales Department of a personal electronics enterprise and then later started selling pre-paid lines. Since then, he has worked buying electronic chips to sell himself. Osvaldo states that he had never been able to expand his business until his loan through Fundación Paraguaya, because he lacked the necessary documents required by other financial entities and banks in order to obtain a loan through them. Once finally able to access credit, he obtained a site for his business in the city of Lambaré. His store is stocked with cell phone accessories as well as activation lines, and he also sells pre-paid lines. He is grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya for helping him with his first loan and, thanks to this help, he now has his own store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as:  cell phone activation chips.

loans.name: Badampurev

texts.en: Badampurev is 30 years old and lives with his spouse and three children in Khovd Province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a "ger". His oldest two daughters, aged four and five, are in a local secondary school while the youngest one, aged one, stays home. Badampurev has operated a taxi service in his town since 2005. He transports people around his town as well as to different areas throughout Khovd Province. He has gained much experience over the years and is a trusted driver for his many customers. Besides his taxi service he also herds livestock in the countryside. Badampurev is a very hardworking person and is known for his good character. He is working hard to maintain his success and has much hope for the future. He is requesting a 500,000 tugrug loan to purchase mechanical parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase mechanical parts for his car

loans.name: Diana Mae

texts.en:
Diana Mae N. is from the village of Mohon, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old. Diana Mae is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Diana Mae raises chickens for sale in the local community. Diana Mae has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,050 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Diana Mae joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diana Mae is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Diana Mae from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa Victoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y Trabajo”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres,  Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 45 años y es madre de 02 hijos  todos independientes, la socia presenta Secundaria Completa.

Rosa Victoria, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de comidas en su distrito, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero y ahora se dedica a la confección de vestidos y sabanas,  queriendo implementar su pequeño taller de costura y teniendo habilidad  para este tipo de actividad, no dudo en hacerlo y gracias al apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, logro implementarlo se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.

En la actualidad continua con su nuevo negocio y cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su casa, para realizar sus trabajos y pedidos, es ella quien personalmente les atiende con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, agujas de maquina, blondas de colores  alfileres, botones.

Rosa Victoria, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de salir adelante, su sueño es seguir creciendo y tener un local más amplio. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Victoria belongs to the communal bank "Honestidad y Trabajo" in the district of Juanjui, province of Mariscal Caceres, and department of San Martin. She is single, 45 years old, and the mother of two children, both of them independent. Previously, Rosa Victoria made a living by selling food in her district. Little by little, she generated her own income and saved money, and now she makes dresses and sheets for a living. She wanted to set up a sewing workshop, and since she had the ability to perform this activity, she had no doubts about doing it. Thanks to the support of the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, she managed to establish her workshop in her own house, with an atmosphere very well suited for attending to her clients. She works with requests from her clients and tells us that her sales are going very well. Currently, she is continuing with her new business and already has a loyal clientele who goes to her house on a daily basis to make requests. She attends to them personally with the kind of friendliness that is characteristic of her. With this loan of 1,500 Nuevos Soles, she will purchase different types of fabric by the meter and supplies such as scissors, needles, colored silk lace, pins, and buttons. Rosa Victoria feels that she is an accomplished woman, with a great desire to get ahead. Her dream is to continue growing and to have a larger work space. She thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start up her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fabrics in different colors and sizes

loans.name: Eseri

texts.en:
Eseri is 44 years of age, widowed, and has four children: aged between 11 and 15 years. Three of her children go to school. The family resides and rents a three-roomed house where she stays with six people. She takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped-in water at home. The family has three meals a day. Her greatest monthly expenses include, paying utility bills, school fees for children, medication and feeding the family and rent for her business and residence. 

Eseri operates and owns a food stall in Nakulabye market in the city suburbs. Eseri sells all types of food and vegetables at the market. On average, she receives 20 customers a day. She has done this business for over five years. She incurs the transport costs from buying food items from villages of Kiboga, about 55 miles from Kampala. Her main challenges are seasonality and the continually increasing prices of food items. She sells on a retail basis only and has been with MCDT for over seven years, servicing her fourteenth loan. She has been working all this long with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas, sacks of cassava, sweet potatoes and cabbages. She is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and to sell by wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of food items.

loans.name: Dario

texts.en:
Dario, a 39-year-old farmer, is a father to a one-year-old child. He has been married to his wife Maribel for ten years now. Involved in rice farming, he experienced difficulty especially at times when prices of farm inputs are too high and when the price of rice is too low. But he is determined to work hard despite all these challenges he faces. He also raises pigs to have another source of income.

Dario joined CEVI a year ago and he finds its program very helpful to farmers like him. He is now applying for a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos. With this amount, Dario would be able to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs he needs.

loans.use: Seed, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Pirmahmad

texts.ru: Шарипов Пирмахмад проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 58 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сын предоставляет услугу такси. Сам Пирмахмад занимается перевозкой. Образование средне- специальное. По специональности водитель- шофер грузовых автомобилей. Опыт работы 15 лет. Его деятельность приносит доход. Кредит берет для ремонта машины.
texts.en:
Pirmahmad S. lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 58 years old. He is married and has four children. His wife is a homemaker. His son drives a taxi cab. Pirmahmad does deliveries. He has a secondary specialized education and his profession is a truck driver. He has fifteen years experience. His business give him income and he is taking out the loan to repair his vehicle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the vehicle

loans.name: Leoncida

texts.es: Leoncida tiene 52 años, su actividad económica es la venta de pastes de baño y mercadería en general. Por lo que tiene mucho de estar en este negocio. Hace más de 8 años que se dedica a esta actividad, por lo que siempre le ha gustado obtener una fuente de ingreso ya que desde muy joven se ha preocupado por mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su negocio. Su deseo ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Leonicida is 53 years old. She makes her living selling bath scrubbers and other general merchandise. She has been engaged in this business for over eight years. Having a source of income has always been important to Leonicida; ever since she was very young, she devoted herself to improving the living conditions of her family. Leonicida wishes to further expand her business; she is asking for a loan in order to purchase the necessary raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok S., 28, is married and lives with her two young children in Siem Reap province. She is a farmer who works for less than US$ 1 each day, while her husband is a taxi driver making US$ 7 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Sok S. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$ 1200 to raise pigs. The rest of the money is to be used to repair her house.

loans.use: Raise pigs

loans.name: Sokunthea's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of five people who live in Trapeang Roka village in Takeo province. Mrs. Sokunthea N. is the group leader, selected by all the members, who will each use their portion of the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns 1.5 hectares of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family living. She is a pig breeder, too. Her husband, Mr. Savuth Sou, is a laborer. Her problem is that the soil in her rice field is infertile. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Sokunthea N. is seeking this loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan, she will buy pesticide, gasoline, and hire a plow machine. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are attending in local public school, while the other is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
Federico R. is from the village of Brgy.Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 52 years old and widowed. To make a living, Federico owns and operates a business venture in the services sector providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating jeepney transport services. Federico has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Federico joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Federico has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase a new engine. Federico is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Federico from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle for better service

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto P. G. de 43 años de edad, reside en el pueblo de Cojutepeque, el cual esta ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Carlos Alberto posee un taller en el cual repara maquinas de coser, así mismo comercializa todo tipo de repuestos para estas. Él es un hombre muy responsable, el cual es un excelente proveedor en su hogar, vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y junto a su única hija de 16 años de edad, quien estudia educación media. Su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal de Cojutepeque, en donde trabaja de lunes a domingo reparando las maquinas de sus clientes, Carlos solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maquinas de coser por mayor así mismo comprar más repuestos como bobinas, fajas, garfios y otros más, todo con el deseo de contar con todos los productos relacionados con su trabajo, para poder contar con más clientes los cuales le permitan contar con mayores ganancias, así de esta forma Carlos desea brindarles todo lo necesario a su esposa e hija, Carlos es un hombre muy trabajador y dedicado a su familia quien anhela lo mejor para esta.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto P. G. is 43 years old and resides in the town of Cojutepeque, which is in the Department of Cuscatlán. He has a workshop where he repairs sewing machines and sells all types of related parts. Carlos Alberto is a responsible gentleman who is a good provider to his household. He lives with his wife, who is in charge of the household duties, and their 16 year old daughter who is in high school.

His business is located at the municipal market in Cojutepeque. Carlos Alberto works Monday through Sunday repairing the machines of his customers. He is requesting a loan so that he can buy sewing machines wholesale as well as parts such as bobbins, belts, hooks, and other items so that he has everything required to perform his work and attract more customers. This will allow him to increase his income so that he can provide everything his wife and daughter needs. Carlos is a hard worker who is dedicated to providing his family the best.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing machines & sewing machine parts

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina, de 25 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tienen una hija. Juntos residen en la ceja de la selva peruana, ubicada en la localidad de Quimbiri, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. Dina se mantiene sola desde los 21 años, su sueño era  tener su propia tienda, pero por cosas del destino, se dedicó en la producción y comercialización de ladrillos de manera artesanal, desde entonces le va muy bien este negocio, dándole muchas satisfacciones económicas, actualmente los vende en la localidad de Pichari, ya que es una localidad que esta en constante crecimiento económico y poblacional; por tanto tiene compradores potenciales, debido a la calidad y tiempo de entrega que lo ofrece a sus clientes. Generalmente trabaja en compañía de su pareja, logrando ser un buen equipo de trabajo, pero en ocasiones necesita de más gente a la que contrata para realizar en menor tiempo la producción. Su punto de venta lo realiza en su misma planta de elaboración, es por ello que espera contar con una movilidad propia de carga, con la finalidad de pueda trasladar sus ladrillos hacia los distintos puntos de distribución, así logrará minimizar tiempo y ampliar su mercado. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando de manera puntual y eficiente, además se siente satisfecho con su grupo comunal, por los beneficios que otorga. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de materia prima e insumos para que pueda  fabricar en mayor volumen, y obtener mayores ingresos que en meses anteriores.
texts.en:
Dina is 25 years old, she lives with her partner and they have a daughter. The live in their own wooden house in the town of Quimbiri, located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle. Dina provides for herself since she was 21: she dreamed of having her own shop, but as fate had it, she has dedicated herself to the production and sales of artisanal wood bricks instead. Since she started, this activity has been very profitable, and it has given her many economical satisfactions. She currently sells her bricks in the town of Pichari, which experiences a constant population and economic growth; she has potential buyers there, thanks to the quality of the product she offers and the delivery times she guarantees to her customers. She generally works together with her partner, and they are a good working team, but sometimes she needs more people, and she hires workers to carry out the production more quickly. Her retail outlet is located in her production factory, and for this she hope to have a vehicle of her own, in order to deliver her bricks to the different distribution outlets, and thus succeeding in reducing the delivery time and increase her market share. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she commits to keeping on repaying in a punctual and proficient way; she is also satisfied with her communal bank for the benefits it grants. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy raw materials and components to produce a higher quantity of bricks, hoping to beat the earnings of the previous months.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials and components for the production of wood bricks.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto L. is from the village of San Miguel, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. He is 50 years old. Ernesto is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Ernesto owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling motor parts and accessories products in the local community. Ernesto has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ernesto joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ernesto is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Ernesto from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional motor parts and accessories  to sell

loans.name: Mary-Ann

texts.en:
Mary-ann F. is from the village of Annayatan, Baggao Cagayan. She is 31 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Mary-ann is starting a livestock business, raising pigs for fattening and sale. She is just starting this business.

Mary-ann joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Mary-ann from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Rita Lorena

texts.es:
Rita es una mujer trabajadora, madre de  dos hijos, es pequeña comerciante desde hace dieciocho años, hace y vende repostería, el cual ha sido su medio para logra apoyar a sus hijos económicamente.
Iniciando con dinero propio y poco,  productos como tortas, pudines vendiendo a sus alrededores del barrio.
Ha venido aumentando su inversión.
Con el financiamiento ya que fue el medio para lograr la demanda de sus pedidos de entrega que hace a los colegios. Lo que hará con este préstamo es el cambio de sistema eléctrico de su vivienda ya que por ser muy viejo en uso esta dando problemas en los apagadores, y teme que haga un corto circuito es por eso necesita hacer las conexiones nuevas para evitar algún accidente.
El cual comprara los materiales para comenzar, como: alambre solidó para hacer la instalación nueva, breaker, toma de doble empalme, tuvo pvc lámpara armada, caja de conduit conectores, placa ciega metálica, curvas conduit, barrilla polo entre otros. Logrando así estas mejoras que gracias al apoyo de Afodenic se hace posible el cambio.
texts.en:
Rita is a hardworking woman and the mother of two children. She has been a small businesswoman for eighteen years, making and selling desserts in order to support her children financially. Using a little bit of her own money, Rita began making cakes and puddings to sell around the neighborhood.

She has been increasing her investment. With the use of financing, Rita has been able to fulfill the orders placed by the local schools. This current loan will be used to replace the electrical wiring system in her home because it is very old and causing problems with her light switches. She is afraid that she might inadvertently cause a short circuit, which is why she needs a new connection installed in order to avoid an accident.

She plans to buy materials needed to start the work which includes wiring for the new connection, breakers, double-jointed connectors, PVC casing, bulbs, a box of conduit connectors, metal plates, curved conduits, terminals, and other supplies. Rita expresses her thanks to AFODENIC because it is now possible for her to make these changes and improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to replace the wiring system in her home

loans.name: Johana Margarita

texts.es:
En el Banco Comunal San Eduardo que se reúnen cada  quince días en la calle del mismo nombre en la ciudad de Portoviejo cerca de un hermoso parque llamado “El Mamey “.

Encontramos a la señora Johana, está casada y tiene dos niñas una de ocho y otra hermosa bebita de un mes que son la luz de su vida comenta. Ella es nacida en Crucita (hermosa playa de Portoviejo) pero que desde se caso se vino a vivir a este lugar.
 
Desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser ropa, confecciona todo tipo de ropa pero dice que le encanta hacer ropa para niños, ella comparte su tiempo entre su trabajo y su casa, aunque ésta es de sus suegros. Dice que aquí  trabaja en sus obras por las noches, los sábados y domingos todo el día. Ella en el día trabaja un taller de costura por lo que aprovecha al máximo su tiempo libre para cumplir con sus contratos.

Esta en el Banco Comunal desde hace ya tres ciclos y está muy contenta ya que le han ayudado mucho. Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar una maquina industrial para mejorar su producción.
 
Sus sueños son tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The San Eduardo Communal Bank meets every two weeks on San Eduardo Street in Portoviejo near a beautiful park called “El Mamey.” We met with Johana who’s married and has two daughters one of whom is 8 years old and the other is a beautiful one-month-old baby. They are the light of her life, she says. She was born in Crucita (beautiful beach of Portoviejo) but came to live here when she got married. She has been a dressmaker for several years. She makes all kinds of clothes but she says what she likes best is to make children’s clothes. She combines her work with her household chores even though the house belongs to her in-laws. She says that she works on her projects during the night and all day on weekends. During the day she works at a sewing workshop so she uses her time to the maximum degree in order to complete her contracts. She has been in the communal bank for three cycles and is very happy because they have helped her much. The new loan will be used to buy an industrial sewing machine to improve production. Her dream is to own her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Kenjebu Chynybekova's Group

texts.en:
Kenjebu C. is the leader of this group. She is 48, married and has two daughters and two sons. The first son is in army, the second is at school and the daughters are married and live separately with their families. Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 10,000 KGS, Kenjebu opened a cafeteria. Now she makes 10,000 KGS per month. Her husband works as a driver and his monthly salary is 5,000 KGS. Having saved money, Kenjebu and her husband purchased a vehicle and repaired their house. With money received from this loan, Kenjebu wants to purchase convenience goods in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future, she wants to build a house for her sons. 
Venera A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 52, a widow and has raised three daughters and a son. Her first daughter is married and lives separately with her family, her second daughter and her son are working in Russia, and her youngest daughter is at school. Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 5,000 KGS, Venera started to breed cattle. By selling the cattle after fattening she makes 5,000 KGS per month. She hopes to obtain this loan because she needs money to start cultivating maize and sunflowers. In the future, she wants to see all her children get married.
Abdimajit A., 52, is married with three daughters and three sons. His sons and youngest daughter are students, and his other daughters are married and live separately with their families. In order to make money, Abdimajit provides a mechanic’s service and his wife sells milk. Abdimajit also cultivates wheat and sunflowers. With money received from this loan, he wants to hire labor for farming. In the future, he wants to purchase a piece of land and then start building a house for his sons.
Adalat A., 52, is married. She has two sons and a daughter. All of her children are married and work in Russia. Sixteen years ago, with an initial investment of 7,000 KGS, Adalat started to sell flour on the market. In this way, she makes 8,000 KGS per month. This profit made it possible for her to purchase a vehicle for her husband, who now works as a private driver. Adalat has applied for this loan because she wants to purchase flour in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future, she wants to expand her business and improve her living conditions.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit:  www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at  www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase convenience goods

loans.name: Ibrogim

texts.en:
Ibrogim, who is married and has four children, lives in Isfara, Northern Tajikistan, where he offers technical maintenance services in his home. Ibrogim decided to launch this business 15 years ago because he has always loved working with technical systems. He is now seeking a loan of 7500 Somoni to purchase necessary materials and spare parts. He believes his business policy, which allows for deferred payments, will be an attraction for his customers and will help him stand out among his competitors. Ibrogim has repaid his previous two loans from IMON International, both of which contributed to the growth of his business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and a diagnostic device for repair of electronic equipment

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda C. is from the village of Mahayahay, Iligan City. She is 58 years old. Erlinda is married and has one grown child. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, buying and selling canned goods and snacks in the local community. She also makes and sells  sausage or longganisa. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Erlinda is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken by Erlinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Mahayahay, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en: Chheang S. L. is 52 years old and she is a widow. She lives in Chamkar Doung village, Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns 1.50-hectare of land to cultivate rice for living. Aside from farming, she is a pig breeder. With her pig breeding, she faces a problem because she does not have enough money to support her breeding. Thus, Chheang S. L. would like to ask for a loan to buy pig food for her breeding busoness. The child who is in the picture is her grandchild.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for pig raising

loans.name: Marjan's Group

texts.en:
What is aging? Some people treat it with respect as a sign of wisdom and greatness. Some fear it, and try to face it as late as possible. And some just accept it as inevitable human nature and deal with it easily. Our next heroine thinks that aging is not an excuse for not following dreams and being successful.
 
Marjan D., 63, born in the small town of Toktogul, started her business breeding livestock 25 years ago. Growing up in the village, this was the only thing she spent her whole time on and was good at. The art of taking good care of livestock is carefully taught from one generation to the next. Marjan is married and is fortunate to have five children. Her husband has worked as a surgeon his entire life. The children are already grown and have their own families. Marjan used only 15,000 KGS for her business start-up and had to sacrifice her husband’s salary. She and her husband understood that it was very risky to invest the last savings in business start-up, but an endless hope and belief drove them forward. Despite her age, Marjan is a very ambitious woman. She gathered a group of four businessmen who are very experienced in breeding livestock before she applied for a loan. At this time Marjan needs 20,000 KGS, which she will use to purchase one more head of cattle. Her dream is to purchase land in the capital Bishkek.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Neou

texts.en:
Sewing clothes is the major part of 32-year-old Neou K.’s daily activities in the garment industry. Neou K. has been engaged in her job since 2000 and has a formal salary. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a blacksmith in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. The couple helps each other to earn money to feed their one kid, who is studying in school. 

Besides her current work, Neou K. is also a farmer and now it is the time for planting a rice crop but her farmland isn't ready for plowing yet because she is busy working. To solve this obstacle, Neou K. is applying for a loan to buy a machine to plow her farmland in order to start growing rice.

loans.use: To buy a machine to plow her farmland in order to start for growing rice

loans.name: Dolores Jacqueline

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Jerusalén.
 
En este lugar encontramos y conocimos a la señora Dolores, tiene 46años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos dos de ellos ya son mayores y el ultimo tiene 15 años y estudia en colegio. Todos sus hijos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es taxista.

Ella tiene un carro que la utiliza como transporte escolar, muy de mañana se levanta y sale a hacer su recorrido diario parra levar a sus estudiantes a los diferentes centros de estudio, realiza esto dos veces en las mañanas y dos en las tardes. Trabaja de lunes a viernes. Nos cuenta que su transporte es muy solicitado por la seriedad y el cumplimiento de ella ya que siempre lleva a sus alumnos a tiempo.

Este crédito lo solicito para comprar algunos repuestos y llantas ya que tiene que tener su carro en buen estado para brindar el mejor servicio.  Lleva 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son tener una furgoneta más grande y brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Dolores, 46, can be found in Manabí’s capital Portoviejo’s Nueva California neighborhood.  Portoviejo has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds.  The members of the Nueva Jerusalén (The New Jerusalem) communal bank meet here every two weeks.

She is married and has three children.  Two of them are already adults and the youngest is 15 and going to secondary school.  All of her children still live with her.  Her husband is a taxi driver.

She has a vehicle she uses to provide school transportation services.  She gets up very early every morning to travel her route taking students to various educational institutions.  She makes two trips in the morning and two in the afternoon.  She works Monday through Friday.  She tells us that her transportation service is highly sought after due to the seriousness and commitment with which she always delivers her students on time.

She asked for this loan to buy some replacement parts and tires because she must have her vehicle in good condition to provide the best service.  She has been in the communal bank for 4 years and likes it because the loans are quick.

Her dream is to have a larger van to provide better service.

loans.use: To buy vehicle replacement parts and tires.

loans.name: Production Plus Group

texts.en:
Marceline, aged 56, is the manager of the Community Bank named “Production Plus”. It is composed of 12 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Marceline has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 1998, having started by selling loaves of bread with a beginning capital of $20. Today, she sells corn and manioc. She has been with Hope since October 2009. Progressively, her business has prospered thanks to accumulated profit and good management. The loan she’ll obtain next will be used to buy some sacks of corn, manioc and charcoal to resell with the goal of increasing her profits. Her business generates a profit of $60 per week. Marceline’s ambition is to become a bread wholesaler.

She is a widowed mother of eight children between the ages 16 and 26, four of whom attend school. She also takes care of two grandchildren.

loans.use: To purchase some sacks of corn and manioc for resale

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar Minawai is a young man from Gaza City in the Gaza Strip. Omar finished school and wanted to start a business. His father owns a shop in the city, so Omar decided to use the shop and start a fishing supplies and equipment store as Gaza City is located by the sea.

Omar took a loan from FATEN to purchase some of the goods, such as fishing nets and hooks, that he wants to sell in the store.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment for his new store

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El señor Oscar C. N. tiene 20años de edad y vive en una casa en alquiler vivienda que esta ubicada en un barrio de la ciudad de Tarija. Oscar es soltero y no tiene  hijos, por circunstancias de la vida el se vino de la ciudad de Potosi por motivos de trabajo, ahora el tiene que trabajar para poder salir adelante, Oscar se dedica desde hace mas de 1 año a trabajar en una empresa muy reconocida en esta ciudad la cual se dedica a la venta de comida rápida que es pollo a  la broster  la empresa se llama Crocan Pollo, 

Los fines de semana el trabaja en acontecimientos festivos con su equipo de amplificacion, lo cua l le genera buenos ingresos. Oscar quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante, pero el nos cuenta que quiere comprarse un mejor equipo de amplificación para poder alquilar, como el ya tiene experiencia en el rubro el credito sera destinado para la compra de dicho equipo que es nesesario para realizar la actividad. Para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.
                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Oscar  nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el proximo credito que solicite sera para la compra de mas equipos para su amplificacion.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar C. N. is 20 years old and lives in a rented house, located in the city of Tarija. Oscar is single and he doesn't have children. He moved to the city of Potosi to look for work and now he works to support himself. For the past year Oscar has been working for a well-known company in the city, selling fast foods including roast chicken, called Crocan Pollo by the company. 

On the weekends he uses his sound system to cater special events and it is a good source of income. Oscar wants to improve his income to support himself. He says that he wants to purchase a better sound system to rent it out, given that he already has experience in the field. The loan will be invested in the purchase of a sound system which is necessary for is business. This way he will be able to increase his income. 

Oscar wants to improve the quality of his life and he says that the next loan will be used to purchase other sound systems.

loans.use: To purchase a sound system.

loans.name: Uriel

texts.es: Uriel tiene 28 años, vive en la propiedad de sus padres y en compañía de ellos. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las actividades agrícolas ayudando a sus padres a cultivar y cuidar las plantaciones, en la actualidad tiene sus terrenos de cultivos heredados y de las cuales administra en ella los cultivos que le son rentables. Su trabajo comienza todos los días en horas de la madrugada ya que siempre verifica el estado de sus plantaciones, cultiva principalmente la papa y también maíz, habas, arveja zanahoria entre otros productos, que luego de ser cosechados los lleva a vender directamente al mercado mayorista de la ciudad mas cercana a su localidad. Siempre recibe la ayuda de sus progenitores así como también contrata mano de obra de peones. Durante este tiempo ha visto que mejorará un poco más sus ganancias por lo que lo anima a continuar adelante en la actividad agrícola. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará sacos de abono para su campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Uriel, 28, lives on his parents’ property with them.  Since childhood he has worked in agriculture helping his parents care for their crops.  He currently has his own fields that he inherited and administers.  His crops are profitable.

His day starts at dawn when he goes out to check on the state of his plants.  He grows mainly potatoes but also corn, lima beans, peas and carrots, among others, which are harvested and sold directly at the wholesale market in the city nearest his location.  He always gets help from his parents as well as from hired helpers.  During this time he has noticed that his profits will be a bit improved which encourages him to continue forward with farming.

This is his first loan with MFP.  He is very happy to know that he has financial support and he enjoys being part of a communal bank because all the members are responsible, very mutually supportive, people.

He thanks all those people who will fund the loan he’s requesting which will be very useful for his activity’s progress.  He will use the requested funds to buy manure for the next planting season.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Griselda De La Paz

texts.es:
Doña Griselda, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, tiene 40 años de edad, administra una tienda de consumo, vive con su esposo don Gabino, dos hijos Maritza de 16 y Jorge de 14 años de edad, los dos estudian.
El negocio de doña Griselda tiene 4 años de existir, y fue iniciativa propia, para ayudar a don Gabino con otra fuente de ingreso que solventara necesidades y les ayudara a mantener el hogar estable. Por el momento ella necesita un préstamo para invertir en el negocio ya que desea surtirlo de mercadería y no cuenta con las facilidades económicas, por lo que este préstamo le servirá para crecer con mercadería de la cual a diario demandan los clientes.
Los sueños de ella son crecer con el negocio tanto en mercadería como en el local que sea más amplio, estabilizar los ingresos y ayudar a su grupo familiar con todo lo que sea posible.
texts.en:
Doña Griselda lives in Corinto, in Morazán department. She is 40 years old and runs a general store. She lives with her husband Don Gabino, and their 2 children Maritza, 16, and Jorge, 14, who are both studying.
