Doña Griselda's business has been around for 4 years and was her own initiative, intended to help Don Gabino by providing another source of income that would pay for necessities and help them maintain a stable home. At present she needs a loan to invest in the business because she would like to stock it with more merchandise, and doesn't have the funds to do so. The loan will therefore be used to expand her stock with items her customers request every day.

Her dreams are to grow her business and stock so much that she will need bigger premises, to stabilise the income form the business, and to help her family in every possible way.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Juana Felicitas

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Juana;  La socia tiene 40 años de edad; La socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos; sus hijos tiene 20 y 18 años,  La socia  es contadora de profesión, la socia tiene una empresa de distribución llamada rio negro; La socia se encuentra estudiando una maestría, ella por ahora desea el crédito para poder ayudarse y pagar los estudios de sus hijos en la universidad, la socia irá pagando este préstamo con lo que ingrese de su empresa y con el dinero de su profesión. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en los estudios de sus hijos.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana is a member of the Communal Bank “Choquequirao” which is lcoated in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 40 years old, married, and has two children (ages 20 and 18). Juana is an accountant by profession. She also has a distribution company called “Rio Negro”. Juana is studying for her Master’s degree, but now she wants to help pay for her children’s university education. She plans to repay this loan using the profits from her business and the money she earns from her job.

Juana is requesting this loan to invest in her children’s studies. She is happy with the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To pay for her children's university expenses.

loans.name: Marichel

texts.en:
Marichel A. is from the village of Sorosoro, Maribucao, Camiguin Province. She is 48 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marichel owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, junk foods, detergents, biscuits and candies in the local community. Marichel has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Marichel joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Marichel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and instant noodles. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and instant noodles

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertudes works hard to support her family. She is single and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines.

Gertudes requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods and noodles for her sari-sari store. She has been in this business for two years now, and she also earns additional income from E-loading.

In the future, Gertudes would like to renovate her home and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa N. is married and has eight dependents. She sells provisions in Abbina, near Elmina, a fishing community in Cape Coast. Adjoa uses her income to assist her husband to provide for her household. Adjoa will use this loan to purchase more provisions to fill her shop. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to save to build a bigger and better shop.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions to fill her shop.

loans.name: James Santos

texts.es: James Santos de cuarenta y dos años de edad vive con su compañera de vida. El posee  una venta de ladrillos de tejar o manual y es el mejor ladrillo del lugar las personas lo prefieren por su calidad y el buen precio; además el carisma de James al atender a sus clientes es inigualable siempre está a su disposición, personas como albañiles son los que más solicitan sus ladrillos y últimamente se ha hecho de mas clientela es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más materia prima como la arcilla, el barro entre otros para la fabricación de mas ladrillos que puedan satisfacer la necesidad del cliente. James espera de esta forma sacar adelante a su familia y confía que podrá darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: James Santos, 42, lives with his partner.  He has a business selling handmade bricks and bricks for tiles and are considered the best bricks in the area.  People prefer their quality and price.  In addition, the way James treats his customers is unmatchable.  He is very attentive.  People who are brick layers use his bricks and he has recently gotten more clients which is why he is taking out a loan from INTEGRAL.  This will help him buy raw materials like mud and other things to produce bricks that will satisfy his customers.  James hopes to get his family ahead by doing this and is confident that he will be able to give them a good quality of life.

loans.use: Raw materials: mud.

loans.name: Abizeranye Group

texts.fr: Valens  est client d’ACB depuis 2011,il est cultivateur de légumineuses, il est membre du groupe Abizeranye, il est né au Rwanda, son éducation est de 8 ans de l’école primaire, il est marié, il a 33 ans, il a 4 enfants entre 7 et 2 an, 2 de ses enfants va  à l’école. C’est son premier cycle de prêt, Valens va utiliser le prêt pour l’agriculture de légumineuses et payer la main d’œuvre et achat d’engrais chimique et la semence. Sa stratégie est d’étendre le terrain cultivé pour augmenter la production. Dans l’avenir, le profit va lui aider de construire une maison d’habitation de sa famille.
texts.en: Valens has been an ACB customer since 2011. He grows legumes (peas, beans etc) for a living, and is a member of the Abizeranye group. He was born in Rwanda, and attended primary school for eight years. He is married, 33 years old and has four children between two and seven years old, two of whom attend school. This is the first loan that he has sought. Valens will use the loan to boost his legumes production and to pay for labour costs, chemical fertilisers and seeds. His aim is to extend his land so that he can boost production. In future, he would like to use the profits from his business in order to build a home for his family.

loans.use: to pay labour costs and to purchase seeds and fertilisers

loans.name: Antonia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Antonia , es una pequeña agricultora de la zona de Ticuantepe, durante 18 años que se dedica al cultivo de piña, la mayor afectación son las plagas y enfermedades que se le presentan ya que carecen de fertilización, los planes hacia su familia es mejor las condiciones de vida; ella  tuvo tres hijos de los cuales uno estudia en la universidad a pesar de los grades problemas económicos, lucha día a día para ver a su hijo graduado,  doña Antonia agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondos Kiva ya que para ella han sido de gran ayuda y poco a poco a realizado cambios en su vida . Con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para inducir las plantas de piña.
texts.en:
Antonia is a small farmer in the Ticuantepe area. For 18 years she has been growing pineapples. The greatest challenge she faces are the pests and diseases that affect her plants because she doesn't have enough fertilizer. Her plans for her family are to improve their quality of life. She has three children, only one of whom is studying at university because of their financial problems. She works hard every day in the hopes of seeing her son graduate.

Antonia is grateful for the support that she receives from Afodenic through Kiva funds because it has been a huge help for her and little by little she has been able to make changes in her life. With this loan she will purchase fertilizer and supplies to plant pineapples.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Battsetseg is a 42 year old divorcee and she lives with her 2 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her eldest daughter has just graduated from secondary school and is currently taking exams towards University. Her son studies at the local secondary school. They live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in ger district. Two years ago her husband left the family. 

Battsetseg has been running a taxi business since 2002, using her family car. Last year she bought a mini truck and she is currently leasing it monthly to someone else for small amount of money. It gives her a chance to earn some extra income. She owns a small land plot in ger district and now she is planning to build a small family house on it.

The loan that Battsetseg is taking will be used to buy necessary building materials like cement, sand, wood planks and beams and to build the basement and the main structure of the house.

loans.use: to buy a necessary building materials like cement, sand, wood planks and beams and to build the basement and the main structure of the house.

loans.name: Dora Victoria Muñoz

texts.es:
Dora, tiene 57 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de León, es madre de tres hijos, esta casada , ella es comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, llevar tres años con este negocio. Ella dice que su primera experiencia en el comercio fue cuando tenia una comideria llamada Vicky la cual tuvo por 15 años, después decidió poner una venta de ropa usada que ahora es su actual negocio su esposo e hijos la apoyan a ella en este negocio.
Solicito el préstamo para compras inventario de ropa usada para vender. Con esta inversión quiere mejorar sus ventas, poder vender ropa de mejor calidad para así atraer nuevos clientes y mejorar sus ingresos.  En lo futuro quiere invertir en hacer mejores a su local quiere mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio.
texts.en:
Dora, 57, lives in the city of León.  She is the mother of three children.  She’s married.  She’s a merchant who sells used clothes.  She’s been in business three years.  She says that her first experience in commerce was when she had an eatery called Vicky that she had for 15 years.  She then decided to go into selling used clothes which is her current business.  Her husband and children support her efforts in this business.

She asked for the loan to buy stock merchandise of used clothes to sell.  She wants to use this investment to improve sales, to be able to sell higher quality clothes to attract new customers and improve her income.  In future, she wants to invest in making some improvement in her locale; she wants to improve its infrastructure.

loans.use: to buy used clothes.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Ellen has a shop that sells fish such as sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy more fish to sell.

Ellen has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Ellen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Pacencia

texts.en:
Pacencia, age 60, is a widow who has had five children, the youngest of whom is still of schooling age and enrolled in school. Pacencia works very hard to provide for the family. She runs a sari-sari (general store) business, and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

Pacencia has been in this business for 38 years and sells a variety of items such as soy sauce, oil, bread, shampoo, and canned goods. 

In the future, Pacencia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items such as soy sauce, oil, bread, shampoo, and canned goods to offer for sale

loans.name: Marco

texts.es: El señor Marco es albañil y trabaja independientemente. El crédito lo requiere para comprar material de construcción como ser cemento y arena para un contrato que obtuvo en una casa particular. Vive en casa propia la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Pasankeri en la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y no  tiene hijos. Marco ya obtuvo un crédito anterior de IMPRO y ahora canalizamos el presente crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Marco is a mason and works independently. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials, such as cement and sand, for a contract job he obtained for a private residence. Marco lives in his own home in the District of Pasankeri in the city of La Paz. He is single and has no children.

Marco received a previous loan from IMPRO, but now this current loan is being referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand in order to complete a contract job.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 30 years old and divorced from her husband who is a teacher by profession. She has one child who is in school. She has a business selling bread in Buluk branch in Juba, South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.

Agnes requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more bread to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a permanent house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: We Tel God Tenki Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “We Tel God Tenki” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

Zainab is the leader of this group. Zainab is age 38; she was born in Mathombo village but she is currently residing in Magburaka, together with her husband and one child. Her husband is a businessman and her child is attending primary school. For 15 years now,  Zainab has been selling onions, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, rice, etc. With this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy onions, Maggi, salt, rice, etc., in bulk.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Rosa tiene ya más de 16 años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes, ya que lo tiene ubicado el negocio en su propia casa. 

Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar mercancía (verduras, frutas, productos de lácteos, (quesos y cremas) y  carmes frías, (jamón).  No cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión  y no quiere descapitalizar el ingreso del negocio ya que es la única fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas de su negocio.
texts.en:
For more than 16 years Maria Rosa has been selling grocers, and she has a store located in her own home. 

She is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise (vegetables, fruit, dairy products (cheese and cream) and cold cuts (ham). She does not have the necessary money for the investment and she doesn’t want to remove money from the money because it’s the only income that her family has. 

She plans to repay the loan with the income that she gets from business sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery business.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad runs her general store within the local community of Dumabato Sur, Maddela Quirino. She has been running this kind of business for two years. She is 57 years of age and has been blessed with five children. 

Felicidad would like to maintain her general store in order to provide the needs of her family. She works very hard to sustain their daily needs. According to her, sometimes or most of the times she suffers from difficulties in managing her store due to some neighborhoods' bad credit. 

This challenge is the reason why she is in need of additional capital in the amount of P15,000. She hopes that she can obtain this loan amount so that she could purchase stock groceries such as soft drinks, cooking oil, detergent soap, shampoo, ingredients and assorted biscuits for her general store. Through this loan amount, she could increase her income, save some for the future of her children and for emergency purposes when she gets weak.

loans.use: to buy stock groceries such as soft drinks, cooking oil, detergent soap, shampoo, ingredients and assorted biscuit  for her general store

loans.name: Mareen

texts.en:
Mareen, age 30, lives in the town of Ishaka in the Kabwohe region of Uganda. She is single and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Mareen has been working hard to manage her grocery store, where she sells food items and home supplies. 

To help expand her business, Mareen has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items to fill her store's shelves, which will help Mareen to generate greater profits and improve her family's quality of life. Mareen hopes that in the future she will be able to open another business in the area. 

Mareen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mareen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more food items and home supplies to offer for sale

loans.name: Esperanca

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Provincia de Gaza, sul  de Moçambique, solteira e mae de 2 filhos  dos quais 1 frenquenta a Escola. Fez 3ª classe  e nao continuou por falta de condicoes financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e nao sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu de Chibuto para Boane, a procura de melhores condicoes de vida, é comerciante ha mais de 20 anos vende produtos variados e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 9.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao obra da sua casa (ferro, cimento, tinta, areia, barrotes e outros) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua obra.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e iniciar outras obras e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Esperança was born in the Chibuto district, Gaza province, in southern Mozambique.  She is a single mother of 2 children, one of whom attends school.  She attended school through the third grade but did not continue due to her parents' financial situation.  She owns the home where she lives with her family and she does not support anyone else.  

She left Chibuto for Boane in search of better living conditions.  She has been a merchant for more than 20 years, selling a variety of products.  She earns around 9.000.00mt per month, which she uses for household expenses and she saves some in her bank account.

She has never had a loan in another bank.  She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client.  This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase materials (iron, cement, paint, sand, beams, etc.) to continue construction on her home.  

She promises to make her payments on time.  In the future she plans to complete her home and start other projects, and she intends to request more loans from Hluvuku for this purpose.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for her home (iron, cement, paint, sand, beams, etc.)

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: La Sra. Rosalía, es cliente antigua de la institución,  ya se encuentra en su tercera secuencia, se dedica a la venta de comida, ella vende almuerzos, esta sacando crédito  para compra de insumos (arroz, azúcar, papa, fideo y otros, en el momento de la evaluación del crédito la Sra. Rosalía demostró una actitud buena, Cortez y amable, razón por la cual se la escogió para crédito Kiva. La Sra. Rosalía tiene su negocio en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz Bolivia, ella vende almuerzos y sopa de fideo, a partir de las 9 de la mañana hasta las 22:30 aproximadamente todos los días, su principal aspiración es comprarse un terreno y tener su casa.
texts.en:
Rosalía is a longstanding client of the institution since she’s in her third sequence.  She sells food: lunches.  She is taking out a loan to buy ingredients (rice, sugar, potatoes, noodles and others).  At her evaluation, Rosalía had a good, cordial and kind attitude which is why she was chosen for a Kiva loan.

Rosalía has her business in the city of La Paz’s Sopocachi zone.  She sells lunches and noodle soup from 9am until 10:30pm approximately every day.  Her main goal is to buy a lot and to own a house.

loans.use: to buy supplies like rice, sugar, potatoes, noodles and others.

loans.name: Echangeur Plus Group

texts.en:
Ilunga, from Kinshasa DRC, is the 56-year-old group leader of an 8-member group loan named “Echangeur Plus” offered by MFI HOPE DRC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ilunga, who is married, has seven children, whose ages range between 12 and 25 years old. Four of them attend school. Ilunga has been a micro-entrepreneur since 1991 in the eastern part of Kinshasa. Currently, his business brings in a profit of 150 USD per week. He has already obtained and correctly repaid 9 loans from microfinance institution and Kiva partner, HOPE DRC. He plans to use the coming loan from HOPE to increase his inventory by purchasing 10 more charcoal sacks for reselling at profit in order to increase his income. Ilunga has a point-of-sale within his community.

loans.use: to increase the stock of his goods by buying 10 charcoal sacks for resale at a profit

loans.name: Jessica Del Socorro

texts.es: Jessica trabajadora, emprendedora, profesión licenciada de contabilidad, comerciante agricultora y ganadera tiene parcela en donde tiene los siembro y cuido de ganado. Vende leche, arroz, maíz, frijoles, entre otros productos. Su plan a futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda. Brindarle seguridad y comodidad a su familia por el ambiente del vecindario donde habita. El préstamo  que solicita será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción siendo el inicio para cumplir sus planes. Comprara: cemento, láminas de zinc, inodoros, lava mano, tuberías pvc, pega para tubería, cerámica, arena, bloques, hierro, perlines, estribu, alambre de amarre, entre otros materiales para construir en una aria libre que está en el patio el servicio higiénico, logrando con esta obra mejorar sus condiciones y a su vez el higienes y salud de la familia. Proyectos futuro construir los muros perimetrales de la propiedad. Agradece a la financiara por su apoyo a la mejora de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jessica is hardworking and enterprising.  She has a degree in accounting and also works as a farmer and rancher.  She has land where she plants and cares for her livestock.  She sells milk, rice, corn, beans, and other products.  Her goal for the future is to improve her house.  It will provide security and comfort to her family by improving the environment in which they live.  

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of construction materials so she can begin to implement her plans.  She will purchase cement, zinc sheets, toilets, sinks, pvc pipes, pipe glue, tiles, sand, bricks, iron, roofing beams, supports, wire, and other materials to build a bathroom in an open area on the patio.  She wants to improve the conditions for her family, and also their hygiene and health.  In the future, she plans to build walls around the boundaries of her property.  

She is thankful to the lenders for their support in improving her home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Leandra

texts.en:
Leandra is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Leandra has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods. snacks and beverages.

Leandra has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Leandra hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods. snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 56 years old, married and has 5 children. With 3 children in school, Josephine works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. Josephine has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Hazef

texts.en:
Hazef is 53 years old, married with five children. He does dairy farming to earn a living, and he has been in the business for four years and has employed one person. He describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income. He hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 75,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es: Lucas de cuarenta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos; el posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad granos básicos, pan, huevos, jabones, entre otros, tiene varios años de tener el negocio y ya tiene mucha experiencia en las ventas, se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente pues es la tienda más surtida de la zona y la gente la prefiere porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad y a precio accesible además el servicio es inigualable; Lucas es un hombre emprendedor con  muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que se le presentan  sabe que solo así llegara al éxito;  desde hace mucho tiempo quiere hacer crecer su negocio pero no posee del suficiente capital para invertir en insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, pan, productos instantáneo,  golosinas, etc. Lucas tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá saldar el financiamiento, y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: granos básicos, pan, productos instantáneo,  golosinas

loans.name: Edridah

texts.en:
Edridah is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Edridah has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells beer and sodas. 

To help expand her business, Edridah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase the stock in the bar, and will help Edridah to generate greater profits and help in buying family necessities. Edridah hopes that in the future she will be able to add more stock. 

Edridah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Edridah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to increase the stock in the bar.

loans.name: Gulidjon

texts.en: Гулиджон 36 летняя жительница района Вахш. Она разведена с мужем. У нее есть одна дочка. Гулиджон сама ухаживает о дочке. Она трудолюбивая женщина и она занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Гулиджон выращивает арбуз. Она 3 года уже занимается этой деятельности. Гулиджон арендует 2 Га земельный участок. Сейчас Гулиджон нужно готовить землю к новому посева урожай. Она хочет купить минеральные удобрения и семян арбуз. Но у нее нет денежных средств, чтобы приобрести их. Поэтому Гулиджон обратилась к Вам за кредитом. Гулиджон так больше старается, чтобы обеспечить дочку. Вы можете помочь ей с финансовыми трудностями. Гулиджон будет очень рада за Вашу поддержку.

loans.use: Для купли минеральных удобрений и семян арбуз.

loans.name: Shukamani

texts.en:
Shukamani is a 45-year-old hardworking lady. She is living with her husband and two daughters who are attending school/college. Shukamani makes local food items like papad (crackers) and badi (fried) from different varieties of lentils like black gram. Her husband goes to different villages from house to house to sell these items. These are local popular side dishes that are round and eaten fried in oil/roasted over a fire or added to curries for flavor. She grinds the lentils and makes dough by adding other ingredients like rice, salt, oil, water and desired seasonings. She then rolls the dough into thin rounds and dries them in the sun to make them ready to fry for selling. She spends seven to eight hours a day at these activities. It is her determination to see her children well-educated that has been getting her through this hard manual labor despite her disability. 

She wants to take a loan of 35,000 INR to buy a grinder that runs on electricity. This will let her grind the lentils and make her life much easier. She also wants to buy more raw materials like lentils (black gram), rice, oil, onions and garlic to make more of these items and sell in bulk to shops in the village market. She wants to give a better education to her children and get them a better standard of life.

loans.use: to buy an electronic grinder and raw materials like lentils, rice, oil, onions and garlic for making papads and badis

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.en:
Maria is a woman on her early 40s. She lives with her boyfriend in Free Union; with him, she shares the blessing of a young boy. Her son is now 8 years old. She enjoys her work, watching movies and spending as much time as possible with her son.

Her partner is the main support and provider for the family. Maria likes to help the household income as much as possible. She likes to know that her hard work will be reflected as a brighter future for her son in the long term, and in short term, will be reflected as a higher life quality.

To contribute to the household income Maria runs two street market stands; she owns both. One sells food and the other, women's clothes imported from the USA. She works in the clothes one, and she has been doing well with both of them. But Maria thinks that for the upcoming season the client demand will be high, and she wants to be available to meet it. To do so, she needs a bigger stock, but she doesn't have enough money to buy all the clothes she needs; therefore, she is applying for a loan at Kiva, through Kubo.financiero, a Kiva field partner, for 10,527 MXN.

Maria has had previous credits before, and she paid for those well, and without trouble.

loans.use: to grow her stock and prepare for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Lidys

texts.en:
Lidys runs a hair salon where she styles and cuts hair. She has been in this line of work for over 15 years. After working in the beauty salon of a family member, Lidy’s decided to start her own operation with $50 of capital. She opens her salon at 9 in the morning and works until about 8 p.m. She needs the loan in order to buy better equipment for her operation. She needs new scissors, a blow dryer and a hair iron.

Lidys is a 34 year old mother of 5 children. All of her kids are in school thanks to the income she generates from her own salon. She hopes to continue to improve her services and attract a larger amount of clients.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She needs new scissors, a blow dryer and a hair iron.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 37 years old and started the business with $800 which she got as a loan from Kenya Women's Finance Trust. She is trained in hair dressing. she is married and has two children who are attending school. She is educated to level 12.

Given the loan, she wants to purchase chemicals in bulk to benefit from the wholesale price, thereby maximizing her profit.

She wants utilize her profits to save for children's education and also to further her training in hair dressing.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals for the saloon

loans.name: Ve

texts.en: Mrs. Ve is 50 years old and her husband been dead for 10 years ago. She lives with a son and a daughter. Her son is 22 years old, is a mason. Her daughter is 17 years old, is a tailor in Long My town. Ve has 4000 square meters land for growing sweet potato, plus she raises pigs. Ve’s family income is $11 per person/month. She needs to get a loan of $75 to purchase feed for pigs and fertilizer for the sweet potato field. Ve will repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: To purchase feed for pigs and fertilizer for the sweet potato.

loans.name: Arzukhanim

texts.en: Arzukhanim Byramova is a 57-year-old widow, who has raised three children alone. Arzukhanim lives with her children in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. She has raised cattle for 5 years and finds this a good way to support her family. She would like a loan of $475 to buy 200 baling presses.

loans.use: To buy 200 baling presses

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul is married with 4 kids and his wife does the domestic chores and takes care of the kids. He started off working in a hardware store as an employee and he learnt how to run the business. For this reason, three years ago he decided to start his own hardware store. His business has steadily grown and this has allowed him to support his family, in particular his kids, 3 of which are still school age.

Raul would like a loan of $925 which he will pay back in 6 months. He will use this loan to buy merchandise for his store so that it will grow and he can achieve his goals. He would also like to attract more clients this way, and he would like his store to craete more jobs in the future too. He and his family thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Raúl esta casado y tiene cuatro hijos, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y cuidar a sus pequeños hijos. Él empezó trabajando en una ferretería como empleado y aprendió como se maneja el negocio y quiso también poder tener su negocio propio, fue así que decidió poner un negocio de ferretería con la cual ya tiene tres años. Poco a poco ha ido creciendo con su negocio y así ha podido mantener a su familia pero quiere continuar creciendo con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida y poder sacar adelante a sus hijos que son pequeños y están 3 de ellos en edad escolar.

Raúl solicita un préstamo por US $ 925 a 6 meses para pagar, utilizando este préstamo para comprar mercadería para su negocio y hacerlo crecer para poder lograr sus metas, y así también captar más clientes y hacer de su negocio algo que en un futuro genere mayores empleos, él y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que les das.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Comprar mercancia

loans.name: Mahfuza

texts.en:
Mahfuza H. , one of the best clients we have at Microinvest, has come to us for a loan of $350 to buy new soft drinks to sell to her customers.

Mahfuza always makes very productive use of her loans, adding inventory to her supply in a way that allows her to meet her customers' needs. She is also very polite and considerate, and her clients are always very happy with the service they receive from her. Because her business is doing so well, she is increasing her net worth month by month. Her business is located in the popular Panjshanbe market in Khujand, the second largest city in Tajikistan. At this market, she rents a container which she uses to keep her products cold.

Mahfuza is married, and uses all the money she makes to care for her two children and provide for their education.

loans.use: Purchase of additional drinks to sell

loans.name: Fikrat

texts.en: Fikrat (his brother is pictured) is a married man who lives in Salyan region, in the village of Khaladj.This 30-year-old man has been raising cattle for 8 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy a baling presses for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy baling presses

loans.name: Madina's Group

texts.en: Madina owns a small beauty salon. With the extra profits, she wants to buy a plot of land and pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer

loans.name: Ni Ketut Winarti

texts.id:
Every morning, at 9 am, Winarti feeds her 3 pigs. This job has become a routine after finishing other household chores. She owns an iron pen that in her backyard to contain her farmed pigs. This business helps her a lot in fulfilling her family's financial needs. Winarti has a child that she needs to take care of. She is highly motivated in pursuing this business as it helps her husband tremendously. Her husband's rice farming income is quite uncertain. She earns decent income. Each 6 months, she can sell 3 piglets and gain $132 profit. This earnings is used to pay for her child's tuition. Currently, Winarti needs additional funding of $275 to make improve her pig pen to improve her pig's health and quality. The rest of the loan will be used to purchase better quality feed to improve the health of the pigs.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Setiap pukul 09:00 wita, Winarti memberi makan 3 ekor babi peliharaannya. Pekerjaan ini tentunya sudah menjadi rutinitas kesehariaannya setelah selesai memasak didapur. Kandang besi yang dimiliki dibelakang rumah, sebagai tempat untuk menampung babi yang dipelihara. Usaha ini sangat membantu dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Winarti memiliki satu orang anak yang masih menjadi tanggungannya. Semangat untuk menukuni usaha yang dimilikinya, membuat suaminya sangat senang karena sangat meringankan beban sebagai kepala rumah tangga. Karena, penghasilan suami yang tidak menentu sebagai seorang petani . Keuntungan yang sudah dirasakan sangat memuaskan. Dalam 6 bulan, 3 bibit babi ini bisa di jual dan mendapatkan keuntungan Rp.1.200.000,- bersih. Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk biaya sekolah anaknya. Saat ini Winarti membutuhkan tambahan modal untuk usahanya sebesar Rp. 2.500.000.- yang akan dipergunakan untuk membuat kandang babi yang lebih permanen lagi supaya babinya bisa berkembang dengan baik tidak seperti sekarang ini tanpa atap. Sisanya nanti akan dipergunakan untuk membeli pakan ternak yang lebih berkwalitas demi pertumbuhan babinya

loans.use: Improve Pig Pen and Buy Feeds

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mrs. Mach T., 44, is a farmer and earns about one dollar a day. Her husband runs a motor-taxi as a business earning approximately two dollars a day. The couple has three children. Two are students in Phnom Penh while one stays at home to help with the farm.

Mrs. T. plans to purchase another motorbike for the son who stays at home so he can start a business as a motor-taxi driver.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and start a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Mrs. Nget K. is a housewife and she lives in the Ampil Village of the Kandal province. She is 43 years old and the mother of six children, four of whom are attending school while the other two are working. Her husband, Phy Phin, is a house constructor and can generate an income of approximately $1.75 per day. Mrs. Nget relies entirely on her husband and her children to support their family. Because of their family's poor living conditions, she is seeking a loan to buy dirt to fill in the front yard of her house.

loans.use: To purchsae dirt in order to fill in her family's front yard.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old and is a widow with 3 children, ages 18,16 and 14 years old. She also takes care of 4 other children, ages 15, 13 and 9 years old. Mary owns a small pharmacy store which she started in 2002. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more medicine for her business.

loans.use: To buy more medicine for her business.

loans.name: Thi Dong

texts.vi:
Mrs Đặng Thị Đông is 48 years old. She is requesting 2.242.000 VND. She needs capital to buy rice for resale. She has 2 children: 1 is working and the other one is still in school. Her family income is 130.000 VND a day. She likes SEDA program because the loan process is fast and simple.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Đặng Thị Đông (MS: 030029), năm nay 48 tuổi. Cô vay 2.242.000 VND để bổ xung vốn mua bán gạo. Cô có hai con đã đi làm còn một con đang đi học. Thu nhập của gia đình cô là 130.000 VND/ ngày. Cô rất thích tham gia chương trình vì thủ tục nhanh, thuận tiện.

loans.use: buy rice for resale

loans.name: Florence Nanziri's Group

texts.en:
Florence N. is a 36 year old single mother of four children, ranging in ages from 3 to 18 years old. She has operated a grocery in her neighborhood for the past 15 years, selling fruits and vegetables and other products. Florence first started the grocery because there weren’t any in her neighborhood. She started with just a few items, such as tomatoes and bananas, and gradually expanded her business to include more items.

Twice a week, Florence goes off early in the morning to the Owino Market, a large outdoor market near downtown Kampala, and buys about 150,000 (Ugandan shillings) or roughly $90 (US dollars) worth of produce. She transports the goods back to her grocery stall via motorcycle taxi (boda boda) or minibus taxi (matatu).

Being the first grocery to open in her neighborhood guaranteed Florence would have many customers, although there are now other groceries nearby. Florence's grocery is open seven days a week from 8:00 AM in the morning until 9:00 PM at night, except on Sunday when she opens at 9:00 AM after attending mass. She is helped by her sister who also works at the grocery.

Florence uses the profits from her business to pay school fees for her children. Profits are getting smaller as food prices go up. Florence has struggled to pay loans back in the face of unexpected expenses, but as she has been a member of MCDT for the last three years, she and her group have been able to repay approximately nine loans. Florence says that the loans make her life better, helping her to overcome challenges, in particular the school fees.

Florence currently lives in a house with three rooms, but she would like to build a larger house with five rooms. Her ultimate goal with a larger loan and sufficient savings is to build a bigger house for her family.

For now, with this new loan, Florence would like to buy a refrigerator. This will help her business because she will be able to sell cold drinks in addition to the produce she sells.

loans.use: Purchase a refrigerator to sell cold drinks

loans.name: Marina's Group

texts.en:
Marina is married. She is a 40-year-old mother of 3 children. She sells meat at the Nery García market on Saturdays and Sundays. She buys animals at the cattle fair in Ayacucho. She also works as a member of the teaching staff in the local school.

Ceverina is married. She is a 49-year-old mother of 7 children. 3 times a week, she travels to the regional fairs where she sells fruit and carrier bags wholesale to the merchants. She also buys cereals and cheeses which she resells wholesale in Ayacucho. 

Fortunata is married, is 59 and has 6 children. She sells clothes in different fairs in the surrounding villages. She buys her products in Ayacucho. She also weaves pullovers on a machine and sells them at fairs. She buys cereals and cheeses at these fairs, then she resells them to her neighbours in Ayacucho.

Marina, Ceverina and Fortunata belong to the Rubí Village Bank. They need respective loans of 400, 1000, and 800 Nuevos Soles to buy pigs, bananas, apples, peaches, pullovers, blouses, and pants.

They dream that their children might become professionals, about expanding their businesses, and having their own business capital.

loans.use: to buy pigs, bananas, apples, peaches, pullovers, blouses and pants.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok A., 42, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. 

Since 1980, she and her husband, Touch Seng, 60, have been working on their farmland growing rice to earn a living, and they are able to make around $1 per day. This couple has eight children, two are employed as garment workers and six others are students. 

Mrs. Sok would like a loan from Kiva via Credit, the local partner, of $400 to breed a heifer for a baby cow.

loans.use: To breed a heifer for a baby cow.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina R. B. is 38 years old and lives in Ayacucho, Perú with her three children. She sells groceries and clothes, including pants, traditional skirts, slips and sweaters at both local festivals and festivals in the rainforest in the northern part of Perú. She has been selling clothes for 6 months and groceries for one year. This loan will provide her with the resources to keep her business running; she will be able to buy more material to make her clothing, including needles, thread, and trim for her skirts and blouses. With the success of her business she hopes to be able to own her own clothing store and start other businesses.

loans.use: To buy more material to make her clothing, such as needles, thread, and trim for her skirts and blouses.

loans.name: Selia

texts.fr: Dame L. Selia est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est née à Dangbo dans le département de l'Ouémé. Mariée à AMIDOU Taho, revendeur de serrures elle est mère de 03 enfants. Initiée dès son jeune âge par sa grande mère paternelle au commerce, elle aidait cette dernière à vendre divers articles tels les seaux, les ustensiles de cuisine. Aujourd'hui elle revend essentiellement les pommes fruits et accessoirement divers produits de vente à solde. Actuellement elle a épuisé son stock de pomme fruit et compte sur ce troisième prêt de 100000fcfa pour saisir l'opportunité de mieux vendre.
texts.en:
Mrs. Selia L., 36, was born in Dangbo in Ouémé Province. Married to Taho Amidou, who sells locks, she is the mother of 3 children. Her paternal grandmother taught her salesmanship when she was just a girl, and she helped her grandmother sell various articles such as buckets and kitchen utensils. Today she sells mostly apples with some other reduced-price goods. Right now she is out of apples and is counting on this, her third loan in the amount of 100,000 F CFA to be able to make more sales.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 3 cases of apples, etc.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 47 años, es casada, tuvo 9 hijos, de los cuales ahora con ella viven solamente 5 hijos. Ella es agricultora y sus padres también, creció en ese ambiente; ahora que se ha casado su tarea se ha incrementado porque en horas de la mañana tiene que dedicarse a preparar los alimentos y después eso de 11.00am se va a la chacra llevando el almuerzo y de pasada a sus carneritos, para pastarlos o sujetarlos en estacas para que pueda trabajar en su chacra. En esta zona de Pachac todos los pobladores siembran papa en grandes cantidades y luego olluco, pero a Rosa le es más rentable sembrar olluco, porque nos dice que a pesar de ser muy sensible a hielo, que si le cae no produce como debe, la papa es más resistente pero se requiere mayor inversión. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará 12 sacos de urea para abonar sus tierras, cada saco cuesta S/.127, en total gastará S/. 1.224.
texts.en:
Rosa is 47 years old, married, with 9 children, though only 5 currently live with her. She, along with her parents, are farmers. She grew up in that environment; but now that she is married, her daily work has increased since in the morning she has to prepare food for her children, then after 11 am, she goes to work on the farm while taking lunch to her husband and taking her rams out to pasture. In the Pachac region where she lives, the people generally grow large quantities of potatoes and olluco (a Peruvian type of potato), but Rosa makes more money growing olluco since it is more weather-resistant; however, it requires a greater investment as well. This is the first loan she has requested from MFP. With the loan, she will purchase 12 sacks of urea to fertilize her land. Each sack costs ~$40, in total, she will spend $480.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for her land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to start a motorcycle-taxi business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John M. is married and has three children. The highest level of schooling he has received is junior high school. 

John sells electrical gadgets and parts in Elmina, which he has done since 2002. His wife operates a chop bar. John uses his income to pay for the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses for his family.  He is requesting a loan to purchase more electrical items to meet the increased demand from his costumers. The profits from the expanded business will allow John to continue building a house for his family, which he has not been able to complete due to inadequate funding.

loans.use: to purchase more electrical items to sell

loans.name: Mike

texts.en: Mike A. is 60 years old and married with 10 children. He has a bakery where he bakes breads and meat pies which he learnt how to bake in Switzerland and in Germany. He is requesting the loan amount of N 80,000 to purchase more baking materials. He says thanks to Kiva and all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baking materials

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: la Sra. Maria G. cuenta con un comedor que se conoce con el nombre de COMEDOR EMMANUEL tiene mas de 30 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y durante todo este tiempo le ha ido muy bien ya que con este negocio logro que sus hijos estudiaran y tambien logro remodelar su casa de habitacion, en esta comunidad ella fue la primera que puso un negocio de este tipo y eso le ayudo a obtner su casa y muchas cosas mas, tiene una hija que le ayuda a elaborar la comida que vende y una de las metas de ella es poder poner un hospedaje para que los clientes que comen en su negocio si quieren dormir alli lo puedan hacer. la mayoria de la gente que viaja come en su comedor y a veces ellos tienen que regresarse hasta el Paraiso para poder conseguir un lugar en donde descanzar. esto queda a 17 kilometros de su local.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria G. has a restaurant called Emmanuel Restaurant. She has been in this business for more than 30 years and during all this time it has gone very well, with this business she was able to provide her children an education and also remodel her home. She was the first to open a business of this type in her community and this helped her obtain her home and many other things. She has a daughter who helps her make the food that she sells and one of her goals is to be able to provide lodging so that if the customers that come to her business want to sleep they can do so there. The majority of the people that travel eat in her restaurant and at time they have to return to Paraiso in order to find a place to rest, and that is 17 kilometers from her locale.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, butter, beans, chicken, cheese, spaghetti

loans.name: Yawoa Akofa

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier de Totsi à lomé, elle est une revendeuse de sacs de sortie pour dame, elle exerce son activité près du marché local de Totsi, ce qui lui permet d’attirer beaucoup de clientes, elle a commencé à exercé cette activité en 2005, actuellement elle n’a plus beaucoup de marchandises elle demande alors  auprès de WAGES un autre crédit pour l’achat de 50 sacs de sorties et des produits de beauté. Elle est mariée et  a 03 enfants.
texts.en:
Yawoa A. lives in the Lomé neighborhood of Totsi and sells women’s handbags. She runs the business near Totsi’s local market, which enables her to attract a lot of customers. She began the business in 2005. She currently has very little merchandise left and is therefore asking WAGES for another loan to buy 50 handbags and some beauty products. She is married and has three children. .

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy women's handbags

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreypov U. (who is in the picture above with her mother and children) is 34 years old and her husband, Mr. Veasna Teang, is 36 years old. They live in a small village that is a suburb of Phnom Penh.  They were married in 2000 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. One of her children attends school and the other two are still small. 

Sreypov has been selling grocery items for ten years. Her husband has been a garment factory worker for over five years. She hopes to purchase more grocery items for her stock as she prepares to sell on the Khmer New Year holiday, because on that day, the price of grocery items will be high. She is requesting her first loan of $500 to make the purchases and to buy an ice machine.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for resale and to buy an ice machine.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Mrs. Susan D. is 50 years old and a resident at Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with 5 children. Two of them are married and three have their own job. Her husband is a carpenter and also helps in farming, specifically growing cassava, which is their primary activity.

They own a little parcel of land, and part of it is mortgaged. Now they plan to redeem it. Mrs D. has been a member of Paglaum MPC since March 2005 with an excellent loan repayment performance.

She is applying for Php20,000 to buy farm fertilizers and pesticides, while part of it will be used to redeem the mortgaged land. She dreams that some day, she will be the one supplying cassava in the market and have enough finances at her age.

loans.use: To purchase farm fertilizer and pesticides, and help repay a mortgage on her land.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es: Dn. Genaro vive solo, su familia cuenta con dos hijos que son independientes, cada uno de ellos con actividad propia, uno de sus hijos vive cerca de su casa, los otros hijos viven en trinidad donde también colaboran al cliente cuando viajan llevando productos. Genaro se dedica a la venta de relojes, radios, dvd´s, y otros artículos electricos de precios económicos. Genaro cuenta con una competencia media ya que al ser ambulante busca diferentes mercados para sus productos. El destino del crédito solicitado fue para incrementar su capital de trabajo ya que estaba viajando a traer mercadería por mayor del interior. Genaro es cliente antiguo de la institución y siempre demostró ser responsable y puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Genaro lives alone. He has two adult children who live independently, each with their own work. One of his children lives close to him, while the others live in Trinidad, where they also help Genaro by bringing him merchandise when they travel. Genaro sells watches, radios, dvds and other inexpensive electric goods. He has some competition and as a mobile vendor seeks out different markets to sell his products. The loan he has requested is for the purpose of increasing his working capital, since he was traveling inland to bring back merchandise bought at wholesale. Genaro is a long-time client of the institution and has always shown himself to be responsible and punctual with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Saldivar Poty Group

texts.en:
The committee of women named Saldivar Poty was formed on March 22, 2007, thanks to Mrs. Esther Silver, who makes and sells cleaning products. She contacted an advisor during a weekly meeting that took place in the neighborhood, inquiring about how to form a committee of enterprising women. Once part of the program, she was able to group 15 women, which are now working together in their 8th cycle within the program. 

During the course of time, the group has experienced some inconveniences, as the daughter of the General Director was admitted to the hospital, and other participants were sick and bedridden. However, they responded without a single problem in repayments, and in this way the group has been able to progress, continuing with the program until now. 

The average credit give per participant is 735,000 Gs, which goes to many different activities such as the sale of: food, hardware, grocery store products, clothing, lingerie, cosmetics, fruit, vegetables, cleaning products, crochet, etc. 

All of them do their own activities in order to earn money, and mutually help each other achieve common objectives within the group and with the Paraguayan Foundation. They participate actively in weekly meetings and do an impeccably supportive job. 

1. Ma. Esther S. - Cleaning product sales 
2. Justina L. - Food sales 
3. Rosalina B. - Cleaning product sales 
4. Gladys N. - Clothing sales 
5. Juana C. - Lingerie sales 
6. Eustacia O. - Sale of fruit and vegetables 
7. Miryan C. - Cleaning product sales 
8. Francisca B. - Clothing and bag sales 
9. Marlene B. - Hardware store 
10. Ma. Mabelín L. - Polyethylene sales 
11. Dominga P. - Cleaning product sales, and crochet 
12. Marcelina C. - Clothing sales 
13. Rosa Ortiz - Sale of fruit and vegetables 
14. Evarista F. - Lingerie sales 
15. Johana L. - Small grocery store

loans.use: To purchase items for their individual businesses

loans.name: Socorro De Los Santos

texts.es: Socorro de los Santos R. P. tiene la edad de 54 años, tiene 5 hijos y solo 2 de sus hijos están a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella da inicio a este oficio por la necesidad que tenia  de ofrecerles a sus hijos el pan de cada día, Socorro ofreció sus productos a ciertos vecinos, mas tarde por medio de la recomendación de algunas amigas decide ofrecer los productos en algunas oficinas, es aquí donde se da cuenta que este negocio es muy rentable y decide salir adelante con el. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pinturas de uñas, pinturas de labios, cremas y perfumes. El sueño de Socorro es establecerse en determinado lugar para obtener más clientes.
texts.en:
Socorro de los Santos R. P. is 54 years old; she has five sons, though she only cares for two of them. For over four years she has sold general merchandise. She began her business out of the need to feed her children. Socorro sold her products to certain neighbors, but later, upon the recommendation of some friends, she decided to sell her products in various offices. She then realized that her business could be very profitable and decided to continue developing it. Socorro's dream is to one day have a permanent establishment in order to gain customers. This loan will help Socorro purchase merchandise; specifically, nail polishes, lipsticks, creams and perfumes.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty supplies for her business

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea confecciona mantas para cholitas (mujeres que usan polleras), que  comercializa en las ferias populares de la ciudad de El Alto, siendo esta su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos;  vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de German Buchs 123 Alto Lima de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra materia prima (Tela) para confeccionar mayor cantidad de mantas, pues su mercado está creciendo.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Andrea makes shawls for “cholitas” (women that wear skirts), which she sells in the popular markets of the city of El Alto. This is her main source of income, which she uses to support her three children. She lives in her parents’ house located in the German Busch 123 Alto Lima zone of the city of El Alto.

She will use this loan to buy raw material (fabric) to make more shawls because her market is increasing.

This is her first loan with Impro. The evaluation completed qualifies her for the approval of the loan for which she has applied.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric for her shawl making business.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a member of the Twiga borrower group in Kola, Morogoro. She is a 27-year-old single woman.

Rukia has had her own business selling charcoal and soap for six months. She works for three hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 45,000 Tanzania shillings (about $34).

This is Rukia’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 150,000 Tsh in order to to buy more charcoal and soap. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Rukia hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Enma

texts.en:
Enma has a business selling used clothing in the small towns near the city of Pucallpa where she lives. She is 52 years old and married with six children, all of whom are independent adults. Enma’s husband works as a driver. Enma has been engaged in the business of selling used clothing for many years. She sometimes also sells local fruits and vegetables when they are in season.

Enma has been working with Kiva's partner, Manuela Ramos, for four years and she is a member of the communal bank “San Fernando II”. She invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in vegetables for sale. Enma plans to invest this loan of 1300 soles in purchasing used clothing for sale. Enma would like to have her own clothing shop one day. In this way, she would not have to travel around to visit her customers – they would come to her. She also wants to begin selling fruits from other regions of Peru, particularly the coastal region.

loans.use: To buy used clothing for sale

loans.name: Alba Nubia

texts.es:
Alba Nubia R. M. es una mujer esforzada; casada, madres de tres hijos y de mucho potencial para los negocios.

Ella se dedica a la compra venta de verduras desde que era muy joven, oficio que aprendió de su abuela con quien iba a trabajar. Hace tres años dejo de trabajar con su abuela e inicio el trabajo sola, ahora ayudada de su hermana y cuñado, ellos se encargan de comprar en diferentes departamentos a pequeños productores frutas y verduras como tomate, chiltoma (Pimiento dulce), plátano, piña, entre otros.

Para poder trasladar el producto tienen que alquilar camiones o camionetas, lo cual incurre en un gasto extra. Por lo tanto con este crédito iniciara los trámites para la adquisición de un carro cómodo que le facilite el transporte de sus productos y seguir ampliando el negocio.

Este es su primer ciclo como clienta individual, pero tiene mucho tiempo en trabajar en grupo, sabemos que ella es muy responsable y que nunca ha quedado mal.
texts.en:
Alba Nubia R. M. is the married mother of three children. She is very hard-working and has great potential for business.
She has bought and sold vegetables since she was very young, when she learned the trade from her grandmother. Three years ago she stopped working with her grandmother and started on her own, now with the help of her sister and brother-in-law. They buy tomatoes, chiltoma (sweet pepper), plantains and pineapple, among others, from small fruit and vegetable growers in different departments of Nicaragua.
They have to rent large and small trucks to transport the produce, costing them extra. This loan will therefore be the first step in acquiring a comfortable vehicle to facilitate transport and continue expanding the business.
This is her first loan cycle as an individual client, but she has a lot of experience working in a group. We know that she is very responsible and has never failed to make a repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a new vehicle

loans.name: Miguel Geronimo

texts.es: Miguel Geronimo T. Ríos tiene 42 años. Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que siempre le ha dado lo necesario a su familia. Miguel tiene que recorrer muchos lugares en busca de clientes por lo que tiene que ofrecer sus productos. A pesar de si edad es un hombre que ha luchado para obtener lo necesario para su familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de camisetas, pantalones, faldas todos los financiamiento han sido de gran ayuda para su negocio. el deseo de Miguel es seguir manteniendo su propio negocio ya que es su principal fuente de vida e ingresos.
texts.en:
Miguel Geronimo T. Ríos is 42 years old. He buys and sells clothing. He has dedicated himself to this business for over 12 years; through this business he has been able to always give his family what is needed. Miguel has to travel to many places in search for clients to offer his products. Despite his age, he is a man that has worked hard to obtain what his family needs. The loan that he is requesting will be used as work capital to purchase t-shirts, pants, and skirts. All the loans that he has obtained have been a great help to his business. Miguel hopes to continue maintaining his own business given that it is his main source life and income.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase t-shirts, pants, and skirts).

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania L., who lives in Hacienda Sarait, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental, is married to Rey Largavita. She's a hardworking mother who wants to provide financial security for her two sons who, although already 25 and 26, have special needs because of their inborn disabilities. She is now 57 years old and worries how her sons will fend for themselves when she and her husband pass on. This is why Epifania and Rey are working very hard now to set aside some money to provide for their sons' future financial security. 

As ambulant food vendors, they do a lot of walking. On a regular working day, Epifania and Rey wake up at dawn to go to the public market to buy the ingredients for their menu of the day. Epifania prepares and cooks all of the food they plan to sell, then Rey helps her pack the food into single-serve packets and arrange them equally in separate baskets. Once their food baskets are packed, Epifania takes her sons to her a neighbor she trusts to take care of them while they are working. That done, Epifania and Rey take their respective baskets and go on separate selling routes around the town, visiting their regular customers first. By walking, they increase their probability for a sale because people they meet on the street usually stop to buy the packed food they offer. When all the food is sold, they go home to rest and get things ready to do the same routine again the following day.

In July 2001, Epifania joined NWTF-Project Dungganon to borrow additional capital for her food vending business. With the additional capital, she was able to increase the food volume and also expand the variety of food that she and her husband sell. Her cooking has become so popular with other members of NWTF-PD that she now brings food to sell during the weekly center meetings that she attends. With the loans that provide her with much-needed working capital, her business has improved a lot. She earns a net profit of 8,000 Philippine pesos per month on the average, and it has been a great help for her family, especially in allowing her to afford the maintenance medicines that her sons need, as well as pay for all their household expenses.

Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 on her 15th loan cycle was fully paid within term and without any delays in the weekly installments. Now she is borrowing PHP 18,000 to buy a gas stove to cook food much faster, and the balance will again be used as revolving working capital to buy the daily ingredients of her products.

Epifania is shown in the attached picture with her food offerings during one of the center meetings in the NWTF-PD Center house.

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase a gas stove and as additional capital for food vending

loans.name: Kivork

texts.en:
Kivork is a 46-year-old man who lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Kivork works with diamonds. He actually installs diamonds on watches, rings, necklaces, bracelets, earrings, etc. He has done this work since 2000. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to do maintenance work on his machine, the one he uses for the diamonds. This is the first time that Kivork has requested a loan.

Kivork is special in his work because he does very precise and clean work. His clients are jewelry shops. When Kivork first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. He decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on expanding his work by opening another store.

loans.use: To do maintenance work on his diamond machine

loans.name: Gene Keni Achola Hellen Group

texts.en:
A. Hellen is forty-nine years of age; she is a widow and treasurer of her group. She is blessed with six children, all schooling.

Hellen runs the business of purchasing cereals, that is: maize, which she has been doing so far for three years. She is requesting the loan to raise the stock of her business by purchasing at least seven or more bags of maize.

Hellen is a courageous businesswoman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase at least seven or more bags of maize

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie S., from the village of Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, is 42 years old, married and has four grown children. To make a living, Vergie owns and operates a business whose income comes primarily from buying and selling shells in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Vergie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional equipment for buying shells for sale, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of the family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for buying shells to sell

loans.name: Sitba

texts.en:
Sitba B. sells onions in the market. She is requesting a loan to buy other items like tomatoes, maize, and groundnut paste, to sell. Sitba is 25 years old and is married to a farmer. She has 5 children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy food to sell

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita C. is from the village of Buenavista, Oroquieta City in Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Tita is single. To make a living, Tita owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, cooking oil, and canned goods in the local community. Tita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2008, Tita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Tita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Tita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Margaret Mwaka

texts.en:
Margaret K. is aged 35 years, is married and has two daughters. She lives with her family in Mariakani where she runs a children's wear store. She has been in this business for four years now and she confesses that her business has been doing well. She also tailors new African clothes to supplement her income.

Margaret has been in KADET for several years and is now accessing her third loan. With the money, she plans to purchase more children's wear and to also purchase garments to make some African clothes called vitenges.

Having only reached primary education, Margaret hopes and believes that through working in her business, she will be able to educate her children up to college level.

loans.use: To purchase more children's wear and also to purchase garments to make African clothes

loans.name: Fatou Ablaye

texts.fr: Fatou Ablaye F. est une femme de 55 ans, elle est veuve avec 3 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 5 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter des bœufs et moutons, de les engraisser et de les revendre au bout de 4 ou 5 mois. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de prendre partiellement en charge ses enfants.
texts.en:
Fatou Ablaye F. is a 55-year old woman who is a widow and has three children in her care. She has been a member of the Village Bank for five years. Her business consists of buying oxen and sheep, fattening them and reselling them after four to five months. Her profits will allow her to boost her savings and to share responsibility for her children.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her livestock selling business

loans.name: Maria Aleen

texts.en:
Maria Aleen E. is from Barangay 3, Tangub City. She is 41 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Maria Aleen owns and operates a business making and selling food, preparing and selling food for snacks like "puto" (rice cake) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Maria Aleen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Maria Aleen is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Pélagie

texts.fr: Z. Pélagie est née en 1968 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Il y a huit ans que Pélagie habite à Agblangandan dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji.
