Pélagie est mariée à BONOU Basile et mère de deux enfants. Pélagie a un autre enfant à sa charge.  Pélagie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Pélagie n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Il y a 10 ans, Pélagie s’est mise dans la vente de pâte de maïs et de l’igname frite de façon secondaire.  C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Pélagie s’approvisionne.  Pélagie est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant bénéficié de six crédits auparavant. Les crédits ont été bien remboursés. Pélagie sollicite un septième crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement et élever le niveau de son activité ; ce qui lui permettra de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Pélagie Z. was born in 1968 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. For the past eight years she has lived in Agblangandan in the municipality of Sèmè-Podji. Pélagie is married to Basile BONOU and has two children of her own. She also has another child in her care. She lives with her husband and children. The couple cover the household expenses between them. Pélagie has never been to school. Ten years ago she set herself up in the sale of corn dough, and she also sells fried yam as a secondary activity. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. Pélagie is an old client of ALIDé having already benefited from six loans in the past. The loans were all repaid without incident. Pélagie is applying for a seventh loan from ALIDé to strengthen her working capital and expand her business; this will allow her to satisfy customer demand more easily.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn and condiments

loans.name: Joike

texts.en: Joike is married with 2 children. She is a Yoruba by tribe but she lives and works in Asaba, Delta state. She sells plastics and mouth-watering Nigerian cooked foods such as rice, beans, egusi (melon) soup and drinks. Her customers love her cooked foods. Joike loves this business because of the one-to-one interaction with her customers. She hopes to have a classic restaurant in the future. She hopes for business expansion as this will attract more sales and increase her profit. Joike is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 120,000 to purchase more plastics, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more plastics, drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Kawoto North Christine Kakande Group

texts.en: Christine K. is a hardworking businesswoman who is a forty-year-old widow with six children, two of whom are going to school. She is also looking after two of her siblings who go to school. She has been selling clothing for over three years. She is using the loan to purchase more clothes to sell. She is a determined businesswoman whose future hope is to construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
José Luis C. C. y su esposa son padres de familia de tres niños pequeños, por quienes tienen que trabajar para ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida y un patrimonio.
En este momento José Luis desea impermeabilizar su vivienda y pintarla por dentro y por fuera, mas que todo para que en temporada de lluvia el agua no trasmine y pueda mojar algún aparato electrónico y pueda hacer un corto circuito en su vivienda; así ocasionar un accidente grave. Es por esto que vuelve a pedir el apoyo para poder realizar su proyecto.
texts.en:
José Luis C. C. and his wife are the parents of three small children, for whom they need to work to offer them a better quality of life and legacy. Currently José Luis wishes to seal and paint his home both inside and out, more than anything so that in the rainy season the water does not leak and soak their electronic appliances, which would create a short circuit in his home and create an unfortunate accident. It is for this reason that he is requesting the support to complete his project.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seal his home

loans.name: Sofonios

texts.en:
Sofonios Y. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City. He is 45 years old. Sofonios is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Sofonios is engage into peddling of cinnamon and other variety of bread in the local community. He buys bread directly from the bread house and then peddles it to the small stores at his village. Sofonios has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Sofonios joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sofonios has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used as additional working capital. Sofonios is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Sofonios from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Normalita's Group

texts.en:
Normalita L. is from the village of Brgy. Paitan, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 47 years old. Normalita is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Normalita is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Normalita owns & operates a general store selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Normalita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Normalita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Normalita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Normalita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Normalita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Eldard

texts.en:
Diehard agriculturalist T. Eldard has been maintaining a banana plantation and a pineapple garden for more than fifteen years in Kahija, Bushenyi, and this fetches him 80,000 Ugandan Shillings per week. Though this is not enough to sustain his family of eight children, he has persevered to keep it growing.

Eldard's aim in taking up this loan is to enable him to buy mulches for his plantations and also to hire additional laborers as he looks at his expansion plan and thinks of transporting his produce to bigger markets. This will help him earn more revenue and enable him to live a more sustaining life.

loans.use: To purchase mulches and hire more laborers

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene L., 45, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Antonio L. Jr., 53, a welder, they are blessed in their marriage. Managing her own variety store for six years now, Arlene makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that her family can have a better life.

Arlene has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now, regularly attending their weekly fellowship meetings and consistently paying her weekly dues. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative, using the money she borrows to expand and improve her businesses.

To ensure the continued success of her business, she is now requesting a PHP 37,000 loan to be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business. Arlene will buy replenishment stock for her variety store. 

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she and her husband can live a well-off life.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Towards buying additional stocks to be incorporated into her current product inventory.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La comunidad de Rayanniyoc está ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad Cusco, esta de camino a la ciudad de Pisaq. Los pobladores de la comunidad se dedican a la ganadería y agricultura.

La socia Luisa pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc”, tiene 30 años y tiene cuatro hijos. 

Su actividad económica principal es la crianza, compra y venta animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes. Luisa lleva sus productos a la ciudad del Cusco al mercado de “Huancaro” los días sábados y al mercado de “Cascaparo” los días lunes. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes. Ella vive en la comunidad de Rayanniyoc del distrito de Taray de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco.
texts.en:
The community of Rayanniyoc is located 30 minutes away from Cusco is on the road going to the city of Pisaq. The residents of this community engage in livestock breeding and agriculture.

Luisa is a member of the Communal Bank “Villa Rayanniyoc”. She is 30 years old and has four chidren. Her main business activity is raising, buying, and selling small animals such as guinea pigs. Luisa brings her products to the city of Cusco to sell at the Huancaro Market on Saturdays and the Cascaparo Market on Mondays. She needs a loan to buy more animals, such as guinea pigs. Luisa lives in the community of Rayanniyoc in the district of Taray, Calca Province, Department of Cusco.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase guinea pigs

loans.name: Aya

texts.en: Aya D. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs in the restaurant. Aya is 39 years old and is Married with a husband who is a medical officer. She has 3 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for rent.

loans.use: To stock more foodstuffs in the restaurant.

loans.name: Edarlina

texts.en:
At the age of 43, Edarlina C. is still working hard for her family. Edarlina is married and has two adult children. The family lives in the village of Manaoag. To make a living, Edarlina owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Edarlina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP during harvest season.

In 2008, Edarlina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edarlina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Edarlina is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Edarlina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel de 58 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en compañía de su hijo Israel de 26 años en su casa propia. El estar solo hizo que él busque una actividad a la cual pueda dedicarle todo su tiempo, puesto que su hijo trabaja independientemente y casi nunca para en casa, es por ello que optó por la venta de calzado. Esta actividad varía según las temporadas, es así que en la actualidad él viene dedicándose a la venta de sandalias con lo cual esta obteniendo buenos resultados. Su forma de trabajo es trasladarse por diferentes zonas del mercado de la zona en la que vive con su triciclo, en el cual pone toda la mercadería que posee para hacerla más vistosa. Manuel se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 5 años por lo que gusta mucho su trabajo, pues gracias a su carisma ha hecho muy buenos amigos. En un futuro el desea tener un negocio más fijo en algún mercado concurrido pero por el momento se siente muy bien con esta actividad. Es su segundo crédito con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más mercadería puesto que tiene las esperanzas de mejorar sus ingresos gracias a las buenas ventas que obtendrá.
texts.en:
Manuel is 58 and a very hard-working man. He lives with his 26-year-old son, Israel, in their own home. Being alone made him look for an activity to which he can dedicate all fo his time. His son works independently and is never home, so he chose to sell shoes. This activity varies according to the seasons. Currently he sells sandals and is seeing good results. He travels to different markets in the area where he lives with his tricycle, in which he puts all of the merchandise he has to make it more eye-catching. Manuel has done this work for 5 years, and he likes it a lot. Thanks to his charisma, he has made some very good friends. In the future, he hopes to have a more established business in a well-visited market, but at the moment, he feels good about his work. This is his second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and he has always characterized himself by being very punctual with his payments. With the loan he is requesting, he will purchase more merchandise because he has hopes of improving his income thanks to the sales he will obtain.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire more shoes to increase his income

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en:
Mrs. S. and her family members are shown in the photo above. She is married with two young kids who attend primary school, while her husband helps be responsible for the family by growing crops on their own farmland.

To generate a daily income, S. built a store next to her house where she sells cooking ingredients, sweets (candies), cakes, and soft drinks to people who are nearby villagers or passers-by.

Since the farming season is coming, S. has requested a loan for her husband to use to plant a potato crop.

loans.use: To enable her husband to plant a potato crop

loans.name: Kisa Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: She started off by selling firewood and charcoal before she branched off into her current clothes and food businesses that are now 20 years. 42-year-old M. Hasifa belongs to Kisa development group Mukono. The happily married mother of six says her customers also cut across the board from the lowest common denominators to middle class people who live within the vicinity of Kalagi, her operating area. In a month, she says, she makes 200,000 shillings and with this loan, this hard working lady says she wants to buy more bales of clothes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of clothes to sell

loans.name: Tawopaneh Group

texts.en:
Fatmata B.  (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group of two entrepreneurs. Born thirty-six years ago in Magburaka town, Fatmata is married and has five children.  For ten years now, Fatmata has been selling fish, salt, Maggi cubes, palm oil, etc. Fatmata will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to expand her business; she will buy fish, salt, Maggi, palm oil, etc. 

This is the first loan that Fatmata and her group member have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Buys fish, salt, Maggi cubes, palm oil, etc.

loans.name: Gelegjamts

texts.en:
Gelegjamts C., age 66, operates a shoe-making business in his town, with the help of his wife. As a younger man, between 1963 and 1998, he used to work as a master in the factory. He has been making a variety of shoes in his home since 2006 and has gained much experience as a manufacturer. 

Gelegjamts is a modest, open-minded, and helpful man who works very hard. He lives with his family in Huvsgul province, Mongolia, in a "ger," which is a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. For the future, he hopes to have his own workplace and continue providing for his family. He is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase fabrics and materials used in making his shoes.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and materials for shoe-making

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (stone, sand, cement, a door, and other items)

loans.name: Gulbaram's Group

texts.en:
Gulbaram is a woman of 47, married to a farming association member. The couple raised three grown children, although two daughters still live with their parents; their elder brother is married and works to support his own family. Since 1999, the family has had a small trading business selling fruit and vegetables. In order to increase sales, Gulbaram has managed to build a real shop. Now she hopes to obtain a loan to develop her business further and increase the family income. In future Gulbaram plans to improve her living conditions.   

	--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (being environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Sumaira's Group

texts.en:
Sumaira is a resident of Multan which is the fourth largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and tombs. She lives there in the area named Chowk Shaheedan with her family in a two room brick house. She came here after her marriage to M. N. who works abroad. 
She supports her family financially by operating a business selling clothes. She buys clothes from the wholesale markets of Multan and sells them to customers in her local area, particularly to rich families. She has a number of clients and she sells a large number of clothes to them every month and earns good profits. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her father’s business, selling roasted chicken. He has a roasted chicken stall in the market where he sells roasted chicken with French fries to his customers and generates income for the family. Due to his food's good taste, people from many areas comes to his stall to buy a large quantity of roasted chicken from him. 
With the loan, he will buy chickens, spices and cooking oil etc in larger quantities in order to prepare his customers' orders and increase his income. 
Sumaira is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her family. 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sumaira.

loans.use: To buy chickens, spices, cooking oil for roasted chicken stall business

loans.name: Gladys Del Rosario

texts.es:
Gladys de 38 años de edad es soltera, tiene 2 hijos, uno de 5 y el otro estudiando la universidad, labora para el MINED desde hace 18 años como docente en el Colegio Floresmilda D.. 

Esta solicitando su 4to credito con el objetivo de cambiar el techo de su casa que se encuentra en mal estado y al mismo tiempo cambiar los pilares de madera que con la humedad se estan deteriorando, para asi brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. 

Sueña con poder ir mejorando poco a poco sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia, pues son su razon de ser.
texts.en:
Gladys is 38 years old, single, and has two children.  One child is 5 years old and the other studies at the university.  She has worked for the Ministry of Education as a teacher at Floresmilda D. High School for 18 years.

She is asking for her 4th loan in order to repair the roof of her home that is in poor condition and also change the wooden pillars that are deteriorating because of the humidity.  This will allow her family to enjoy a better quality of life.

She dreams of being able to improve the living conditions of her family because they are her reason for being.

loans.use: Repair the roof and pillars of her home

loans.name: La Ilusion De Huitzililla Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama La Ilusión de Huitzililla, se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Huitzililla, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México. este grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas, ellas son la señora Ángela F. L. va a comprar con su préstamo una vaca, azúcar, fruta para hacer el yogurt para surtir su negocio, la señora Marlen T. P. va a comprar refrescos, carne, verduras para la venta de los tacos, para surtir su negocio, la señora Adriana M. Pérez va a comprar escobas, cepillos, sosa liquida, ganchos de ropa para surtir su negocio, Félix G. Azorín va a comprar huaraches por mayoreo para surtir su negocio, la señora Petra E. Anzurez va a comprar topper para surtir sus pedidos y va a comprar de abarrotes aceite, jabón, azúcar, la señora Delfina F. M. va a comprar topper para tener bien surtido su negocio, la señora Rosalía L. S. va a comprar artículos como fibras, estropajos, escobetas, cepillos, lazos, y pinzas par la ropa, la señora Lucila Hernández Cárdenas va a comprar Brasier, pantimedia, lencería para surtir sus pedidos que tiene, la señora María Eugenia M. Pérez va a comprar aceite, jabón, azúcar, papel higiénico, chiles, mayonesa, refrescos para surtir su negocio. 
La señora Lucila Hernández Cárdenas es la representante del grupo, ella tiene 31 años de edad, estudio hasta el 2º. Año de preparatoria, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos Abrahán tiene 4 años y va a preescolar, Ismael tiene 3 años, la señora Lucila solicitó su préstamo para surtir su negocio de Lencería va a comprar brasier, panty, lencería, ella inicio su negocio hace 10 años aprendió sola, vende lencería por catálogo anda ofreciendo sus productos fuera de su casa con sus vecinos y las personas que viven en Huitzililla, su negocio es ambulante va caminando o en bicicleta, su negocio es importante porque le da beneficios, ella maneja como quiere su negocio y se siente orgullosa de vender de lo mejor, sus clientas son las muchachas, las señoras y los caballeros y les ofrece blusas, sostenes, pantaletas, baby dool, tangas, pantalones deportivos, su negocio es conocido porque anda casa por casa y por la marca de los productos que vende. 
Su negocio enfrenta la competencia y otras 2 personas que venden los mismos productos en Huitzililla, las ganancia a veces las va ahorrando y a veces las vuelve a invertir, la señora Lucila quiere ampliar su negocio meter más mercancía de otras marcas y lo piensa lograr a través de los prestamos, su negocio ha ayudado a su familia económicamente, ella tiene planes de progresar y sus sueños de seguir adelante, seguir creciendo en su negocio y está feliz con este préstamo que le dan porque va a surtir su negocio, las mejorías que desea para el futuro de sus hijos son que vivan mejor, tratar que no les falte nada y piensa que este préstamo le va a ayudar invirtiéndolo y echándole ganas al negocio. 
Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias a ustedes podemos tener nuestros negocio, gracias por apoyarnos y ayudarnos”. Huitzililla es un pueblo de clima caluroso y seco, en tiempos de lluvia se pone verde y les gusta porque es el lugar donde viven.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called 'La Ilusión de Huitzililla'.  It is located in the community of Huitzililla, Ayala, in the State of Morelos, Mexico.  The group has 9 female members who know each other and are neighbors.  The members are:
Ángela F. L. who will use her loan to buy a cow, sugar and fruit for making yogurt to stock her business
Marlen T. P. who will buy soft drinks, meat and vegetables for making tacos, to stock her business
Adriana M. Pérez who will buy brooms, brushes, caustic soda and clothes hangers, to stock her business
Félix G. Azorín who will buy rubber sandals wholesale, to stock her business
Petra E. Anzurez who will buy sports shoes to fill her orders and also groceries, oil, soap and sugar
Delfina F. M. who will buy sports shoes to keep her business well stocked
Rosalía L. S. who will buy items such as scouring pads, small brooms, brushes, rope and clothes pegs
Lucila Hernández Cárdenas who will buy bras, pantyhose and lingerie to fill her orders
María Eugenia M. Pérez who will buy oil, soap, sugar, toilet paper, chilis, mayonnaise and soft drinks to stock her business.

Lucila Hernández Cárdenas is the group's representative.  She is 31 years old and studied up to the second year of high school.  She is married and has two children: 4 year-old Abrahán who goes to pre-school and 3 year-old Ismael.  Lucila requested her loan to stock her lingerie business.  She will buy bras, pantyhose and lingerie.  She set up her business 10 years ago and is self taught.  She sells lingerie through a catalog.  She walks outside offering her products for sale to her neighbors and the people who live in Huitzililla.  Her business is itinerant, she walks or travels by bicycle.  Her business is important because it provides her with benefits.  She manages her business as she wishes and she feels proud of selling the best products.  Her customers are girls, women and men.  She offers them blouses, bras, underpants, baby doll pajamas, tanga briefs and sports pants.

Lucila's business is well known because she goes door to door and it is also well known for the brand of products that she sells.  Her business faces competition and there are another 2 people who sell the same products in Huitzililla.  She sometimes saves her profits and sometimes she re-invests them in her business.

Lucila would like to expand her business, stocking more merchandise of different brands.  She is planning to achieve this goal through loans.  Her business has helped her family financially.  She has plans to make progress and has dreams of getting ahead in life and, continuing to grow her business.  She is happy to be receiving this loan because she will use it to stock her business.  The improvements Lucila would like to make in the future are for her children to live better and to ensure that they don't want for anything.  She believes that this loan will help her.  She will invest it in her business and it will help improve her business.

The members of the group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad "Thanks to you we can have our own businesses.  Thank you for supporting us and helping us".  Huitzililla is a town with a warm, dry climate.  When it rains everything becomes very green and the women like it because it is the place where they live.

loans.use: To buy bras, pantyhose and lingerie to fill her orders

loans.name: Hana

texts.en:
Hanan is married to Muhammad A. H. and they have four daughters and four sons. Hanan's daughters are in school and university. Her sons who are old enough work with their father in the shoe store they own. One of her sons works on the other side of the wall.

Hanan's husband bought a large amount of shoes to sell during the holidays and feasts and didn't have enough liquidity to pay the full amount in cash. Therefore, he needed a $1,000 loan, which Hanan took out from FATEN to help her husband pay for the shoes.

Hanan's husband appears in the photo as Hanan is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of shoes

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is a married woman who lives in Pamplona, Negros Oriental. She earns her living fattening pigs. Her husband, Simplicio V. Jr., age 35, works as a laborer. They have two children who are 6 and 10 years old. Maricel joined NWTF-Project Dungganon on November 22, 2004, because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and by the sweat of her brow, Maricel has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 18,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 15,000 PHP, thus improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her seventh cycle loan, she is borrowing 25,000 PHP which she intends to use to purchase feed and vitamins for pigs so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Maricel is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins

loans.name: El Principio Group

texts.es:
El señor Gerardo Pérez Sánchez, vive en la Ribera Guadalupe Municipio de Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, es casado con la señora  María de Lourdes Palacios Marín con quien procreo ocho hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad y son: Riki y Maricel de quince años, Cristian Leobardo de doce años, Elver Elaine de once, Viviana de Jesús de nueve, Nelsin Yahir de ocho años, Alex Rubín de cinco años y la más pequeña es Candi del Rosario.

     El préstamo  que ha estado solicitando lo utiliza para comprar mazeca (maíz preparado para hacer tortilla) y luego venderlo en la comunidad, ya que donde él vive esta retirado, para irse a la tienda,  en esta pequeña actividad lleva cuatro meses y comenta que le va bien  ya que le está dando buenos resultados.

    Para comenzar a trabajar  le dio animo su hermano el señor Bernal quien es el representante del grupo a que juntos formaran un grupo  para solicitar un préstamo  y que mejor invertirlo en un negocio que le diera resultado y fue así como decido poner esta actividad.

    De la ganancia que va obteniendo lo invierte en la misma actividad, para que de ello logre solventar sus gastos que se generan dentro de su familia de la que está muy orgulloso.

    El grupo se llama el principio la razón del nombre es porque es la primera vez que trabajan con  un préstamo otorgado por el programa de fundación realidad.

    El grupo se integra de tres personas una mujer y dos hombres y son los siguientes:

    Gerardo Pérez Sánchez: invierte el préstamo en la compra de productos agrícolas y éste préstamo lo utilizará en mazeca

    Bernal Pérez Sánchez: invierte el préstamo en la compra de madera para su carpintería y también pagar el personal que trabaja con él.

    Marisol C. Arévalo: ella invertirá el préstamo en la compra de refresco para luego venderlo en la misma comunidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Gerardo Pérez Sánchez lives in the Ribera Guadalupe town of Coapilla in the State of Chiapas, Mexico. He is married to Sra. María de Lourdes Palacios Marín, the mother of their eight children for whom he is responsible: Riki and Maricel (age 15), Cristian Leobardo (age 12), Elver Elaine (age 11), Viviana de Jesús (age 9), Nelsin Yahir (age 8), Alex Rubin (age 5), and the youngest Candi del Rosario.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy “maseca” (cornmeal used for making tortillas) that he will later sell in the community. Even though he is retired, Gerardo opened a small store four months ago. He says he is doing well due to the good results he has achieved.

In order to begin working, Gerardo convinced his brother Sr. Bernal, who serves as the representative, to form a group for the purpose of requesting a loan since this was the best way to invest in a business that could generate good results. This is how he came to the decision to start a business.

By investing in a business, Gerardo is able to earn money to meet his expenses, which makes his family very proud.

The group is called “El Principio” (The Beginning) because this is the first time they have worked to receive a loan through the program offered by Fundación Realidad. There are three members, one woman and two men. They are listed below:

1. Gerardo Pérez Sánchez will invest his loan in the purchase of farming products and the production of cornmeal. 2. Bernal Pérez Sánchez will invest his loan in the purchase of wood for his carpentry shop and also to pay the wages of an employee who works for him. 3. Marisol C. Arévalo will invest her loan in the purchase of soft drinks that she will sell in the community.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making & selling cornmeal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more food items for his shop

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor Jose Luis D. A. tiene un auto el cual es propio a la fecha se dedica a servicio de taxi trabaja con la empresa taxi card vive en casa familiar y tiene un prestamo con otra organizacion tiene buen historial crediticio y buenas referencias laborales y vecinales se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable y amable esta solicitando el crédito para darle mantenimiento a su unidad de transporte, es por ello que se propone el crédito.
texts.en: This borrower has his own vehicle which he uses to provide a taxi service.  He works with the company Taxi Card.  He lives in his family home and has a credit history with another loan organization.  He has made his loan repayments punctually and has good work and credit references.  He is known to be a responsible person and is requesting this loan to pay to have his vehicle serviced.  For this reason, he is being offered a loan.

loans.use: to pay for his vehicule's maintenance

loans.name: Leap

texts.en:
Mrs. Leap L. (pictured) and her husband, Mr. Voek Bun, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1992 and have three children--one son and two daughters. 

Leap is hired by her villagers to farm. Her husband is a construction worker. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to build a concrete brick room under her wooden house.

loans.use: to build a concrete brick room under her wooden house

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
The two persons in the picture are Som P., 44, and her husband, Roum Oeurn, age 48. Som P. could earns a living as a breeder of pigs at the pigpen behind her house. Aside from this, she also helps her husband to sell firewood in and around Kompong Tom province. The couple has five children, four of whom are in school. One of them is employed as a security guard in a private company. 

Som P. is seeking a loan to buy a second motorbike for her son to ride to his work place. That can reduce the traveling costs for her employed son.

loans.use: to buy a second motorbike for her son to ride to his work place.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José Luis R., reside en casa propia con su esposa y dos hijos que son todo para él. Don José es un hombre luchador, lleno de vida y entregado en su trabajo. Él Posee una pequeña tienda en su casa de habitación en la cual ofrece diferentes artículos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar golosinas, etc. Además de su pequeña tienda también se dedica a la venta de huevos y pollos de forma ambulante en el Municipio de Santa Ana del Departamento del mismo nombre. El sabe que solo trabajando logrará sacar adelante a su querida familia y es por esto que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito ya que sueña con ver su negocio crecido el cual cuente con los productos necesarios para atraer a más clientes y así poder convertirse en el mas preferido de la zona. Con el crédito pretende comprar variedad de productos de tienda como: Azúcar, leche, arroz, frijoles, bebidas, pan dulce, golosinas, macarrones, condimentos, huevos y pollos. Así tendría variedad de productos y los clientes lo preferirían más ya que está lleno de  carisma y amabilidad. De esta forma confía que sus ganancias se verán aumentadas lo que significa que él podría ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José Luis R. lives in a home of his own along with his wife and two children who are everything to him.  José is a man who puts forth great effort, is full of life, and is dedicated to his work.  He has a small store in his home where he sells different items, such as rice, beans, sugar, snacks, etc.  He also sells eggs and chickens on foot in the town and department of Santa Ana.

He knows that he will only get ahead with his family by working and so he decided to request this loan because he wants to see his business grow, have enough products to serve a greater number of customers, and become the best in the zone.

He will use the money from this loan to buy a variety of products for his store, such as sugar, milk, rice, beans, drinks, bread, snacks, macaroni, condiments, eggs, and chickens.  In this way he will have a variety of products on hand and his customers will prefer the store more as it already has a special charm.  He is confident that he will increase his earnings and that he will be able to offer better living conditions to his family.

loans.use: to buy inventory items

loans.name: Boronboy

texts.ru: Нозимов Боронбой житель района Шахритус. Ему 39 лет. Он женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование у него среднее. Он занимается растениеводством. В основном он выращивает овощи и арбуз для продажи. В этой области более 8 лет. Кредит берет для закупа топлива, минеральных удобрений и семян арбуза.
texts.en: Boronboy N. lives in Shahrituz. He is 39 years old, married, and has four children. He has a high school education.  He is a farmer. Primarily, he grows vegetables and watermelons for sale. He has been doing this for more than eight years. He is taking out a loan to buy fuel, mineral fertilizer, and watermelon seed.

loans.use: to buy fuel, mineral fertilizer, and watermelon seed.

loans.name: Klever Antonio

texts.es:
Klever Antonio tiene 27 años, es soltero vive  con los padres  en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar, no tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  COOPERATIVA Patrón San Miguel se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Pailaloma a 60 minutos de la oficina pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 13 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de maíz, papas y trigo.

Klever Antonio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas y trigo, los productos los compra en  Chillanes y en San Pablo cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos además de fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es llegar a tener casa propia.

Le gusta hacer deporte, festejar las fiestas del carnaval y estar con la familia que es muy unidad.
texts.en:
Klever Antonio is 27 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province. He has no children.

The members of the Communal Bank “Cooperativa Patrón San Miguel” (St. Michael’s Cooperative) meet in the neighborhood of Pailaloma, which is located 60 minutes away from the Cooperativa San Jose office in the canton of Chillanes. This Communal Bank has 13 members who engage in farm activities that involve growing corn, potatoes, and wheat.

Klever Antonio is a farmer who grows corn, potatoes, and wheat. His supplies are purchased in Chillanes and San Pablo at the end of each month. He sells his goods at the fair every Sunday in Chillanes.

Klever Antonio is requesting a loan to buy supplies for his crops, such as fertilizers and compost. The support from this loan will help him financially to access what he needs to increase production. Among the challenges he faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. His dream is to have a house of his own.

He enjoys playing sports, celebrating the Carnival festivities, and being part of a very close family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and compost.

loans.name: Victor Gerardo

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 52 años de edad. Vive con su esposa e hijo en una comunidad rural perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande- Piura. La casa de Víctor no cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.

Víctor es un hombre trabajador que lucha por el bienestar de su familia. Él se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la cosecha de limón. Cuenta con clientela establecida en su zona y alrededores. 

Adicionalmente Víctor se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral, las cuales vende  en el mercado local. Víctor tiene grandes deseos de superación y es por ello que se ha propuesto invertir en su negocio para que este prospere a mayor escala.

Víctor solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que utilizará para  fertilizar sus cultivos de limón y el deshierbo de sus tierras. Además comprará alimento balanceado y algunas aves de corral para mejorar la producción de este segundo negocio.

Víctor ya ha trabajado con nuestra entidad y ha cancelado sus créditos puntual y responsablemente.
texts.en:
Víctor is 52 years old.  He lives with his wife and son in a rural community belonging to Tambogrande-Piura District.  Víctor’s house does not have all basic utilities.

Víctor is a hard working man who strives to provide wellbeing for his family.  He is a farmer, specifically lemons.  He has an established clientele in the area and its surroundings.

In addition, Víctor raises barnyard fowl that he sells in the local market.  Víctor has a great drive for self improvement and this is why he’s proposed to invest in his business so that it will prosper on a larger scale.

Víctor asks Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan that he’ll use to fertilize his lemon crops and to weed his fields.  In addition, he’ll buy nutritionally balanced feed and a few barnyard fowl to improve production in this second business.

Víctor has worked with our firm previously and has repaid his loans on time and responsibly.

loans.use: to fertilize his lemon crops and to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio has spent his entire life being a farmer. He grew up in a small village in Sto. Nino South Cotabato. Now, he is 50 years old and married. His wife is also a farmer. He has three children. The eldest child is 25 years old while the youngest child is 21. He has been doing this business for 5 years now.

Aside from farming rice, he also raises swine to supplement the family income. His average income for his businesses is PHP 10,000 per month.

Bonifacio needs a loan to support his livelihood. The loan will help him buy fertilizers and pig feed. In the future, Bonifacio hopes to own a bigger farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pig feed.

loans.name: Noemi Yolanda

texts.en:
Noemi Yolanda lives in the El Paraiso region of Honduras where she runs a small convenience shop. She also earns additional income by milling corn.

Noemi Yolanda is a returning client and has a punctual payment history. She is currently requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL with which to purchase a variety of merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina, age 42, runs a sari-sari (general) store. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods and noodles.
  
She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell from her store. She and her husband have three children, two of whom are enrolled in school. Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina's goal is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell from her store, such as snack foods and noodles

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 53 years old, married, and has five children. Wilma works very hard to provide for them. 

Wilma runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. 

Wilma has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snacks, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future Wilma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
La Sra. Otilia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Aguerridas II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Está casada, tiene 53 años y 01 hijo de 20 años, estudiante de nivel superior en Economía.
Hace 6 años trabajaba como empleada doméstica en diferentes casas, el tiempo transcurría, se sentía cansada y no se daba tiempo para su familia, es por ello y por iniciativa propia que decide dedicarse a la venta de ropa.
Con su préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles otorgados por el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,inicia su negocio de venta de ropa de segunda mano.  Nos ceunta que le va muy bien en sus ventas ya que lo  realiza en las afueras de la ciudad, cuenta con clientes fijos. Actualmente incrementó su negocio con la venta de blusas, pantalones, faldas y zapatos para damas, haciéndose de una muy  buena clientela. Este negocio le da muy buenas ganancias y le brinda muchas satisfacciones.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará más vestidos, blusas, pantalones, polos, faldas de segunda, y zapatos de diferentes modelos y marcas.
La Sra. Otilia es una mujer trabajadora y entusiasta,  su sueño es aumentar su stock de prendas de vestir de primera calidad en marcas y modelos, de esa manera generar mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Otilia is a member of the communal bank "Las Aguerridas II" of the district of Tarapoto in the province and department of San Martin. She is married, 53 years old, and she has a 20-year old son. He is attending post-secondary education specializing in economics.

For the past 6 years she has been working as a janitor in various houses. But with the passage of time she felt tired and she did not have any time to spend with her family. For this reason and under her own initiative she started out selling clothing.

Her first loan was in the amount of S/.300 nuevos soles, granted by the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner). She started out her used clothing sales business. She tells us that is has done very well especially because she carries out her sales outside of the city. She has a steady roster of clients. She has increased her business by incorporating the sale of blouses, pants, skirts, and ladies' shoes. This has earned her a very good clientele. This business provides her with a very good income and it provides her with great satisfaction. 

With this new loan in the amount of S/. 1000 nuevos soles she will purchase more dresses, blouses, pant, polo shirts, used skirts, and shoes in various models and brands.

Otilia is a hardworking and enthusiastic woman whose dream is to have an inventory of top quality clothing of popular brand names and styles to improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Ribhya

texts.en:
Ribhya is a 53-year-old married woman with six sons and two daughters. Her husband works as a taxi driver. One of her sons is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. She also has an income from working in agriculture. Ribhya has a taxi that makes internal and external trips. She wants to replace the old taxi with a bigger new one. She has part of the payment, but she needs to add to her savings by taking out a loan from FATEN for $3,000.

When Ribhya gets this loan, to be repaid on a monthly basis, she will have the full amount of money she needs to pay for replacing the old taxi she owns with a new bigger one. This will increase her income and allow her family to live in better conditions. Ribhya and her husband are photographed near the old taxi that she wants to replace.

loans.use: to add to her savings to purchase a new taxi.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a farmer in Kitale, Western Kenya. He is married with four children ages 4 to 12 years. He has been farming for 15 years and currently employs one farmhand. His farm produces milk, maize, vegetables, and tomatoes.

He has requested a loan of 66,600 Kenya shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo. He will purchase and insure a dairy cow for 41,600 KES and buy poultry birds for 25,000 KES. He says the loan will enable him expand his farming business and offer better quality of life to his family.

Moses also laments poor farm product prices in the market.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow and buy poulry birds.

loans.name: Vireak

texts.en:
Vireak is 36 years old and is a grocery seller with his wife. They earn $15 per day and have four children who are 13, 10, 4 and 2 years old. Two of their children are in school. Every month, Vireak has to spend $90 on food, $10 on electricity, $30 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. He wants to support all of his children to study at least until finishing high school. 

Vireak would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy more grocery goods to sell in his store because he doesn’t have enough types of good to sell.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rug making business in the Philippines. Analie has been in this business for 4 years. She earns additional income from her general store. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her rug making business.

Analie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her rug making business.

loans.name: Hamrochon

texts.ru: Хамрочон на протяжении многих лет содержит семью на полученные доходы от своего бизнеса. Она разведенная и содержит семью одна. У нее двое детей. Старший ребенок помогает ей по бизнесу. Она занимается продажей продовольственных товаров. На полученный доход она закончила ремонт своего дома. Для расширения оборота  ей нужны средства. Она хочет получить займ, увеличить ассортимент и количество товаров. Она надеется на вашу помощь.
texts.en: Hamrochon is divorced and has two children. For many years, she has provided for her family all alone, running a business focused on selling groceries and foodstuffs. Her oldest child helps her run the store. With the income generated from the business, Hamrochon has finished repairing her house. In order to expand her business, she requires more capital. A loan would allow her to augment her assortment of products. She hopes for your help.

loans.use: to purchase new goods

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 43 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is widowed and has six children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past five years, Fatuma has been working hard to manage her business, in which she sells maize and produce. 

To help expand her business, Fatuma has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bags of maize, and will help Fatuma to generate greater profits and transition into selling wholesale. Fatuma hopes that in the future she will be able to open other wholesale businesses. 

Fatuma is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small business entrepreneurs like Fatuma who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more bags of maize.

loans.name: Adriana María

texts.es:
Adriana vive en el municipio de San Felix donde inició  su negocio de venta de mercancía en un local arrendado, con este negocio ella se consigue su sustento diario para ella y su pequeño hijo de 6 años.

Ella se sueña con tener su local propio y con un almacén con variedad de mercancía para ofrecerle a sus clientes, además así le puede brindar a su hijo una estabilidad económica y emocional.
texts.en:
Adriana lives in the city of San Felix. She started her business, selling merchandise, in a rented space. With this business she is able to provide daily sustenance for herself and her small six-year-old son. 
Her dream is to own her own property and have a small grocery store there with a variety of merchandise to offer to her customers. She would also like to provide her son with economic and emotional stability.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Fredy Alberto

texts.es:
Durante algunos años Fredy se ha desempeñado como operario en algunas empresas de Medellín y desea iniciar su propio negocio para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia conformada por su esposa y sus dos hijos de 16 y 17 años.

En su propia casa desea adecuar un espacio para iniciar con una sala de internet para ofrecerle este servicio a sus vecinos y para ello necesita de un préstamo para realizar las adecuaciones locativas del espacio.
texts.en:
For some years, Fredy has worked for various companies in Medellín, but he now wants to start his own business so that he can offer a better quality of life to his family, which consists of his wife and two children, who are 16 and 17.

He wants to remodel part of his house to start an internet cafe so he can offer this service to his neighbors.  He will use this loan to make the necessary changes to the space.

loans.use: convert part of his home into an internet cafe.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angelica forma parte del Banco comunal “Villa Unida”, perteneciente a la comuna de San Javier, ubicada en la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente atiende un almacén y botillería desde hace 14 años.
Su local está ubicado en un costado de su casa. Comenta que le va muy bien en su negocio, a pesar de la competencia en el sector donde vive.
Su horario de atención es de lunes a domingo de 10ºº de la mañana hasta las 02ºº de la madrugada. 
Su mercadería la compra a los proveedores que van directamente a su casa, también concurre a las distribuidoras. 
Con el crédito comprará materiales de construcción, para reparar el techo de su local, además comprará mercadería para abastecer su negocio.
Las metas en su negocio son mejorar la infraestructura de su local, para tener una mayor comodidad. 
Angelica vive junto a sus dos hijos y un nieto de 9 años de edad.  Sus hijos están terminando sus carreras universitarias, por lo que se siente muy orgullosa del logro obtenido con gran esfuerzo.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, ya que es unido, comprometido y responsable. 
San Javier es una comuna y ciudad de la zona central de Chile, perteneciente a la región del Maule. Se caracteriza por ser una zona esencialmente vitivinícola. Los viñedos locales pertenecen a la zona denominada Valle del Loncomilla, de donde provienen algunos de los mejores vinos chilenos, Viña Carolina y Viña Gillmore, entre otras.
texts.en:
Angelica is a member of the 'Villa Unida' community bank which is located in San Javier, in the city of Talca.  She is a shopkeeper and has run a grocery store and off licence for 14 years.  Angelica's premises are located on one side of her house.  She says that her business is doing very well, despite the competition in her area.

Angelica's opening hours are from Monday to Sunday, from 10.00am to 02.00am.  She buys her merchandise from suppliers who come directly to her home.  She also visits wholesalers.  She will use her loan to buy building materials to fix the roof of her premises.  She will also buy merchandise with which to stock her business.  Her business goals are to improve the infrastructure of her premises so that she can be more comfortable.

Angelica lives together with her two children and a 9-year-old grandson.  Her children are finishing their university degree courses and she feels very proud of what they have managed to achieve as a result of her hard work.

Angelica is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza have given her as it has allowed her to invest in her business.  She also feels very comfortable with the meetings of her community bank as it is a very united, committed and responsible group.

San Javier is a district and city in the central area of Chile, in Maule region.  It is noted for being essentially a wine-growing area.  The local vineyards are in an area called 'Valle del Loncomilla' where some of the best Chilean wines come from (Viña Carolina, Viña Gillmore and others).

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair the roof of her premises and to buy merchandise with which to stock her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Omela milk, toothpaste, biscuits, batteries, scented soap and sardines for his business.

loans.name: Gerrybeth

texts.en: Gerrybeth is married and works hard to support her family. She has operated a fishing business in the Philippines for 10 years. She earns additional income from food sales. Gerrybeth has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment for fishing. In the future, Gerrybeth would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
Né en Janvier 1983 à Sikasso, Monsieur Drissa est marié et réside chez son frère à Kaboïla II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Drissa n’ayant pas eu la chance de progresser dans les études, s’est vite initié à cette activité d’achat et de vente de téléphones portables et leurs accessoires (façade, batterie, chargeur, écouteur, etc.) il y a environ trois ans. Son activité est menée dans sa propre boutique au grand marché de Sikasso avec une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales et surtout des forains. Il est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ une année. Il a bénéficié deux crédits qui ont été correctement remboursés. Dans le but de mieux relancer cette activité, il sollicite ainsi un troisième crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter à Bamako 20 téléphones portables de marques différentes, 3 cartons de façade, 20 chargeurs, 20 paquets de carte mémoire, 5 cartons de batterie et 2 douzaines d’écouteur. 
 Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in January 1983 in Sikasso, Drissa is married and lives with his brother in Kaboïla II, one of the neighborhoods of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
Since he did not get a chance to further his education, Drissa quickly got into the business of buying and selling cell phones and phone accessories (covers, batteries, chargers, headphones, etc.) 3 years ago. He does this at his own booth in the big market of Sikassa, with a client base composed of all social classes, but especially itinerant merchants. Because of their quality, the products he sells are in high demand.
In order to better meet the needs of his growing clientele, he decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance institution, about a year ago. He was granted 2 loans, which have been successfully paid back. In order to boost his business, he is applying for a third loan which will enable him to buy 20 phones of various brands, 3 boxes of phone covers, 20 packs of memory cards, 5 boxes of batteries, and 2 dozens of headphones in Bamako.
He expects to make a monthly profit of 200.000 FCFA, which will be mostly used to contribute to his family's expenses, pay back his loan, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and phone accessories

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is 39 years old and married with two children aged 9 and 16. He bakes to earn a living. He has been in the business for three years and has employed three people. 

He describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to expand his business. He hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy baking powder and cooking oil.

loans.use: To buy baking powder and cooking oil

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
This is 44 year-old Osman.  He is married and has 4 children who are 14, 11, and 9 (female twins). He has 2 additional dependents, who attend school and  assist with the domestic work. 

Osman owns a business to sell used clothes, shoes, suitcases, refrigerators, bed spreads, carpets, slippers, handbags, and televisions.  He began his business because he  could not have a better education and needed to stop at the primary level.  He used to help his father with his faming business.  He saved the commissions that were given to him by his father. Later, he started  traveling to Guinea Conakry to buy jewelry and men and women's clothes.  He was doing it on a credit basis and later transformed his business to include used items.  

He works 7 days a week, 10 hours a day and earns 2,200,000 SLL every month.  He would like to borrow 5,000,000 SLL to purchase the following items: large quantities of used clothes, trousers, bed spreads, shoes, carpets, and  handbags. He is friendly and accommodating.  The major challenge is not having a shop.  

In the future, Osman plans to rent a shop, educate his children to higher levels, and to build a house.  The loan will help him to earn more profit as it is an additional income. 

 He thanks you for your support  and promises to repay within the stipulated dates and continue the program.

loans.use: to buy more goods.

loans.name: Sagrario Norela

texts.en:
For the last years, I’ve been a peddler who sells beauty products. I visit offices, neighbors and markets in order to sell lotions and clothes. I work from Monday to Saturday, and my sales have gone up in the last few months. During the Christmas season, people buy gifts and accessories for personal use, and that helps me with my sales. I’m a single mother, so I have to look for ways to help my kid financially. This is a good month for sales, so I need to invest money in order to increase my inventory, and my income.

Loan Use: Purchase lotions, shampoo, everyday lotions, etc.

Desde hace dos años me dedico a la venta de productos de belleza ambulante, visito oficinas, vecinas y mercados para vender cremas, lociones y ropa. Trabajo de lunes a sabado y mis ventas han incrementado en estos ultimos meses. Ahora en temporada navideña las personas buscan comprar regalos o accesorios de uso personal lo que me ayuda a mi producto se venda. Soy madre soltera por lo que tengo que buscar la manera de ayudar economicamente a mi hijo. Este mes es bueno para ventas por lo que necesito invertir capital para incrementar mi inventario y obtener mejores ingresos.

loans.use: Compra de lociones, Shampoo, Cremas de uso diario y otros.

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
Benito is a rice farmer in Santa Lucia. He is the leader of the cooperative of rice farmers and field workers named Dios Con Nosotros (God is with Us). His job as leader is to make sure that his fellow borrowers are on time and no one falls behind. He needs this loan in order to purchase all the necessary items to plant rice on his lands. He has been a rice farmer for over 20 years, and he is sure that the access to capital will help him and his fellow cooperative members be more productive than ever. He hopes that this is the first step in bypassing loan sharks and intermediaries who take many of the profits that he and his fellow field workers would otherwise make.

The Paypayales Communal Bank in Santa Lucia

Benito is part of one of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program: the Paypayales Communal Bank. All bank members are part of a rice farmers' cooperative in Santa Lucia named Dios Con Nosotros (God is with us). They will use these microloans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. As members of a communal bank, they are all the guarantors for each other's loans. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Dios con Nosotros Cooperative are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about the commnity of Santa Lucia, compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The region is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area, as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with the rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them harvest their crop. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not have access to formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also often lack skills and knowledge of how to commercialize their product and get fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them to repay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Farm Rice

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en: Shahin N. is a native of the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan. He is married with four children. He started his trade business in 1990 selling small items from a table in front of his house. Over the years his business has grown and with the help of a loan of $500 from Normicro he was able to obtain a small store to sell his goods. Shahin is now requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a wider variety of goods and products to satisfy the needs of his growing customer base.

loans.use: To purchase more goods and products to stock his general store

loans.name: Karla Elizabeth

texts.es:
Karla is single and has four children, who are studying. She has never had anyone's assistance in helping her children get ahead, so for 10 years, she has been working with the sales of used clothing, and then she began making and selling pasteles (savory pastries). this has been her only income to support and educate her children, and it has not been easy for her to have the entire responsibility for her family. But her love for her children is what drives her forward from day to day.

Thanks to the good quality of the pasteles she makes, she has grown her business and is now requesting a loan of $250 that will be used to purchase goods to increase her production and meet her clients' demand. She promises to return this amount in 3 months. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Help them by contributing to the growth of her business, and they will sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Karla es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos, que se están estudiando. Nunca ha tenido la ayuda de nadie para sacar adelante a sus hijos, por lo que desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, después inició con la elaboración y venta de pasteles, este ha sido su único ingreso para sostener y dar educación a sus hijos, no ha sido fácil para ella tener toda la responsabilidad de su familia, pero el amor hacia sus hijos es lo que la impulsa día a día.

Gracias a la buena calidad de pasteles que elabora ha hecho crecer su negocio y ahora está solicitando un préstamo de $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos para incrementar su producción y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, ayúdalos contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Gogosina

texts.en: Gogosina is 37 years of age and married with 5 children. Her parents run a small retail shop in the village. About a year ago, Gogosina's father passed away, and left her with her mother and two grown-up sisters. She's looking after the shop, which is why she decided to join SPBD. With the help of SPBD she managed to expand her shop, and she managed to sell enough goods. Some of the women in the village are using Gogo's shop, as she is known, to display their goods, for example, cabbage, beans, coconuts, etc.

loans.use: To assist with the family's shop

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro Coronoal is a 35-year-old physical education teacher and nutritionist. He is single and lives with his mother and four brothers. He and his brothers work hard to ensure their independence from their mother. 
After finishing his studies to become a physical education teacher and nutritionist, Pedro has begun his work in this field. He has been able to achieve this level of success with the ongoing support of his family. He has been working in this field for the last seven years. His business is growing and he has established a number of regular clients. 
Pedro has asked for a small loan to allow him to buy new weights for his gym, which will open early this summer as people try to get in shape for the warm weather. The loan will allow him to continue successfully in this line of work.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN NEW WEIGHTS FOR HIS GYM, AND HELP GROW HIS BUSINESS AS A PHYSICAL EDUCATION TEACHER AND NUTRITIONIST

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta lives in her own home with her three children on Mario Alborta street in the Tembladerani district of the city of La Paz. She sells food, perfume and electronics in schools and in her neighborhood. She delivers her goods on credit and collects money on a daily basis. She will use this loan to increase her capital so that she can offer a wider variety of products.

She does not have a loan history with Impro but the socioeconomic analysis conducted qualifies her to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Vicenta vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos en la calle Mario Alborta de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. Su actividad es la venta de víveres, perfumes, artefactos eléctricos, ya sea en los colegios y por su zona entregándolos al crédito y cobrando diariamente , el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y así tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer.

No tiene antecedente histórico con Impro pero por la evaluación socio económica efectuada ella califica para obtener un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase capital to purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Rose Kizito's Group

texts.en: Rose is 35 years old and married with five children. She has a market stall where she sells foodstuffs. Rose wants to use the extra profits from her business to buy iron sheets for her stall and to complete her the floor of her house.

loans.use: Increase her business profits.

loans.name: Muborak

texts.en:
A. Muborak is 54 years old. She and her husband have raised three children, the elder is already married. 

For 11 years Muborak has been running her own business. She is selling  socks in the central local market. As a rule she receives the goods from the  neighboring city of Istaravshan. Considering that the husband of Muborak is currently unemployed, her business is the main source of income for the family. Muborak is working hard and hoping to educate her younger children and to improve the living conditions of the family.

Today Muborak requests 200.00 US Dollars for the term of 3 months. She is planning to enlarge the range of goods for selling. Muborak promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: Purchasing of goods like socks for men and women in order to enlarge the range of goods

loans.name: Johari's Nyota Group

texts.en:
Johari is 38 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, aged 14, 9, and 3. Johari owns a small stationery store, which she started in 2006. Every day she works from 9:00 AM to 6:30 PM at her business.

Johari now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in food vending and charcoal selling.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Mr. Yim Y. is 62 years old and lives in the Kroal Krabei Village, Pursat Province. He farms and raises pigs, earning about $2.50 per day. His wife, Mrs. Sen In, is 55 years old. Sen sells porridge and Khmer noodles from her home and earns about $2.30 per day. Y. has seven children, two of whom are married.

Mr. Y. requests a loan of $500 to purchase small pigs to raise. Y. hopes this loan will increase his income and sustain his family’s financial stability. Sen In is pictured in the photo because Yim Y. was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase small pigs to raise

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret M. is thirty years old. She is married with a child. She has been a retailer of charcoal for five years. Margaret is very grateful for the previous loan which made a big difference in her business and family's life. She wants to use the next loan to buy more charcoal stock to serve her customers. She also wants to expand the business to include food stuffs like maize and plantain which are mostly requested by customers. She believes this can help to increase her income to provide a decent shelter for her family. She belongs to the community group called Nyame Asomafo (God’s Ambassadors). Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Dewi

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman Dewi believes that working hard is important, and she has done so for many years. To ensure the longterm survival of her family and to help relieve some of the burden of her hard work, she hopes to get another loan to help increase her family's income.
