Anna is a single woman with five children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over eight years, Anna has operated a charcoal business. She sells charcoal to her neighbors and to the general public. Her major business challenge is seasonality. During the rainy winter season when demand is high, the charcoal supply is low and it is difficult for Anna to meet customer demand.

Anna decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. In the future, Anna hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband with his butcher shop. From his shop, he sells chicken meat to his customers and generates income for the family. Chicken consumption is different in every city, but people like to eat chicken over other meats. With the loan, he will buy chickens in larger quantities, which will help him fulfill the on time demands of his customers and earn more income. 

Nasreen resides with her family in Riwind, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its dairy industry. She moved here after her marriage many years ago. She herself is a seamstress, and sews clothes for neighborhood clients. She also does embroidery work that she learned from her mother prior to marriage. She believes that in today’s world it is very difficult for one person to improve the financial condition of the family when the cost of living is getting higher every day. That’s why she supports her husband financially with her sewing and embroidery work. 

She has 3 sons. All of them have their own shops where they also sell chicken meat to their clients. They have a good reputation among their clients due to the quality of their fresh meat. 

Nasreen is hopeful that an investment will take her husband’s business to a more profitable position and bring more money to her home. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In her previous loan years, she maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with her hand raised is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy chickens for specialty butcher shop

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is married woman with one child who is still  too young to attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a fresh water selling business for the past year, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Zawadi faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to sell at wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase a water tank for storing water for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank for storing water for sale.

loans.name: Irma Cristina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Irma Cristina; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pintura cusqueña,ella pinta diferente cuadros de la pintura cusqueña,ella tiene una tienda que atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia también vende estas pinturas en forma independiente,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar la tienda de venta de pinturas cusqueñas .La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer las pinturas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Irma Cristina is a member of the "BUENA ESPERANZA" (Good Hope) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Irma Cristina is 29 years old and lives with her partner and son.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling Cusqueña paintings (Cusco-style paintings).  She paints Cusqueña paintings and has a store where she serves from 8.00am to 7.00pm.  She also sells her paintings independently.  She would like to expand and improve the store where she sells her paintings.

Irma Cristina is requesting this loan to buy materials for her paintings.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy materials for her paintings

loans.name: Raima's Group

texts.en:
Loans provided by Kiva are a great opportunity especially for women, since they are one of the most unprotected part of society in many eastern countries. 

Raima M., 43, is the leader of this group. A year ago she started working in clothing retail in a local market. Retail requires a big starting capital for obtaining inventory, a rental space and taxes. Raima gets her goods in a local wholesale market, where the significant part of goods are imported from neighboring countries such as China, Kazakhstan and Russia. Raima is happy with how she managed the first year in this business. Her 16 year old daughter helps her out after school and Raima has good predictions for long-term business. With the returns from her business, she purchased a dairy cow for having fresh milk products for the entire family. Raima earns 5 000 soms monthly, but it’s too little for increasing the assortment she has. A bigger volume of goods would attract more customers. She needs a loan in order to purchase more goods.
 
  --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Olaya Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Bellavista de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Bellavista.

La señora Olaya  es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y porque los intereses son bajos. Tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 16,  15 y 11 años  de edad, los mismos que  estudian dos en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su esposo es agente vendedor.

Tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa en la cual vende cervezas, sodas, aguas y también vende tarjetas telefónicas, trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 21h 00, ella  nos cuenta que lleva en sus negocio el mismo tiempo que lleva en el Banco y por esta razón está muy agradecida con la institución ya que gracias a estos créditos ella puede sacar su negocio adelante y que con todos los créditos recibidos ha ido poco a poco agrandando su negocio. Todos sus productos los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar cervezas, colas, aguas entre otras cosas. Sus sueños son que sus hijos tengan una muy buena educación y que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The partners of the Communal Bank of Bellevista meet in the city of Bellavista de  Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí known for many years as the city of the Reales Tamarindos.

Señora Olaya is a founding partner of this communal bank which she likes because of the additional benefits of Fundación ESPOIR and because of the low interest rates. She is 43 years old and is married with three children, ages 16,15 and 11. All three of her children are in school and her husband is a salesman.

The Señora has a small business in her house to sell beer, soda, water and also various phone cards. She works everyday from seven in the morning until nine at night.  She told us that she started her business at the same time that she began working with the bank and this is why she is so grateful to Fundación ESPOIR. Thanks to these loans she has been able to improve her business and with each loan she has received she has been slowly expanding her business. All of her products she buys locally. 

This loan she will use to buy beer, soda, water and a few other things. She dreams that her children will have a very good education and will have good jobs.

loans.use: To buy beer, sodas, water, etc.

loans.name: Bicentenario Dos Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama Bicentenario dos, porque son muy patriotas y orgullosos de su país. Esta ubicado en el estado de México y es la segunda vez que piden un crédito. La Señora Nelly Uribe C. es integrante del grupo y la presidenta. Ella tiene 21 años y dos hijos, ambos son niños, de 2 y 3 años de edad, lleva dos años con su negocio. El prestamo que solicita lo invertira en materias primas para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y así tener variedad en sus productos, su intencion es crecer economicamente y tener una estabilidad para apoyar a su familia. La señora Nelly se siente feliz al solicitar este crédito ya que con él le podrá ofrecer una carrera profesional a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Bicentenario Dos”, [Bicentennial Two] because they are very patriotic and proud of their country. It is located in the State of Mexico and this is the second time it has requested a loan. 

Mrs. Nelly Uribe C. is a member and the president of the group. She is 21 years old and has two boys who are two and three years old. She has had her business for two years.

The loan will be utilized to buy raw materials to please her costumers and offer a variety of products. She wishes to grow economically and obtain stability to provide for her family. Mrs. Nelly is excited about requesting the loan because it may allow her to provide a career path for her children through schooling.

loans.use: To buy raw material

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a married woman who lives in Palawan. She earns her living by buying and selling ginger/bamboo shoots and rice. Her husband Rodrigo, who is 54 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 7 and 32 years old. 

Norma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 22 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Norma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 23rd loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 to buy more ginger and bamboo shoots to sell in the market so that she can continue to save up for her children's education and household improvements. Norma is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to buy more ginger and bamboo shoots to sell

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Allen has a business selling clothes, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Allen has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Allen hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Allen hopes to own a salon.    

Allen is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by expanding her capital.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Herbert Niel

texts.en:
Herbert Niel S. is from the village of Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 34 years old. Herbert Niel is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Herbert Niel owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a tricycle transport service. Herbert Niel has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Herbert Niel joined Kiva's partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Herbert Niel is requesting a new loan of 38,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Herbert Niel from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories for his transportation service

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana forma parte del banco comunal “Aurora Boreal” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar.
Ella se dedica a la confección hogar, esto quiere decir confección de cortinas, sábanas, cobertores, bolsos para llevar los artículos de bebé y bolsas de pan. Además cuenta con un bazar y librería. Ana arrendó un departamento específicamente para ubicar sus negocios, lo adaptó del tal manera, para ubicar su taller de confecciones en la parte de atrás del departamento y adelante lo utiliza para su bazar y librería. Se dedica a la confección hogar desde hace 16 años y al negocio del bazar desde hace 8 años. 
Con el préstamo comprará telas para su trabajo de confección. Además necesita pagar permisos y trámites de sus negocios. 
Sus metas son seguir ampliando su negocio y ser conocida en el rubro, a través de una página Web o catálogos de sus confecciones. Por ahora sus trabajos y ventas son sólo a pedidos, sin embargo le va muy bien.
Ana vive junto a su esposo y su sueño a nivel personal es viajar y conocer la ciudad de Valdivia que se encuentra ubicada al sur de Chile. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la facilidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza para acceder al crédito. Respecto a las reuniones, Ana se siente muy cómoda y a gusto, ya que existe una muy buena relación y comunicación entre las demás socias del grupo, además se transmiten datos y se recomiendan a distintos clientes, por lo que existe solidaridad entre las integrantes del banco comunal. Por otra parte los aprendizajes de venta en las reuniones los ha incorporado en su negocio, como por ejemplo en la distribución y registro de sus ganancias. 
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the “Aurora Boreal” community bank which is located in the city of Viña del Mar.

Ana makes soft furnishings.  She makes drapes, sheets, bedspreads, diaper bags and bread bags.  She also has a bazaar and book store.  Ana rented an apartment specifically for her businesses.  She adapted it so that she could also locate her sewing workshop in the rear of the apartment.  She uses the front part of the apartment for her store.

Ana has been making soft furnishings for 16 years and has run her store for 8 years.  She will use her loan to buy fabrics for her sewing work.  She also needs to pay for licenses and permits for her businesses.

Ana's goals are to continue expanding her business and to become well known in the field through a Web page or catalogs which contain her products.  For now, she makes and sells products to order.  Her business is doing very well.

Ana lives together with her husband and her dream, on a personal level, is to travel and visit the city of Valdivia which is in the south of Chile.  She is very happy and grateful for the ease with which Fondo Esperanza enabled her to access her loan.  As regards the meetings of her community bank, Ana feels very comfortable and at ease in these meetings since there is are good relationships and good communication between the members of the group.  They pass on information and recommend each other to different customers which means there is a lot of solidarity between them.  In addition, Ana has incorporated into her business what she has learned about sales from the bank's meetings, for example, as regards distributing and recording her profits.

Viña del Mar is a city and municipality which is located on Chile's central coast.  It is known as the Garden City because of the gardens and patios that some of the city's old houses have.  It is also considered to be the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: to buy fabric for her soft furnishings work and to pay for licenses and permits for her businesses

loans.name: Simon Maina

texts.en:
Simon Maina N., 29, is married to Grace Muthoni, who also contributes to the family income. He has been running his shop selling clothes for a period of six years with an income of about 14,000 Kenyan shillings a month. 

This is his second loan after successfully repaying the previous one from KADET Ltd. He wants to use the loan funds to buy more clothes for resale. 

He hopes to own a wholesale shop in the future and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to replenish stocks of new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Dewin Miguel

texts.es: Dewin  de 32 años tiene una tienda en el municipio de Malambo, ubicado a 15  minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla; allí  vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 6 años de edad, familia que es su motivación para dirigir todos sus esfuerzos de trabajo y lograr su bienestar. Dewin es un educador de profesión, que adquirió la experiencia de negocio en la casa de sus padres y él desde muy niño observó cómo ellos  sacaron adelante a su familia mediante este trabajo. Por eso hace tres años recibió una liquidación y no dudó en emprender su propia aventura, que hoy está convertida en una tienda que constituye  importantes ingresos para su hogar. Este negocio es administrado por su esposa en las mañanas y por él mismo en la tarde, porque trabaja en un colegio el otro medio tiempo. Su meta es apoyar su crecimiento para  cada día ganar más rentabilidad y muy seguramente lo logrará, porque es un hombre de familia, muy organizado y trabajador;   su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará víveres, papelería, y en general artículos de miscelánea pues desea fortalecer también,  su punto de ventas como miscelánea y con ello aprovecharía el mercado ya cautivo del que goza su tienda. .
texts.en: Dewin is 32 years old, he has a store in the Malambo municipality, some 15 minutes from the city of Barranquilla. He lives with his partner and 6 year old son; they are his motivation to give his all to his work and to obtain their wellbeing. Dewin is a teacher by profession that got business experience is his fathers’ home and since he was a boy he saw how they got their family ahead through their work. This is why three years ago when he received his severance pay he didn’t think twice about setting up his own business which is now a very important part of his family’s income. The business is managed by his wife in the mornings and the afternoons by himself since he works in a school in the mornings. Dewin’s goal is to support his growth to be more profitable each day and surely he will achieve it since he is a family man, very organized and hardworking. His Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo is his first, he will buy supplies, stationary, and miscellaneous general articles since he wants to stock his store and make good use of the market that his store has cornered.

loans.use: buy supplies, stationary, and miscellaneous general articles.

loans.name: Petra

texts.es: La señora Petra es originaria de Acteopan, ella tiene 55 años de edad, ella es viuda pera esta a su cargo su sobrina Luisa de 24 años de edad y su tía de 88 años de edad, ella se dedica a la alfarería elabora cazuelas, ollas y jarros y los vende crudos, ella solicito su préstamo para elaborar la loza va a comprar barro, leña, tierra blanca  y una parte para la comida. Ella inicio su negocio desde que era pequeña tenía  15 años de edad y les ayudaba a sus papas ellos le enseñaros a elaborar las cazuelas, ollas y jarros de barro, después se caso y sus suegros le ayudaron le dieron dinero para comprar el material y comenzó su propio negocio elaborando ollas, cazuelas y jarros crudos, este negocio es importante porque de ahí tiene para su mantención vende las cazuelas, ollas o jarros y ya tiene para ir al mercado, este préstamo le da fuerza a su negocio para comprar la materia primas y seguir trabajando y sus sueños y esperanzas son estar bien de salud para seguir en el negocio elaborando y vendiendo cazuelas, ollas y jarros. En San Marcos se celebra el 29 de Junio a San Pedro, hay misas, procesión y toros. Ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias que me prestan, lo voy a ocupar en el negocio”.
texts.en: Señora Petra is a native of Acteopan.  She is a 55- year old widow but takes care of her 24-year old niece, Luisa, and her 88- year old aunt.  She makes her living making pottery.  She makes clay stew pots, smaller pots and jars.  She sells them unfinished.  Señora Petra is requesting her loan to make her crockery and to purchase clay, firewood, white clay and some food.  Señora Petra began in the business when she was young, just 15 years old.  She helped her parents, who taught her to make the stew pots, smaller pots and jars all from clay.  After she was married, her in-laws helped her by giving her money to purchase the necessary materials and she started her own business making unfinished clay stew pots, smaller pots and jars.  This business is important because she supports herself from it.  She sells her stew pots, smaller pots and jars to have enough money to go to the market.  This loan will give strength to her business so she can purchase her raw materials and keep working.  Señora Petra's dreams and hopes are for good health so she can keep her business going and keep making and selling stew pots, smaller pots and jars.  In San Marcos they celebrate the 29th of June on honor of St. Peter.  There is a mass, a procession and bull fights.  Señora Petra wants to say to Kiva and to "Fundación Realidad," “Thank you for what you have loaned me.  I will use it for my business."

loans.use: to purchase clay, firewood, white clay and food.

location.town: Barrio San Pedro, Acteopan, Estado de Puebla

loans.name: Po

texts.en: Po, 57 years old, is a farmer. Her husband is a priest and their income is $7 per day. They have one child and he is working right now. Every month, Po spends around $40 on the family's expenses. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a motorbike for her son to travel to work. She wants her son to sell groceries instead of work when he is married. If Po could save some money, she will repair her house for her son in the future, because she has only this one son.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son to travel to work

loans.name: New Horizons Group

texts.en:
Marina, Maria, and Gregoria, all of whom reside in El Paraiso, Honduras, formed the “New Horizons” solidarity group in June, 2011. Marina is married with grown children, and her husband works in the livestock industry. The other group members, Maria and Gregoria, make their livings by selling homemade tortillas and clothing, respectively.

Marina has made a living for many years selling basic grains, dairy products, clothing, and shoes out of her home. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL to purchase shoes and bundles of used American clothing which she will sell out of her home.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and bundles of used American clothing.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
This is Rosa, 30, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Jacky, a driver, and mother to their children. With her husband, Rosa manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosa operates a small repacking business. She buys her products from wholesalers and repackages it in smaller quantities. The then sells it to stores in the community. Her products are garlic, black pepper, pandan leaves and other herbs and spices used in cooking. She also earns additional income in the operation of their tricycle. She has one tricycle, which is paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Rosa’s husband drives the tricycle. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community store. She earns a minimum of PHP950 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Rosa is requesting a PHP12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy garlic, black pepper and other stocks for her repacking business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosa hopes to be able to expand soon to sustain their daily needs. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of herbs & spice products that she needs in her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 50 years old.  She is married and has 5 children.  

Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has been running this business for 8 years.  She also earns an income from a cafeteria.  

Grace has requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like toothpaste, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.  She has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Grace aspires to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Lyda Del Carmen

texts.es: Lyda de 48 años de edad vive con su esposo  y sus tres hijos en las edades de 14 a 20 años, en la ciudad de Cartagena donde se dedica a la venta de libros y también a la preparación de desinfectantes, champó y jabones líquidos;  Lyda inició su vida como negociante en un tenderete  y vendía minutos a celulares, y apoyada por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la cual ha recibido tres créditos, ha logrado ensanchar su mercado y adicionar  la venta de libros cristianos. Igualmente mediante capacitación aprendió la técnica para preparar desinfectantes, champó y jabones  y también se ha dedicado a ello.   Con su credikiva comprará materias primas para la preparación de jabones, desinfectantes y champó, fundamentado en un pedido, lo cual hará que  esta inversión sea exitosa, porque es un reto aumentar su capital de trabajo y esto es lo que la mueve cada día.
texts.en:
Lyda is 48 years old and lives with her husband and three children, who are between the ages of 14 and 20. They reside in the city of Cartagena, where she sells books and prepares disinfectants, shampoo, and liquid soaps. Lyda started her business working in a booth selling mobile phone minutes. With the support of three loans she received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, she was able to expand her market and add the sale of Christian books to her inventory. She also attended seminars where she learned techniques for preparing disinfectants, shampoo, and soaps. Lyda now engages in this business.

With this Kiva loan, she will buy raw materials for preparing soaps, disinfectants, and shampoo based on the orders that she receives. She hopes that this investment will be successful because her main challenge has been increasing her operating capital, which is what she needs to move forward each day.

loans.use: to buy materials for making disinfectants, shampoo, and soap.

loans.name: Baragul's Group

texts.en:
Baragul is the leader of this group. She is 59 and married to a veterinarian. Together they have raised three daughters and two sons. The daughters are married and the sons are working in Russia. Eight years ago, with an initial investment of 12000 soms, Baragul started to breed livestock. Reselling livestock allows her to contribute an additional 4000 soms to the family budget. She has applied for a loan because she needs additional funds to increase her number of livestock. In the future, Baragul hopes to see her sons wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: True Go Lass Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “True Go Lass” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 800,000 SLL for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Abdul is the leader of this group. The 38-year-old is a native of Makeni. He is married with three children attending primary school. His wife is a businesswoman, too. Abdul makes and sells mattresses. He has been a professional dealer in locally made mattresses for five years now. With the help of this loan, Abdul is going to buy working materials in large quantity in order to produce a larger quantity of mattresses for sale.

loans.use: to buy working materials in large quantity in order to produce a larger quantity of mattresses for sale.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a 49-year-old married woman with three children. The oldest child is 16 years old. Alicia lives in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato where she has a farm and a sari-sari store business.

Alicia grows rice crops on her land and sells her harvest at the market. At her sari-sari store, she sells items like vinegar, soy sauce and dried fish. Alicia plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell such as dried fish and canned goods. She hopes to have a stable income that will sustain her family and her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell such as dried fish and canned goods

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani is 51 years old and married with 7 children.

Lani works hard to proviD. for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Lani has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 4 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Lani aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is divorced and cares for seven dependents. 

Ama sells fish, bowls and locally made soap at Elmina and she moves from one place to another.  Her income is used to feed, cloth and educate her children. 

The loan will help make her soap business a success.

loans.use: to obtain materials to make soap.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is 35 years old. He lives in An Ninh village with his wife and three children. His children are still small. His wife is a farmer and he is businessman. He sells clothes in the market and he has had this job for four years. He has a monthly income of about 6.000.000 Vietnamdong(VND). 

Since 2009 he has participated in SEDA. The last time he borrowed 6.944.000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycL., he would like to borrow 9.184.000 VND to buy more new clothes to resell.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Gilbel

texts.es:
Carlos, necesita incrementar su negocio, tiene ideas de comprar abono y dos terneros, el primer elemento le servirá para fortalecer los cultivos, los terneros para aumentar su ganado, los proyectos de Carlos es que a través de los préstamo pueda crecer en su actividad agropecuaria.
Los anteriores préstamos le han servido para mejorar la condición de su familia, siendo ahora más provechosas que antes.
texts.en: Carlos needs to expand his business. He plans to buy organic fertilizer and two calves.  The fertilizer will help him to improve his crops, and the calves will increase his livestock.  Through this loan, Carlos plans to grow his agricultural business.  His previous loans helped him to improve his family's living conditions, as his business is now more profitable.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and two calves

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Donaldo

texts.es: El Sr. Donaldo es cliente antiguo de la institución, pago de forma responsable sus cuotas,  tiene  45 años de vida, casado y tiene tres hijos, el solo corre con los gastos de su hogar y de la educación de sus hijos, cuenta con casa propia ubicada en la zona Norte, se dedica a la carpintería hace mas de 23 años, y desde sus 19 años cuenta con taller propio, que trabaja junto a su hijo mayor cuando su hijo se encuentra de  vacaciones y también tiene un operador que trabaja con el como ayudante, es muy conocido en la zona por la calidad del terminado de sus trabajos, el crédito es para la compra de  un motor para un maquina tupi que se quemo y también para la compra de madera el señor Donaldo esta en muy agradecido con la institución por confiar en su persona, además de la oportunidad de poder adquirir y mejorar su herramienta de trabajo.
texts.en: Donaldo is an old client of the communal bank and has made his payments on time.  He is 45 years old, married with 3 children, and has his own house located in the northern zone.  Donaldo is the sole provider for the family's household expenses and for the cost of his children' s education.   He has worked as a carpenter for more than 23 years, from the age of 19, and now has his own shop as well as an assistant.  When his oldest son has vacations he joins his father in the business.  Donaldo is very well known in the area for the quality of his work.  This loan is to purchase machinery and wood for the shop.   Donaldo is very grateful to the communal bank for their confidence in him, and for the opportunity to grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase machinery and wood for his carpentry shop.

loans.name: Candy

texts.es:
Candy,  de 27 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, así como alegre y extrovertida, en conviviente con Guillermo, vive en compañía de su pareja y su hermana de 14 años de edad, a la que apoya con su educación, instalados en su casa propia,  pero aún no tiene hijos. La actividad que realiza Candy es la confección de ropa de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, para luego venderlo entre sus amistades, familiares y conocidos, teniendo muy buena aceptación por sus buenos acabados. Comenta que este oficio lo aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, e iniciándose como independiente hace 6 años con una maquina de coser que compró con su propio capital, logrando crecer con el paso del tiempo. Ahora cuenta con la colaboración de una ayudante a la que paga por prenda confeccionada. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es realizar el oficio que le gusta, ya que le agrada mucho confeccionar nuevos diseños. Sin embargo, el cansancio físico que le ocasiona estar varias horas en una misma postura realizando los cortes y costuras le perjudica  pero a pesar de eso tiene planes de ampliar y hacer crecer su negocio, queriendo abrir un taller en su casa comprando más maquinas de costura. Este será el préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad de tener una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio, por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Además de sentirse cómoda con el grupo de su banco comunal pues los considera bunas personas.
Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, comprara una nueva maquina de coser a un valor de 600 nuevos soles, además de comprar materiales para confección de ropas, como telas e hilos.
texts.en:
Candy, age 27, is a hardworking and earnest woman who exhibits cheerfulness through her extroverted personality. She is in a common-law relationship and lives with her partner Guillermo and her 14-year-old sister, who she is supporting by providing for her education. Candy lives in her own home and she has no children. She produces clothing for women, men, and children and then sells these items to relatives, friends, and acquaintances. Her designs have received good reception because they have fine finishes. Candy says that she learned this trade by studying at a vocational center and then became independent six years ago when she purchased a sewing machine with her own capital. Her business has grown since that time. Now she works with an assistant who she pays for each garment she produces. Candy enjoys her business because she has the ability to produce new designs. However, she occasionally suffers from physical exertion as a result of cutting and sewing for several hours in the same position. Despite the pain, she has plans to expand and grow her business. Candy wants to open a workshop in her house by purchasing more sewing machines.

This will be her sixth loan with the MFP organization. She is grateful for the opportunity to have a line of credit to help advance her business. For this reason, Candy promises to complete her payments just as she did with her previous loans. In addition, she feels comfortable with her Communal Bank group because she considers the members to be good people. The amount of 3000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy a new sewing machine valued at 600 PEN, as well as sewing materials for making clothes, such as fabrics and thread.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, fabrics, and thread.

loans.name: Angelitania

texts.en:
Angelitania is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Angelitania has a shop that sells fruits such as bananas and mangoes. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fruits for resale.
Angelitania has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits for resale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 44 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and her husband is a security personnel. They have two children aged 2 and 11, who live at home with their parents.

For the past 3 years, Betty has been operating a grocery shop where she sells toothpaste, cosmetics, detergent, soap, rice and many other items. She has many customers since her business is in a very good location. Betty is requesting a loan to purchase more items for her business. She plans to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, detergent, soap, rice and many other items for her business

loans.name: Maliha

texts.en:
Maliha is a 28-year-old mother of two from the Negev region. She has just an elementary school education but strong determination and drive. Maliha wants to provide for her children and ensure a secure future. She has a business raising chicks and selling them to local customers. In this way, Maliha has been able to contribute to her family’s monthly income.
Maliha is requesting this loan to purchase additional chicks and restructure the area where she raises her chickens. She wants to continue and strengthen her business, eventually expanding so she can sell chickens to the entire area.

loans.use: to purchase additional chicks and restructure the area where she raises her chickens.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира трудолюбивая женщина. У нее прекрасный любящий муж. Детей у них нет. Для своей семьи они хотят создать все хорошие условия и для этого им приходиться много работать. Она занимается откормом скота. В этом деле ей помогает муж. Она хочет увеличить поголовье скота. В настоящее время скот на рынке немного дешевле, поэтому ей нужны средства. Она надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку. Она хочет получить займ в размере 6 800 сомони. Она думает, то её поддержат и протянут руку помощи.
texts.en: Zamira is hardworking woman. She has a wonderful loving husband but no children. Together they want to create good living conditions for their family and so both of them work very hard. Zamira raises cattle with her husband. She wants to purchase more animals for her herd since right now livestock prices are lower then usual, but she lacks the capital for it. Zamira hopes that you will be able to help her with a loan of 6800 somoni for this venture. She is grateful in advance for your helping hand.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Dado's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois nouvellement  inauguré ce 11 septembre 2013 est composé de  femmes ayant un vœu ardent d’intégrer le programme de bancs villageois. Elles entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide mutuel et vivent toutes dans le même village depuis plusieurs années. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la culture saisonnière sous pluie.

Madame DADO (assise à l’extrême droite en tunique rouge et noire), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 04 filles et 03 garçons. Elle s’active dans la vente de miel. 
  
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle s’approvisionner en galette  de miel dans les villages environnant, la presse pour recueillir le miel et la vendre.

Les bénéfices me permettent de renforcer son épargner pour obtenir durant les prochains cycles de prêts plus importants.
texts.en:
The newly-established Banc Villageois (created on 11th September 2013) is made up of women having a burning desire to join the Banc Villageois program. There is a great community spirit between them and a desire to help each other out;  they have all lived in the same village for several years and their principal activity is small-size trading and seasonal farming in the rain.

Dado (who is sitting on the far right of the photo in a red and black tunic) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and mother to seven children, four girls and three boys. She sells honey.

With this new loan she is going to get supplies of honeycomb from surrounding villages and a press for collecting the honey so she can sell it.

The profits will enable her to boost her savings so that she can get more significant loans during the following cycles.

loans.use: to get supplies of honeycomb from surrounding villages and a press for collecting the honey and selling it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy 50 chicks anf their feeds

loans.name: Silaime

texts.en:
Silaime M. has opened up his own barber shop in his hometown of Chavón. The business provides the income necessary to take care of his 2-year-old son. Silaime will use this loan to purchase materials for his barber shop including a second chair for a second barber he wishes to employ. This loan would increase productivity and the quality of his service, while providing the capacity to employ another person in Silaime’s community. He enjoys serving and talking with his customers and is talented at both. His reputation in the community and track-record with Esperanza has made him eligible for this new loan. Silaime is prepared and ready to expand his barber shop.

NOTE: As a leader in the "Sol Naciente" (Rising Sun) lending group, Silaime represents four other micro-entrepreneurs. Each one will receive an equal $150 share of this $750 loan to develop their businesses as well. They are responsible for repaying the loan together and helping one another should one person be short on a payment.

loans.use: Purchase a chair, clippers, and hire an additional employee.
